original: abodhy agniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum ivāyatīm uṣāsam
analyzed: abodhi agniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum iva āyatīm uṣāsam
translated: Agni has awakened, kindled by the people, the dawn that comes like a cow to the milking.

original: yahvā iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam acha
analyzed: yahvāḥ iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam acha
translated: Like mighty ones stretching out the morning, the bright flames spread out to the vault of heaven.

original: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvo agniḥ sumanāḥ prātar asthāt
analyzed: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvaḥ agniḥ sumanāḥ prātar asthāt
translated: The priest has awakened to worship the gods; Agni, lofty, well-disposed, has risen in the morning.

original: samiddhasya ruśad adarśi pājo mahān devas tamaso nir amoci
analyzed: samiddhasya ruśat adarśi pājaḥ mahān devaḥ tamasaḥ niḥ amoci
translated: The shining light of the kindled one has been seen; the great god has been released from the darkness.

original: yad īṃ gaṇasya raśanām ajīgaḥ śucir aṅkte śucibhir gobhir agniḥ
analyzed: yat īm gaṇasya raśanām ajīgaḥ śuciḥ aṅkte śucibhiḥ gobhiḥ agniḥ
translated: When you have seized the reins of the troop, Agni is anointed with pure things by the pure cows.

original: ād dakṣiṇā yujyate vājayanty uttānām ūrdhvo adhayaj juhūbhiḥ
analyzed: āt dakṣiṇā yujyate vājayantī uttānām ūrdhvaḥ adhayat juhūbhiḥ
translated: The sacrificial fee is yoked, eager for strength; the lofty one has offered with the ladles.

original: agnim achā devayatām manāṃsi cakṣūṃṣīva sūrye saṃ caranti
analyzed: agnim achā devayatām manāṃsi cakṣūṃṣi iva sūrye sam caranti
translated: The minds of the gods who go to Agni and the eyes as it were in the sun move together.

original: yad īṃ suvāte uṣasā virūpe śveto vājī jāyate agre ahnām🔽janiṣṭa hi jenyo agre ahnāṃ hito hiteṣv aruṣo vaneṣu
analyzed: yat īm suvāte uṣasā virūpe śvetaḥ vājī jāyate agre ahnām  janiṣṭa hi jenyaḥ agre ahnām hitaḥ hiteṣu aruṣaḥ vaneṣu
translated: When you are purified by the two dissimilar dawns, the white steed is born at the beginning of the days.🔽The worthy one has been born at the beginning of the days, the red one is set in the set ones in the woods.

original: damedame sapta ratnā dadhāno 'gnir hotā ni ṣasādā yajīyān
analyzed: damedame sapta ratnā dadhānaḥ gniḥ hotā ni sasāda ā yajīyān
translated: Placing the seven treasures in every house, Agni, the priest, has sat down, the most worthy to sacrifice.

original: agnir hotā ny asīdad yajīyān upasthe mātuḥ surabhā uloke
analyzed: agniḥ hotā ni asīdat yajīyān upasthe mātuḥ surabhau uloke
translated: Agni, the priest, has sat down, the most worthy to sacrifice, in the lap of his mother, in the fragrant, shining place.

original: yuvā kaviḥ puruniṣṭha ṛtāvā dhartā kṛṣṭīnām uta madhya iddhaḥ
analyzed: yuvā kaviḥ puru niṣṭhaḥ ṛtāvā dhartā kṛṣṭīnām uta madhye iddhaḥ
translated: The young sage, the fulfiller of many vows, the upholder of the people, kindled in the midst,

original: pra ṇu tyaṃ vipram adhvareṣu sādhum agniṃ hotāram īḷate namobhiḥ
analyzed: pra nu tyam vipram adhvareṣu sādhum agnim hotāram īḍate namobhiḥ
translated: They invoke with homage the good sage Agni, the priest at sacrifices,

original: ā yas tatāna rodasī ṛtena nityam mṛjanti vājinaṃ ghṛtena
analyzed: ā yaḥ tatāna rodasī ṛtena nityam mṛjanti vājinam ghṛtena
translated: He who has extended the two worlds with truth, they always cleanse the strong one with ghee,

original: mārjālyo mṛjyate sve damūnāḥ kavipraśasto atithiḥ śivo naḥ
analyzed: mārjālyaḥ mṛjyate sve damūnāḥ kavi praśastaḥ atithiḥ śivaḥ naḥ
translated: The one to be cleansed is cleansed in his own abode, praised by the sages, a welcome guest for us,

original: sahasraśṛṅgo vṛṣabhas tadojā viśvāṃ agne sahasā prāsy anyān
analyzed: sahasra śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tad ojāḥ viśvān agne sahasā prāsi anyān
translated: The thousand-peaked bull, of that strength, O Agni, with your might you have surpassed all others.

original: pra sadyo agne aty eṣy anyān āvir yasmai cārutamo babhūtha
analyzed: pra sadyas agne ati eṣi anyān āvis yasmai cārutamaḥ babhūtha
translated: Immediately, O Agni, you will surpass others, to whom you have become the most beautiful.

original: īḷenyo vapuṣyo vibhāvā priyo viśām atithir mānuṣīṇām
analyzed: īḍenyaḥ vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā priyaḥ viśām atithiḥ mānuṣīṇām
translated: To be desired, beautiful, shining, dear to the people, a guest to human beings,

original: tubhyam bharanti kṣitayo yaviṣṭha balim agne antita ota dūrāt
analyzed: tubhyam bharanti kṣitayaḥ yaviṣṭha balim agne antitas ā uta dūrāt
translated: To you, O youngest, the people bring tribute, O Agni, from near and far.

original: ā bhandiṣṭhasya sumatiṃ cikiddhi bṛhat te agne mahi śarma bhadram
analyzed: ā bhandiṣṭhasya sumatim cikiddhi bṛhat te agne mahi śarma bhadram
translated: Seek the favor of the most radiant one. Your protection, O Agni, is great and good.

original: ādya ratham bhānumo bhānumantam agne tiṣṭha yajatebhiḥ samantam
analyzed: ā adya ratham bhānumas bhānumantam agne tiṣṭha yajatebhiḥ samantam
translated: O radiant one, sit in the radiant chariot, O Agni, on all sides with the sacrificers.

original: vidvān pathīnām urv antarikṣam eha devān haviradyāya vakṣi
analyzed: vidvān pathīnām uru antarikṣam ā iha devān haviḥ adyāya vakṣi
translated: Knowing the paths, the vast atmosphere, bring the gods here to eat the oblation.

original: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vaco vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe
analyzed: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vacaḥ vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe
translated: We have spoken a word to the wise one, to the bull, the mighty one, to the lord of the house

original: gaviṣṭhiro namasā stomam agnau divñva rukmam uruvyañcam aśret
analyzed: gaviṣṭhiraḥ namasā stomam agnau divi vai rukmam uruvyañcam aśret
translated: Gavishthira has raised in the fire, with reverence, a hymn, a heavenly golden ornament, far-reaching

original: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ samubdhaṃ guhā bibharti na dadāti pitre
analyzed: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ samubdham guhā bibharti na dadāti pitre
translated: The young boy whom the youthful mother embraces in secret, she bears him and gives him not to the father

original: anīkam asya na minaj janāsaḥ puraḥ paśyanti nihitam aratau
analyzed: anīkam asya na minat janāsaḥ puras paśyanti nihitam aratau
translated: The people do not diminish his appearance, they see him placed in front, in the right place

original: kam etaṃ tvaṃ yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna
analyzed: kam etam tvam yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna
translated: Whom do you serve, this young boy? The grinding stone bears him, the great cow has given birth

original: pūrvīr hi garbhaḥ śarado vavardhāpaśyaṃ jātaṃ yad asūta mātā
analyzed: pūrvīḥ hi garbhaḥ śaradaḥ vavardha apaśyam jātam yat asūta mātā
translated: For the embryo has grown for many autumns, I have seen him born when his mother gave birth

original: hiraṇyadantaṃ śucivarṇam ārāt kṣetrād apaśyam āyudhā mimānam
analyzed: hiraṇya dantam śuci varṇam ārāt kṣetrāt apaśyam āyudhā mimānam
translated: I have seen from afar the golden-toothed one, the pure-colored one, measuring the weapons in the field

original: dadāno asmā amṛtaṃ vipṛkvat kim mām anindrāḥ kṛṇavann anukthāḥ
analyzed: dadānaḥ asmai amṛtam vipṛkvat kim mām an indrāḥ kṛṇavan an ukthāḥ
translated: Giving him immortality, as it were, what have the powerless ones, the chantless ones, done to me?

original: kṣetrād apaśyaṃ sanutaś carantaṃ sumad yūthaṃ na puru śobhamānam
analyzed: kṣetrāt apaśyam sanutas carantam sumat yūtham na puru śobhamānam
translated: I have seen from the field one moving in all directions, a beautiful herd, shining in many ways

original: na tā agṛbhrann ajaniṣṭa hi ṣaḥ paliknīr id yuvatayo bhavanti
analyzed: na tāḥ agṛbhran ajaniṣṭa hi saḥ paliknīḥ id yuvatayaḥ bhavanti
translated: They have not seized him, for he has been born. Even the young girls become old in their homes

original: ke me maryakaṃ vi yavanta gobhir na yeṣāṃ gopā araṇaś cid āsa
analyzed: ke me maryakam vi yavanta gobhiḥ na yeṣām gopāḥ araṇaḥ cit āsa
translated: Who among them will stretch out my marriage alliance with cattle, whose cowherds are not even in the wilderness?

original: ya īṃ jagṛbhur ava te sṛjantv ājāti paśva upa naś cikitvān
analyzed: ye īm jagṛbhuḥ ava te sṛjantu ājāti paśve upa naḥ cikitvān
translated: May they who have seized him release him for you, knowing the birth of cattle, for us.

original: vasāṃ rājānaṃ vasatiṃ janānām arātayo ni dadhur martyeṣu
analyzed: vasām rājānam vasatim janānām arātayaḥ ni dadhuḥ martyeṣu
translated: The Rātris have placed the king of wealth, the dwelling of the people, among mortals.

original: brahmāṇy atrer ava taṃ sṛjantu ninditāro nindyāso bhavantu
analyzed: brahmāṇi atreḥ ava tam sṛjantu ninditāraḥ nindyāsaḥ bhavantu
translated: May the prayers of Atri release him. Let those who blame be blamed.

original: śunaś cic chepaṃ niditaṃ sahasrād yūpād amuñco aśamiṣṭa hi ṣaḥ
analyzed: śunaḥ cit śepam niditam sahasrāt yūpāt amuñcaḥ aśamiṣṭa hi saḥ
translated: From the stake thou didst release the dog's entrails, a thousandfold, for he hath sacrificed.

original: evāsmad agne vi mumugdhi pāśān hotaś cikitva iha tū niṣadya
analyzed: eva asmat agne vi mumugdhi pāśān hotar cikitvaḥ iha tu niṣadya
translated: Even so, O Agni, release us from the bonds, O Hotar, sitting here, O thou who knowest.

original: hṛṇīyamāno apa hi mad aiyeḥ pra me devānāṃ vratapā uvāca
analyzed: hṛṇīyamānaḥ apa hi mat aiyeḥ pra me devānām vrata pāḥ uvāca
translated: Grudge not, but go away from me. The guardians of the gods have told me.

original: indro vidvāṃ anu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāham agne anuśiṣṭa āgām
analyzed: indraḥ vidvān anu hi tvā cacakṣa tena aham agne anuśiṣṭaḥ āgām
translated: Indra, the wise, hath seen thee. By him, O Agni, instructed, I have come.

original: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāty agnir āvir viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā🔽prādevīr māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣase vinikṣe
analyzed: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāti agniḥ āvis viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā  pra adevīḥ māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣase vinikṣe
translated: Agni shines with great light. He maketh all things manifest by his greatness.🔽He beareth away the godless wiles, the evil ones. He sharpeneth his horns to strike the Rākṣasa.

original: uta svānāso divi ṣantv agnes tigmāyudhā rakṣase hantavā u
analyzed: uta svānāsaḥ divi ṣantu agneḥ tigma āyudhāḥ rakṣase hantavai u
translated: And let the bright ones rejoice in Agni's light, the keen-weaponed ones, to slay the Rākṣasa.

original: made cid asya pra rujanti bhāmā na varante paribādho adevīḥ
analyzed: made cit asya pra rujanti bhāmāḥ na varante paribādhaḥ adevīḥ
translated: Even in his joy his flames are stirred. The godless ones ward not off his attack.

original: etaṃ te stomaṃ tuvijāta vipro rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam
analyzed: etam te stomam tuvi jāta vipraḥ ratham na dhīraḥ su apāḥ atakṣam
translated: This hymn, O thou of mighty birth, the sage hath fashioned for thee, like a skilful charioteer,

original: yadīd agne prati tvaṃ deva haryāḥ svarvatīr apa enā jayema
analyzed: yadi id agne prati tvam deva haryāḥ svarvatīḥ apaḥ enāḥ jayema
translated: If thou, O Agni, O god, wilt accept it, we may win the waters that lead to heaven.

original: tuvigrīvo vṛṣabho vāvṛdhāno 'śatrv aryaḥ sam ajāti vedaḥ
analyzed: tuvi grīvaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ śatru aryaḥ sam ajāti vedaḥ
translated: The mighty bull, of mighty neck, grown strong, the friend of the pious, knows his own.

original: itīmam agnim amṛtā avocan barhiṣmate manave śarma yaṃsad dhaviṣmate manave śarma yaṃsat
analyzed: iti imam agnim amṛtāḥ avocan barhiṣmate manave śarma yaṃsat haviṣmate manave śarma yaṃsat
translated: Thus have the immortal ones spoken to this Agni: may he grant shelter to the man who strews the grass, may he grant shelter to the man who offers oblations.

original: tvam agne varuṇo jāyase yat tvam mitro bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne varuṇaḥ jāyase yat tvam mitraḥ bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art born as Varuṇa, thou art Mitra when thou art kindled.

original: tve viśve sahasas putra devās tvam indro dāśuṣe martyāya
analyzed: tve viśve sahasas putra devāḥ tvam indraḥ dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: In thee, O son of strength, all the gods, thou art Indra to the mortal who offers.

original: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnāṃ nāma svadhāvan guhyam bibharṣi
analyzed: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnām nāma svadhāvan guhyam bibharṣi
translated: Thou art Aryaman when thou art the youngest, thou bearest the secret name, O self-moving one.

original: añjanti mitraṃ sudhitaṃ na gobhir yad dampatī samanasā kṛṇoṣi
analyzed: añjanti mitram sudhitam na gobhiḥ yat dampatī samanasā kṛṇoṣi
translated: They anoint Mitra, the well-disposed one, with cows, when thou, with a willing mind, makest the two spouses.

original: tava śriye maruto marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram
analyzed: tava śriye marutaḥ marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram
translated: For thy glory, O Rudra, the Maruts purify thee, O son of strength, what is thy beautiful and wonderful birth.

original: padaṃ yad viṣṇor upamaṃ nidhāyi tena pāsi guhyaṃ nāma gonām
analyzed: padam yat viṣṇoḥ upamam nidhāyi tena pāsi guhyam nāma gonām
translated: The foot of Vishnu, which is like a measure, is laid down; by it thou guardest the secret name of the cows.

original: tava śriyā sudṛśo deva devāḥ purū dadhānā amṛtaṃ sapanta
analyzed: tava śriyā sudṛśaḥ deva devāḥ purū dadhānāḥ amṛtam sapanta
translated: For thy glory, O god, the gods, O god, the well-seeing ones, placing many, desire immortality.

original: hotāram agnim manuṣo ni ṣedur daśasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ
analyzed: hotāram agnim manuṣaḥ ni ṣeduḥ daśasyantaḥ uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ
translated: Men have seated thee as Hotar, O Agni, the eager ones have honoured thee, O living one.

original: na tvad dhotā pūrvo agne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paro asti svadhāvaḥ
analyzed: na tvat hotā pūrvaḥ agne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paraḥ asti svadhāvas
translated: No priest is better than thou, O Agni, in sacrifice, none is greater than thou, O self-existent one.

original: viśaś ca yasyā atithir bhavāsi sa yajñena vanavad deva martān
analyzed: viśaḥ ca yasyāḥ atithiḥ bhavāsi sa yajñena vanavat deva martān
translated: And in whose house thou art a guest, O god, he shall prosper with sacrifice over mortal men.

original: vayam agne vanuyāma tvotā vasūyavo haviṣā budhyamānāḥ
analyzed: vayam agne vanuyāma tvotāḥ vasūyavaḥ haviṣā budhyamānāḥ
translated: We, O Agni, with thee to aid, seeking wealth, shall prosper, O son of strength, with oblation.

original: vayaṃ samarye vidatheṣv ahnāṃ vayaṃ rāyā sahasas putra martān🔽yo na āgo abhy eno bharāty adhīd agham aghaśaṃse dadhāta
analyzed: vayam samarye vidatheṣu ahnām vayam rāyā sahasas putra martān  yaḥ naḥ āgaḥ abhi enaḥ bharāti adhi id agham agha śaṃse dadhāta
translated: We in the battle, in the assemblies of the days, we with wealth, O son of strength, over mortal men.🔽He who brings us as a guest, O Agni, who bears away our treasure, who injures us,

original: jahī cikitvo abhiśastim etām agne yo no marcayati dvayena
analyzed: jahi cikitvaḥ abhiśastim etām agne yaḥ naḥ marcayati dvayena
translated: Place thou, O wise one, that curse upon the curser, O Agni, who with treachery assails us.

original: tvām asyā vyuṣi deva pūrve dūtaṃ kṛṇvānā ayajanta havyaiḥ
analyzed: tvām asyāḥ vyuṣi deva pūrve dūtam kṛṇvānāḥ ayajanta havyaiḥ
translated: Thee, O god, the ancient ones, making thee their messenger, worshipped with oblations in the dawn.

original: saṃsthe yad agna īyase rayīṇāṃ devo martair vasubhir idhyamānaḥ
analyzed: saṃsthe yat agne īyase rayīṇām devaḥ martaiḥ vasubhiḥ idhyamānaḥ
translated: When, O Agni, thou goest to the gathering of riches, O god, kindled with wealth by mortals.

original: ava spṛdhi pitaraṃ yodhi vidvān putro yas te sahasaḥ sūna ūhe
analyzed: ava spṛdhi pitaram yodhi vidvān putraḥ yaḥ te sahasaḥ sūno ūhe
translated: Approach, O wise one, fight with the father, the son who shall carry thee, O son of strength.

original: kadā cikitvo abhi cakṣase no 'gne kadām ṛtacid yātayāse
analyzed: kadā cikitvaḥ abhi cakṣase naḥ gne ṛta cit yātayāse
translated: When, O wise one, wilt thou look upon us, O Agni? When wilt thou go to the place of the righteous?

original: bhūri nāma vandamāno dadhāti pitā vaso yadi taj joṣayāse🔽kuvid devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam agnir vanate vāvṛdhānaḥ
analyzed: bhūri nāma vandamānaḥ dadhāti pitā vaso yadi tat joṣayāse  kuvid devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam agniḥ vanate vāvṛdhānaḥ
translated: The one who praises bestows abundant food, O Vasu, if you approve of that, O father.🔽Agni, rejoicing in the god's impulse, gains prosperity, growing in strength.

original: tvam aṅga jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha viśvāny agne duritāti parṣi
analyzed: tvam aṅga jaritāram yaviṣṭha viśvāni agne duritā ati parṣi
translated: You, O most youthful Agni, carry over all misfortunes the one who sings your praises.

original: stenā adṛśran ripavo janāso 'jñātaketā vṛjinā abhūvan
analyzed: stenāḥ adṛśran ripavaḥ janāsaḥ jñāta ketā vṛjināḥ abhūvan
translated: The enemies, the people, have been seen, their course unknown, the wicked have become (so).

original: ime yāmāsas tvadrig abhūvan vasave vā tad id āgo avāci
analyzed: ime yāmāsaḥ tvadrik abhūvan vasave vā tat id āgaḥ avāci
translated: These have become your servants, O powerful one, that is the truth which I have uttered.

original: nāhāyam agnir abhiśastaye no na rīṣate vāvṛdhānaḥ parā dāt
analyzed: na aha ayam agniḥ abhiśastaye naḥ na rīṣate vāvṛdhānaḥ parā dāt
translated: This Agni is not for our destruction, not for defeat, the growing one will give us away.

original: tvām agne vasupatiṃ vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan
analyzed: tvām agne vasu patim vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan
translated: O Agni, lord of treasures, I praise you, O king, at the sacrifices, for the sake of treasures.

original: tvayā vājaṃ vājayanto jayemābhi ṣyāma pṛtsutīr martyānām
analyzed: tvayā vājam vājayantaḥ jayema abhi syāma pṛtsutīḥ martyānām
translated: Through you, O Agni, striving for strength, we may win, we may conquer the battles of mortals.

original: havyavāḷ agnir ajaraḥ pitā no vibhur vibhāvā sudṛśīko asme
analyzed: havyavāṭ agniḥ ajaraḥ pitā naḥ vibhuḥ vibhāvā su dṛśīkaḥ asme
translated: Agni, the bearer of oblations, the imperishable, our father, the all-knowing one, the powerful, the radiant, the well-seen one, for us.

original: sugārhapatyāḥ sam iṣo didīhy asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi
analyzed: su gārhapatyāḥ sam iṣaḥ didīhi asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi
translated: Shine forth with easy hearths, with food, bestow upon us fame.

original: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatim mānuṣīṇāṃ śucim pāvakaṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭham agnim
analyzed: viśām kavim viśpatim mānuṣīṇām śucim pāvakam ghṛta pṛṣṭham agnim
translated: The sage of the people, the lord of human beings, the pure, the purifying one, Agni, whose back is anointed with ghee.

original: ni hotāraṃ viśvavidaṃ dadhidhve sa deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi
analyzed: ni hotāram viśva vidam dadhidhve sa deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi
translated: You have made him the all-knowing priest, he gains boons among the gods.

original: juṣasvāgna iḷayā sajoṣā yatamāno raśmibhiḥ sūryasya🔽juṣasva naḥ samidhaṃ jātaveda ā ca devān haviradyāya vakṣi
analyzed: juṣasva agne iḷayā sajoṣāḥ yatamānaḥ raśmibhiḥ sūryasya  juṣasva naḥ samidham jātavedaḥ ā ca devān haviḥ adyāya vakṣi
translated: Rejoice, O Agni, with the Iḷâ in unison, striving with the rays of the sun🔽Rejoice in our kindling-stick, O all-knower, and bring the gods to eat the oblation

original: juṣṭo damūnā atithir duroṇa imaṃ no yajñam upa yāhi vidvān
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ damūnāḥ atithiḥ duroṇe imam naḥ yajñam upa yāhi vidvān
translated: Honoured, the house-friend, guest in the house, come thou to this our sacrifice, knowing it

original: viśvā agne abhiyujo vihatyā śatrūyatām ā bharā bhojanāni
analyzed: viśvāḥ agne abhiyujaḥ vihatya ā śatrūyatām ā bhara bhojanāni
translated: Having destroyed all hostilities, O Agni, bring hither the enjoyments of the enemies

original: vadhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kṛṇvānas tanve svāyai
analyzed: vadhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kṛṇvānaḥ tanve svāyai
translated: Drive away the Dasyu with thy weapon, making life for thine own body

original: piparṣi yat sahasas putra devānt so agne pāhi nṛtama vāje asmān
analyzed: piparṣi yat sahasas putra devān saḥ agne pāhi nṛtama vāje asmān
translated: When thou supportest the gods, O son of strength, then, O Agni, best of men, protect us in this contest

original: vayaṃ te agna ukthair vidhema vayaṃ havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadraśoce
analyzed: vayam te agne ukthaiḥ vidhema vayam havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadra śoce
translated: O Agni, we will worship thee with hymns, O purifier, with oblations, O thou of fair flame

original: asme rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ sam invāsme viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi
analyzed: asme rayim viśva vāram sam inva asme viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi
translated: Impel to us wealth with all good things, bestow on us all kinds of riches

original: asmākam agne adhvaraṃ juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyam
analyzed: asmākam agne adhvaram juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyam
translated: Accept, O Agni, our sacrifice, O son of strength, the oblation, O thou who art in three places

original: vayaṃ deveṣu sukṛtaḥ syāma śarmaṇā nas trivarūthena pāhi
analyzed: vayam deveṣu su kṛtaḥ syāma śarmaṇā naḥ tri varūthena pāhi
translated: May we be among the gods the doers of good deeds. Protect us with a threefold rampart

original: viśvāni no durgahā jātavedaḥ sindhuṃ na nāvā duritāti parṣi
analyzed: viśvāni naḥ durgahā jātavedaḥ sindhum na nāvā duritā ati parṣi
translated: O all-knower, carry us over all our difficulties, as in a boat over the river

original: agne atrivan namasā gṛṇāno 'smākam bodhy avitā tanūnām
analyzed: agne atri vat namasā gṛṇānaḥ smākam bodhi avitā tanūnām
translated: Agni, like Atri, being praised with homage, be thou a protector of our bodies.

original: yas tvā hṛdā kīriṇā manyamāno 'martyam martyo johavīmi
analyzed: yaḥ tvā hṛdā kīriṇā manyamānaḥ martyam martyaḥ johavīmi
translated: The mortal who, thinking of thee with his heart and with praise, invokes thee, the immortal,

original: jātavedo yaśo asmāsu dhehi prajābhir agne amṛtatvam aśyām
analyzed: jātavedaḥ yaśaḥ asmāsu dhehi prajābhiḥ agne amṛta tvam aśyām
translated: O Jātavedas, bestow glory upon us; by offspring, O Agni, may I attain immortality.

original: yasmai tvaṃ sukṛte jātaveda ulokam agne kṛṇavaḥ syonam
analyzed: yasmai tvam su kṛte jātavedaḥ ulokam agne kṛṇavaḥ syonam
translated: To him, O Jātavedas, to whom thou, O Agni, makest a pleasant abode, O good worker,

original: aśvinaṃ sa putṛṇaṃ vīravantaṃ gomantaṃ rayiṃ naśate svasti
analyzed: aśvinam sa putṛṇam vīravantam gomantam rayim naśate svasti
translated: He obtains wealth with sons, with horses, with heroes, with cattle, with welfare.

original: susamiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtaṃ tīvraṃ juhotana
analyzed: su samiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtam tīvram juhotana
translated: To the well-kindled one, to the radiant one, offer the fierce ghee

original: agnaye jātavedase
analyzed: agnaye jātavedase
translated: to Agni, to Jātavedas.

original: narāśaṃsaḥ suṣūdatīmaṃ yajñam adābhyaḥ
analyzed: narāśaṃsaḥ suṣūdati imam yajñam adābhyaḥ
translated: May Narāśaṁsa, the infallible one, purify this sacrifice for us,

original: kavir hi madhuhastyaḥ
analyzed: kaviḥ hi madhu hastyaḥ
translated: for the sage has honey in his hand.

original: īḷito agna ā vahendraṃ citram iha priyam
analyzed: īḍitaḥ agne ā vaha indram citram iha priyam
translated: O Agni, being invoked, bring Indra, the wondrous one, here, the dear one,

original: sukhai rathebhir ūtaye
analyzed: sukhaiḥ rathebhiḥ ūtaye
translated: with easy chariots, for help.

original: ūrṇamradā vi prathasvābhy arkā anūṣata
analyzed: ūrṇamradāḥ vi prathasva abhi arkāḥ anūṣata
translated: O you who are clothed in wool, spread out; the bright ones have sung praises.

original: bhavā naḥ śubhra sātaye
analyzed: bhavā naḥ śubhra sātaye
translated: Be thou bright for us for gain.

original: devīr dvāro vi śrayadhvaṃ suprāyaṇā na ūtaye
analyzed: devīḥ dvāraḥ vi śrayadhvam su prāyaṇāḥ naḥ ūtaye
translated: O divine doors, open yourselves easily for our help.

original: prapra yajñam pṛṇītana
analyzed: pra pra yajñam pṛṇītana
translated: Fill the sacrifice.

original: supratīke vayovṛdhā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
analyzed: su pratīke vayaḥ vṛdhā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
translated: O you of fair appearance, increasing the life, the young mothers of truth,

original: doṣām uṣāsam īmahe
analyzed: doṣām uṣāsam īmahe
translated: we implore the evening and the dawn.

original: vātasya patmann īḷitā daivyā hotārā manuṣaḥ
analyzed: vātasya patman īḍitā daivyā hotārā manuṣaḥ
translated: On the path of the wind, invoked are the divine Hotrs and the human

original: imaṃ no yajñam ā gatam
analyzed: imam naḥ yajñam ā gatam
translated: Come to this our sacrifice.

original: iḷā sarasvatī mahī tisro devīr mayobhuvaḥ
analyzed: iḷā sarasvatī mahī tisraḥ devīḥ mayobhuvaḥ
translated: The three goddesses, Iḷā, Sarasvatī, and Mahī, who bring bliss,

original: barhiḥ sīdantv asridhaḥ
analyzed: barhiḥ sīdantu asridhaḥ
translated: Sit on the grass, free from impurity.

original: śivas tvaṣṭar ihā gahi vibhuḥ poṣa uta tmanā
analyzed: śivaḥ tvaṣṭar iha ā gahi vibhuḥ poṣaḥ uta tmanā
translated: O Tvaṣṭar, come here, auspicious, all-pervading, nourishing by your own nature,

original: yajñeyajñe na ud ava
analyzed: yajñeyajñe naḥ ud ava
translated: In every sacrifice, rise up.

original: yatra vettha vanaspate devānāṃ guhyā nāmāni
analyzed: yatra vettha vanaspate devānām guhyā nāmāni
translated: Where, O tree, you know the secret names of the gods,

original: tatra havyāni gāmaya
analyzed: tatra havyāni gāmaya
translated: There lead our offerings.

original: svāhāgnaye varuṇāya svāhendrāya marudbhyaḥ svāhā devebhyo haviḥ /
analyzed: svāhā agnaye varuṇāya svāhā indrāya marudbhyaḥ svāhā devebhyaḥ haviḥ
translated: Svāhā to Agni, to Varuṇa, svāhā to Indra, to the Maruts, svāhā to the gods, the oblation.

original: agniṃ tam manye yo vasur astaṃ yaṃ yanti dhenavaḥ🔽astam arvanta āśavo 'staṃ nityāso vājina iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: agnim tam manye yaḥ vasuḥ astam yam yanti dhenavaḥ  astam arvantaḥ āśavaḥ stam nityāsaḥ vājinaḥ iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: I think of that Agni who is the good one, to whom the cows go,🔽To whom the swift horses go, to whom the well-born strong ones go, bring food to the praisers.

original: so agnir yo vasur gṛṇe saṃ yam āyanti dhenavaḥ🔽sam arvanto raghudruvaḥ saṃ sujātāsaḥ sūraya iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: saḥ agniḥ yaḥ vasuḥ gṛṇe sam yam āyanti dhenavaḥ  sam arvantaḥ raghudruvaḥ sam su jātāsaḥ sūrayaḥ iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: That Agni whom the good one sings, to whom the cows come together,🔽To whom the swift horses come together, to whom the well-born nobles come together, bring food to the praisers.

original: agnir hi vājinaṃ viśe dadāti viśvacarṣaṇiḥ
analyzed: agniḥ hi vājinam viśe dadāti viśvacarṣaṇiḥ
translated: For Agni, the all-powerful one, gives the strong one to the people.

original: agnī rāye svābhuvaṃ sa prīto yāti vāryam iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: agniḥ rāye su ābhuvam sa prītaḥ yāti vāryam iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: Agni, well-disposed, goes to the good, to the excellent. Bring food to the praisers.

original: ā te agna idhīmahi dyumantaṃ devājaram
analyzed: ā te agne idhīmahi dyumantam deva ajaram
translated: We kindle thee, O Agni, the radiant, undecaying god,

original: yad dha syā te panīyasī samid dīdayati dyavīṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: yat ha syā te panīyasī samidh dīdayati dyavi iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: That which is thy most excellent kindling, O Agni, shines for thy strength; bring food to the praisers.

original: ā te agna ṛcā haviḥ śukrasya śociṣas pate
analyzed: ā te agne ṛcā haviḥ śukrasya śociṣaḥ pate
translated: With the Rc, O Agni, the oblation to thee, O lord of the bright flame,

original: suścandra dasma viśpate havyavāṭ tubhyaṃ hūyata iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: su ścandra dasma viśpate havyavāṭ tubhyam hūyate iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: O very pleasant one, O lord of the people, the oblation-bearer is offered to thee; bring food to the praisers.

original: pro tye agnayo 'gniṣu viśvam puṣyanti vāryam
analyzed: pra u tye agnayaḥ gniṣu viśvam puṣyanti vāryam
translated: Those fires, O Agni, in the fires, cherish all that is good.

original: te hinvire ta invire ta iṣaṇyanty ānuṣag iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: te hinvire te invire te iṣaṇyanti ānuṣak iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: They impel, they send forth, they strive after one another; bring food to the praisers.

original: tava tye agne arcayo mahi vrādhanta vājinaḥ
analyzed: tava tye agne arcayaḥ mahi vrādhanta vājinaḥ
translated: Those strong flames of thine, O Agni, increase their great strength,

original: ye patvabhiḥ śaphānāṃ vrajā bhuranta gonām iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: ye patvabhiḥ śaphānām vrajāḥ bhuranta gonām iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: Which, with the paths of the hooves, hasten to the stalls of the cattle; bring food to the praisers.

original: navā no agna ā bhara stotṛbhyaḥ sukṣitīr iṣaḥ
analyzed: navāḥ naḥ agne ā bhara stotṛbhyaḥ su kṣitīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: Bring us new riches, O Agni, to the praisers, O thou of good abodes,

original: te syāma ya ānṛcus tvādūtāso damedama iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: te syāma ye ānṛcuḥ tvādūtāsaḥ damedame iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: May we be they, O thou who hast been chosen, with our own thoughts, in this house; bring food to the praisers.

original: ubhe suścandra sarpiṣo darvī śrīṇīṣa āsani
analyzed: ubhe su ścandra sarpiṣaḥ darvī śrīṇīṣe āsani
translated: O Agni, thou of very bright rays, fill both thy ladles with ghee,

original: uto na ut pupūryā uktheṣu śavasas pata iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: uta u naḥ ud pupūryāḥ uktheṣu śavasaḥ pate iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: And do thou also fill us in the praises, O lord of strength; bring food to the praisers.

original: evāṃ agnim ajuryamur gīrbhir yajñebhir ānuṣak
analyzed: eva ām agnim gīrbhiḥ yajñebhiḥ ānuṣak
translated: Thus have they made Agni undecaying with songs and sacrifices, one after another,

original: dadhad asme suvīryam uta tyad āśvaśvyam iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
analyzed: dadhat asme su vīryam uta tyad āśu aśvyam iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: Granting us good strength, and that which is most excellent in horses, bring food to the praisers.

original: sakhāyaḥ saṃ vaḥ samyañcam iṣaṃ stomaṃ cāgnaye🔽varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjo naptre sahasvate
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ sam vaḥ samyañcam iṣam stomam ca agnaye  varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjaḥ naptre sahasvate
translated: O friends, unite your food and praise for Agni,🔽For the most powerful of the people, the grandson of strength, the mighty one.

original: kutrā cid yasya samṛtau raṇvā naro nṛṣadane🔽arhantaś cid yam indhate saṃjanayanti jantavaḥ
analyzed: kutra cit yasya samṛtau raṇvāḥ naraḥ nṛṣadane  arhantaḥ cit yam indhate saṃjanayanti jantavaḥ
translated: Nowhere is he whose company is delightful, like men in the assembly of men,🔽Whom even the worthy ones enkindle, the creatures generate.

original: saṃ yad iṣo vanāmahe saṃ havyā mānuṣāṇām
analyzed: sam yat iṣaḥ vanāmahe sam havyā mānuṣāṇām
translated: When we unite for food, and for the offerings of men,

original: uta dyumnasya śavasa ṛtasya raśmim ā dade
analyzed: uta dyumnasya śavasaḥ ṛtasya raśmim ā dade
translated: And for the ray of the glory of truth, I have taken it.

original: sa smā kṛṇoti ketum ā naktaṃ cid dūra ā sate🔽pāvako yad vanaspatīn pra smā mināty ajaraḥ🔽ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati
analyzed: sa smā kṛṇoti ketum ā naktam cit dūre ā sate  pāvakaḥ yat vanaspatīn pra smā mināti ajaraḥ  ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati
translated: He makes a sign, even in the night, for the one who is far away.🔽When the pure one, the undecaying one, passes over the trees,🔽On whose path they offer sweat in the search.

original: abhīm aha svajenyam bhūmā pṛṣṭheva ruruhuḥ
analyzed: abhi īm aha sva jenyam bhūmā pṛṣṭhā iva ruruhuḥ
translated: They have mounted the one to be embraced, the bountiful one, on the back of the earth.

original: yam martyaḥ puruspṛhaṃ vidad viśvasya dhāyase
analyzed: yam martyaḥ puruspṛham vidat viśvasya dhāyase
translated: The mortal who knows him, the one desired by many, for the support of all,

original: pra svādanam pitūnām astatātiṃ cid āyave
analyzed: pra svādanam pitūnām astatātim cit āyave
translated: The enjoyment of the fathers, even the one who has made an agreement with Ayus.

original: sa hi ṣmā dhanvākṣitaṃ dātā na dāty ā paśuḥ
analyzed: sa hi sma dhanva akṣitam dātā na dāti ā paśuḥ
translated: For he, indeed, gives the one with far-reaching eyes, the giver, the animal.

original: hiriśmaśruḥ śucidann ṛbhur anibhṛṣṭataviṣiḥ
analyzed: hiri śmaśruḥ śucidan ṛbhuḥ a nibhṛṣṭa taviṣiḥ
translated: The one with a beard of splendor, with pure teeth, Rbhukṣan, with unimpaired power,

original: śuciḥ ṣmā yasmā atrivat pra svadhitīva rīyate
analyzed: śuciḥ ṣmā yasmai atri vat pra svadhitī iva rīyate
translated: He is pure, he is to be worshipped, like Atri, he is to be served like a sharp axe.

original: suṣūr asūta mātā krāṇā yad ānaśe bhagam
analyzed: suṣūḥ asūta mātā krāṇā yat ānaśe bhagam
translated: The mother, the creator, has given birth to the one who has received good fortune.

original: ā yas te sarpirāsute 'gne śam asti dhāyase
analyzed: ā yaḥ te sarpiḥ āsute gne śam asti dhāyase
translated: O Agni, for him who has offered you clarified butter, there is well-being for his support.

original: aiṣu dyumnam uta śrava ā cittam martyeṣu dhāḥ
analyzed: ā eṣu dyumnam uta śravaḥ ā cittam martyeṣu dhāḥ
translated: Place in these (men) glory and fame and thought.

original: iti cin manyum adhrijas tvādātam ā paśuṃ dade
analyzed: iti cit manyum adhrijaḥ tvādātam ā paśum dade
translated: Thus, O irresistible one, I have taken away your wrath and given you a beast.

original: ād agne apṛṇato 'triḥ sāsahyād dasyūn iṣaḥ sāsahyān nṝn
analyzed: āt agne apṛṇataḥ tris sāsahyāt dasyūn iṣaḥ sāsahyāt nṝn
translated: O Agni, Atri has overcome the Pṛṇatas here, the Dasyus, the Pṛṇatas, the men.

original: tvām agna ṛtāyavaḥ sam īdhire pratnam pratnāsa ūtaye sahaskṛta
analyzed: tvām agne ṛtāyavaḥ sam īdhire pratnam pratnāsaḥ ūtaye sahaskṛta
translated: O Agni, the ancient ones, the ancient ones, have kindled you for the sake of truth, for the sake of help, O performer of a hundred (good) deeds.

original: puruścandraṃ yajataṃ viśvadhāyasaṃ damūnasaṃ gṛhapatiṃ vareṇyam
analyzed: puru ścandram yajatam viśva dhāyasam damūnasam gṛhapatim vareṇyam
translated: You are the one with many lights, to be worshipped, the supporter of all, the lord of the house, the desirable one.

original: tvām agne atithim pūrvyaṃ viśaḥ śociṣkeśaṃ gṛhapatiṃ ni ṣedire
analyzed: tvām agne atithim pūrvyam viśaḥ śociṣkeśam gṛhapatim ni sedire
translated: O Agni, the ancient tribes have seated you as their guest, the lord of the house with hair of light.

original: bṛhatketum pururūpaṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ suśarmāṇaṃ svavasaṃ jaradviṣam🔽tvām agne mānuṣīr īḷate viśo hotrāvidaṃ viviciṃ ratnadhātamam
analyzed: bṛhat ketum puru rūpam dhana spṛtam su śarmāṇam su avasam jaradviṣam  tvām agne mānuṣīḥ īḍate viśaḥ hotrā vidam vivicim ratna dhātamam
translated: The one with a great banner, of many forms, the one who wins wealth, the one with good protection, the self-ruling one, the one who conquers old age.🔽O Agni, the human tribes invoke you, the one who knows the sacrificial formulas, the discerning one, the one who bestows treasures.

original: guhā santaṃ subhaga viśvadarśataṃ tuviṣvaṇasaṃ suyajaṃ ghṛtaśriyam
analyzed: guhā santam subhaga viśva darśatam tuviṣvaṇasam suyajam ghṛta śriyam
translated: You, O fortunate one, who are in the secret place, who are visible to all, who have great power, who are well worshipped, who have ghee as your glory.

original: tvām agne dharṇasiṃ viśvadhā vayaṃ gīrbhir gṛṇanto namasopa sedima
analyzed: tvām agne dharṇasim viśvadhā vayam gīrbhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ namasā upa sedima
translated: We, O Agni, with our songs, singing to thee, the supporter in every way, have approached thee with homage.

original: sa no juṣasva samidhāno aṅgiro devo martasya yaśasā sudītibhiḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ juṣasva samidhānaḥ aṅgiraḥ devaḥ martasya yaśasā su dītibhiḥ
translated: Be pleased with us, O Angiras, when kindled, O god, with the glory of mortals, with thy fair lights.

original: tvam agne pururūpo viśeviśe vayo dadhāsi pratnathā puruṣṭuta
analyzed: tvam agne puru rūpaḥ viśeviśe vayaḥ dadhāsi pratnathā puruṣṭuta
translated: O Agni, of many forms, in every house, thou placest life, as of old, O much-invoked one.

original: purūṇy annā sahasā vi rājasi tviṣiḥ sā te titviṣāṇasya nādhṛṣe
analyzed: purūṇi annā sahasā vi rājasi tviṣiḥ sā te titviṣāṇasya na ādhṛṣe
translated: Thou shinest with many foods by thy might. The radiance of thee who shinest is not to be overcome.

original: tvām agne samidhānaṃ yaviṣṭhya devā dūtaṃ cakrire havyavāhanam
analyzed: tvām agne samidhānam yaviṣṭhya devāḥ dūtam cakrire havya vāhanam
translated: O Agni, the gods have made thee, when kindled, O youngest one, their messenger, the bearer of oblations.

original: urujrayasaṃ ghṛtayonim āhutaṃ tveṣaṃ cakṣur dadhire codayanmati
analyzed: uru jrayasam ghṛta yonim āhutam tveṣam cakṣuḥ dadhire codayat mati
translated: They have made thee, the far-reaching one, whose womb is ghee, the invoked one, the radiant one, their eye, urging their thought.

original: tvām agne pradiva āhutaṃ ghṛtaiḥ sumnāyavaḥ suṣamidhā sam īdhire
analyzed: tvām agne pradivaḥ āhutam ghṛtaiḥ sumnāyavaḥ su samidhā sam īdhire
translated: O Agni, those who long for bliss have kindled thee, when offered, with ghee, with good fuel, in the morning.

original: sa vāvṛdhāna oṣadhībhir ukṣito 'bhi jrayāṃsi pārthivā vi tiṣṭhase
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhānaḥ oṣadhībhiḥ ukṣitaḥ bhi jrayāṃsi pārthivā vi tiṣṭhase
translated: Thou, having grown, sprinkled with plants, dost spread out the earthly rays.

original: tvām agne haviṣmanto devam martāsa īḷate
analyzed: tvām agne haviṣmantaḥ devam martāsaḥ īḍate
translated: O Agni, mortal men who offer oblations worship thee, O god.

original: manye tvā jātavedasaṃ sa havyā vakṣy ānuṣak
analyzed: manye tvā jātavedasam sa havyā vakṣi ānuṣak
translated: I think of thee as Jātavedas. Thou shalt carry the oblations in due course.

original: agnir hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: Agni is the priest of the generous one, of the one with strewn grass.

original: saṃ yajñāsaś caranti yaṃ saṃ vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ
analyzed: sam yajñāsaḥ caranti yam sam vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ
translated: To him the sacrifices and the prizes, the glories, come together.

original: uta sma yaṃ śiśuṃ yathā navaṃ janiṣṭāraṇī
analyzed: uta sma yam śiśum yathā navam janiṣṭa araṇī
translated: And him whom they have generated as a child, as a new-born one, the two Arāṇīs,

original: dhartāram mānuṣīṇāṃ viśām agniṃ svadhvaram
analyzed: dhartāram mānuṣīṇām viśām agnim su adhvaram
translated: The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the well-adoring one.

original: uta sma durgṛbhīyase putro na hvāryāṇām
analyzed: uta sma durgṛbhīyase putraḥ na hvāryāṇām
translated: And him who is to be worshipped, like a son of the Hvārya people,

original: purū yo dagdhāsi vanāgne paśur na yavase
analyzed: purū yaḥ dagdhā asi vanā agne paśuḥ na yavase
translated: O Agni, who burns many woods, like an animal in a pasture.

original: adha sma yasyārcayaḥ samyak saṃyanti dhūminaḥ
analyzed: adha sma yasya arcayaḥ samyak saṃyanti dhūminaḥ
translated: And of him whose flames

original: yad īm aha trito divy upa dhmāteva dhamati śiśīte dhmātarī yathā
analyzed: yat īm aha tritaḥ divi upa dhmātā iva dhamati śiśīte dhmātari yathā
translated: When Trita blows him in the sky, as if on a bellows, he blows, he sharpens, as on a whetstone.

original: tavāham agna ūtibhir mitrasya ca praśastibhiḥ
analyzed: tava aham agne ūtibhiḥ mitrasya ca praśastibhiḥ
translated: By thy help, O Agni, and by the praise of Mitra,

original: dveṣoyuto na duritā turyāma martyānām
analyzed: dveṣoyutaḥ na duritā turyāma martyānām
translated: May we overcome the enmity and wickedness of mortals.

original: taṃ no agne abhī naro rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara
analyzed: tam naḥ agne abhi naraḥ rayim sahasvas ā bhara
translated: Bring us that wealth, O Agni, O hero, bring it quickly,

original: sa kṣepayat sa poṣayad bhuvad vājasya sātaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
analyzed: sa kṣepayat sa poṣayat bhuvat vājasya sātaye uta edhi pṛtsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: He who shall give, he who shall nourish, he shall be the winner of strength. Be thou ready for our battles.

original: agna ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigo
analyzed: agne ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigo
translated: O Agni, bring us the most powerful glory, O thou who goest straight forward.

original: pra no rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām
analyzed: pra naḥ rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām
translated: Find for us the way to wealth, to the gaining of strength.

original: tvaṃ no agne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṃhanā
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṃhanā
translated: Thou, O wondrous Agni, by the greatness of wisdom and power of Dakṣa,

original: tve asuryam āruhat krāṇā mitro na yajñiyaḥ
analyzed: tve asuryam āruhat krāṇā mitraḥ na yajñiyaḥ
translated: In thee the divine power has mounted, as Mitra who is to be worshipped by sacrifice.

original: tvaṃ no agna eṣāṃ gayam puṣṭiṃ ca vardhaya
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne eṣām gayam puṣṭim ca vardhaya
translated: Do thou, O Agni, increase for us the prosperity and growth of these (people).

original: ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayo naro maghāny ānaśuḥ
analyzed: ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayaḥ naraḥ maghāni ānaśuḥ
translated: Those who, with their hymns, have won great riches, the heroes who have gained glory with their lauds,

original: ye agne candra te giraḥ śumbhanty aśvarādhasaḥ🔽śuṣmebhiḥ śuṣmiṇo naro divaś cid yeṣām bṛhat sukīrtir bodhati tmanā
analyzed: ye agne candra te giraḥ śumbhanti aśva rādhasaḥ  śuṣmebhiḥ śuṣmiṇaḥ naraḥ divaḥ cit yeṣām bṛhat su kīrtiḥ bodhati tmanā
translated: Those who, O Agni, with their songs, O bright one, adorn you, seeking horses as their prize,🔽The mighty men with their mighty powers, whose great fame, O Agni, is awakened by itself, even from heaven,

original: tava tye agne arcayo bhrājanto yanti dhṛṣṇuyā
analyzed: tava tye agne arcayaḥ bhrājantaḥ yanti dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: These flames of yours, O Agni, shining, move forth in their strength,

original: parijmāno na vidyutaḥ svāno ratho na vājayuḥ🔽nū no agna ūtaye sabādhasaś ca rātaye
analyzed: parijmānaḥ na vidyutaḥ svānaḥ rathaḥ na vājayuḥ  nu naḥ agne ūtaye sabādhasaḥ ca rātaye
translated: Circling like lightning, roaring, a chariot like a racer,🔽Now, O Agni, for our help, and for our support, and for our gifts,

original: asmākāsaś ca sūrayo viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi
analyzed: asmākāsaḥ ca sūrayaḥ viśvāḥ āśāḥ tarīṣaṇi
translated: And our own heroes, may you, O Agni, overcome all the quarters,

original: tvaṃ no agne aṅgira stuta stavāna ā bhara
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne aṅgira stuta stavāna ā bhara
translated: You, O Agni, O Angiras, being praised, bring us praiseworthy wealth,

original: hotar vibhvāsahaṃ rayiṃ stotṛbhya stavase ca na utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
analyzed: hotar vibhvāsaham rayim stotṛbhya stavase ca naḥ uta edhi pṛtsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: O Hotar, all-conquering wealth to the praisers and to the chanter, and be with us in our battles for growth.

original: janasya gopā ajaniṣṭa jāgṛvir agniḥ sudakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase
analyzed: janasya gopāḥ ajaniṣṭa jāgṛviḥ agniḥ su dakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase
translated: The watchful guardian of the people, Agni, the very skilful one, was born for a new prosperity.

original: ghṛtapratīko bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumad vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkaḥ bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumat vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ
translated: The one whose face is turned towards the ghee, the lofty one touching the sky, shines brightly for the Bharatas, pure.

original: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam agniṃ naras triṣadhasthe sam īdhire
analyzed: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam agnim naraḥ triṣadhasthe sam īdhire
translated: The men have kindled Agni, the banner of the sacrifice, the first priest, in the threefold abode,

original: indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ sa barhiṣi sīdan ni hotā yajathāya sukratuḥ
analyzed: indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham sa barhiṣi sīdat ni hotā yajathāya su kratuḥ
translated: With Indra and the gods he sits on the strew, the priest, the wise one, to be worshipped.

original: asammṛṣṭo jāyase mātroḥ śucir mandraḥ kavir ud atiṣṭho vivasvataḥ🔽ghṛtena tvāvardhayann agna āhuta dhūmas te ketur abhavad divi śritaḥ
analyzed: a sammṛṣṭaḥ jāyase mātroḥ śuciḥ mandraḥ kaviḥ ud atiṣṭhaḥ vivasvataḥ  ghṛtena tvā avardhayan agne āhuta dhūmaḥ te ketuḥ abhavat divi śritaḥ
translated: Unanointed, thou art born from thy parents, pure, delightful, a sage, thou hast stood forth from Vivasvan.🔽With ghee they have increased thee, O Agni, O worshipped one; thy smoke hath become a banner, resting in the sky.

original: agnir no yajñam upa vetu sādhuyāgniṃ naro vi bharante gṛhegṛhe
analyzed: agniḥ naḥ yajñam upa vetu sādhuyā agnim naraḥ vi bharante gṛhe gṛhe
translated: May Agni come to our sacrifice with ease; men carry Agni in every house.

original: agnir dūto abhavad dhavyavāhano 'gniṃ vṛṇānā vṛṇate kavikratum
analyzed: agniḥ dūtaḥ abhavat havya vāhanaḥ gnim vṛṇānāḥ vṛṇate kavi kratum
translated: Agni hath become the messenger, the bearer of oblations; they choose Agni, of wise power, when they choose.

original: tubhyedam agne madhumattamaṃ vacas tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śaṃ hṛde
analyzed: tubhya idam agne madhumattamam vacaḥ tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śam hṛde
translated: To thee, O Agni, this speech most rich in honey; to thee this thought of ours be for prosperity.

original: tvāṃ giraḥ sindhum ivāvanīr mahīr ā pṛṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca
analyzed: tvām giraḥ sindhum iva avanīḥ mahīḥ ā pṛṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca
translated: The great songs fill thee, as the rivers the ocean, O Agni; they increase thee with their might.

original: tvām agne aṅgiraso guhā hitam anv avindañ chiśriyāṇaṃ vane vane
analyzed: tvām agne aṅgirasaḥ guhā hitam anu avindam śiśriyāṇam vane vane
translated: The Angirases found thee, O Agni, hidden, lying in every wood, in every place.

original: sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ saho mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasas putram aṅgiraḥ
analyzed: sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ sahaḥ mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasaḥ putram aṅgiraḥ
translated: Thou art born, when rubbed, with great strength; they call thee, O Angiras, the son of strength.

original: prāgnaye bṛhate yajñiyāya ṛtasya vṛṣṇe asurāya manma
analyzed: pra agnaye bṛhate yajñiyāya ṛtasya vṛṣṇe asurāya manma
translated: To Agni the great, worthy of sacrifice, to the strong one of truth, to the Asura, my thought,

original: ghṛtaṃ na yajña āsyQ supūtaṃ giram bhare vṛṣabhāya pratīcīm
analyzed: ghṛtam na yajñe āsyam su pūtam giram bhare vṛṣabhāya pratīcīm
translated: Like ghee purified in the mouth of the sacrifice, I bear a song to the bull, to the west.

original: ṛtaṃ cikitva ṛtam ic cikiddhy ṛtasya dhārā anu tṛndhi pūrvīḥ
analyzed: ṛtam cikitvaḥ ṛtam id cikiddhi ṛtasya dhārāḥ anu tṛndhi pūrvīḥ
translated: Knowing the truth, I seek the truth; extend the many streams of truth.

original: nāhaṃ yātuṃ sahasā na dvayena ṛtaṃ sapāmy aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ
analyzed: na aham yātum sahasā na dvayena ṛtam sapāmi aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ
translated: I do not serve the truth of the tawny bull by violence or deceit.

original: kayā no agna ṛtayann ṛtena bhuvo navedā ucathasya navyaḥ
analyzed: kayā naḥ agne ṛtayan ṛtena bhuvaḥ navedāḥ ucathasya navyaḥ
translated: By what truth, O Agni, the truthful one, are you the knower of the new hymn, the new one?

original: vedā me deva ṛtupā ṛtūnāṃ nāham patiṃ sanitur asya rāyaḥ🔽ke te agne ripave bandhanāsaḥ ke pāyavaḥ saniṣanta dyumantaḥ
analyzed: vedā me devaḥ ṛtu pāḥ ṛtūnām na aham patim sanituḥ asya rāyaḥ  ke te agne ripave bandhanāsaḥ ke pāyavaḥ saniṣanta dyumantaḥ
translated: O god, I know the seasons of the seasons; I am not the lord of this man's wealth.🔽O Agni, who are your bonds for the enemy? Who are your powerful companions?

original: ke dhāsim agne anṛtasya pānti ka āsato vacasaḥ santi gopāḥ
analyzed: ke dhāsim agne anṛtasya pānti ke āsataḥ vacasaḥ santi gopāḥ
translated: Who protect the path of falsehood, O Agni? Who are the guardians of the deceitful word?

original: sakhāyas te viṣuṇā agna ete śivāsaḥ santo aśivā abhūvan
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ te viṣuṇāḥ agne ete śivāsaḥ santaḥ aśivāḥ abhūvan
translated: These, O Agni, are your spiteful friends; being auspicious, they have become inauspicious.

original: adhūrṣata svayam ete vacobhir ṛjūyate vṛjināni bruvantaḥ
analyzed: adhūrṣata svayam ete vacobhiḥ ṛjūyate vṛjināni bruvantaḥ
translated: These have themselves been stirred by words, speaking crookedly to the straight one.

original: yas te agne namasā yajñam īṭṭa ṛtaṃ sa pāty aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ te agne namasā yajñam īṭṭe ṛtam sa pāti aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ
translated: He who invites the sacrifice to you, O Agni, with homage, he guards the truth of the tawny bull.

original: tasya kṣayaḥ pṛthur ā sādhur etu prasarsrāṇasya nahuṣasya śeṣaḥ
analyzed: tasya kṣayaḥ pṛthuḥ ā sādhuḥ etu prasarsrāṇasya nahuṣasya śeṣaḥ
translated: Let his wide and good abode come forth, the remnant of the extended serpent.

original: arcantas tvā havāmahe 'rcantaḥ sam idhīmahi
analyzed: arcantaḥ tvā havāmahe rcantaḥ sam idhīmahi
translated: We call you, we invoke you, O Agni, with homage, we kindle you with homage.

original: agne arcanta ūtaye
analyzed: agne arcantaḥ ūtaye
translated: O Agni, we praise you for help

original: agne stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ
analyzed: agne stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ
translated: We conceive the successful praise today, O Agni, you who touch the sky,

original: devasya draviṇasyavaḥ
analyzed: devasya draviṇasyavaḥ
translated: We who are devoted to the wealth of the god.

original: agnir juṣata no giro hotā yo mānuṣeṣv ā
analyzed: agniḥ juṣata naḥ giraḥ hotā yaḥ mānuṣeṣu ā
translated: May Agni accept our songs, the priest who is among mankind,

original: sa yakṣad daivyaṃ janam
analyzed: sa yakṣat daivyam janam
translated: He who shall serve the divine people.

original: tvam agne saprathā asi juṣṭo hotā vareṇyaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne saprathāḥ asi juṣṭaḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the spreader, the acceptable priest, the excellent one,

original: tvayā yajñaṃ vi tanvate
analyzed: tvayā yajñam vi tanvate
translated: By whom they spread out the sacrifice.

original: tvām agne vājasātamaṃ viprā vardhanti suṣṭutam
analyzed: tvām agne vāja sātamam viprāḥ vardhanti suṣṭutam
translated: You, O Agni, most victorious, the sages praise well,

original: sa no rāsva suvīryam
analyzed: sa naḥ rāsva su vīryam
translated: Grant us good strength.

original: agne nemir arāṃ iva devāṃs tvam paribhūr asi
analyzed: agne nemiḥ arām iva devān tvam paribhūḥ asi
translated: O Agni, you are the rim like the spokes, you are the overlord of the gods,

original: ā rādhaś citram ṛñjase
analyzed: ā rādhaḥ citram ṛñjase
translated: You seek the wondrous support.

original: agniṃ stomena bodhaya samidhāno amartyam
analyzed: agnim stomena bodhaya samidhānaḥ amartyam
translated: Awaken Agni with the praise, kindled, the immortal one,

original: havyā deveṣu no dadhat
analyzed: havyā deveṣu naḥ dadhat
translated: Who shall place our offerings among the gods.

original: tam adhvareṣv īḷate devam martā amartyam
analyzed: tam adhvareṣu īḍate devam martāḥ amartyam
translated: The mortals invoke that god at sacrifices, the immortal one,

original: yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane
analyzed: yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane
translated: The best sacrificer among the human people.

original: taṃ hi śaśvanta īḷate srucā devaṃ ghṛtaścutā
analyzed: tam hi śaśvantaḥ īḍate srucā devam ghṛtaścutā
translated: For him all people invoke with ladles, the god with drops of ghee,

original: agniṃ havyāya voḷhave
analyzed: agnim havyāya voḷhave
translated: Agni, to carry the oblation.

original: agnir jāto arocata ghnan dasyūñ jyotiṣā tamaḥ🔽avindad gā apaḥ svaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ jātaḥ arocata ghnan dasyūm jyotiṣā tamaḥ  avindat gāḥ apaḥ svar
translated: Agni, being born, shone forth, slaying the Dasyus with his light,🔽He found the cows, the waters, and the heaven.

original: agnim īḷenyaṃ kaviṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṃ saparyata
analyzed: agnim īḍenyam kavim ghṛta pṛṣṭham saparyata
translated: Worship the wise Agni, whose back is anointed with ghee,

original: vetu me śṛṇavad dhavam
analyzed: vetu me śṛṇavat dhavam
translated: May he come and hear my call.

original: agniṃ ghṛtena vāvṛdhu stomebhir viśvacarṣaṇim
analyzed: agnim ghṛtena vāvṛdhuḥ stomebhiḥ viśvacarṣaṇim
translated: They have strengthened Agni with ghee, the all-impelling one, with hymns,

original: svādhībhir vacasyubhiḥ
analyzed: su ādhībhiḥ vacasyubhiḥ
translated: with their own thoughts, with eloquent words.

original: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya giram bhare yaśase pūrvyāya
analyzed: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya giram bhare yaśase pūrvyāya
translated: I bring a song to the wise one, the leader, for fame, for the ancient one.

original: ghṛtaprasatto asuraḥ suśevo rāyo dhartā dharuṇo vasvo agniḥ🔽ṛtena ṛtaṃ dharuṇaṃ dhārayanta yajñasya śāke parame vyoman
analyzed: ghṛta prasattaḥ asuraḥ su śevaḥ rāyaḥ dhartā dharuṇaḥ vasvaḥ agniḥ  ṛtena ṛtam dharuṇam dhārayanta yajñasya śāke parame vyoman
translated: The Asura, well-disposed, delighted with ghee, is the supporter of wealth, the bearer of treasure, Agni.🔽By law they uphold the law, the support, in the highest heaven, in the place of sacrifice.

original: divo dharman dharuṇe seduṣo nññ jātair ajātāṃ abhi ye nanakṣuḥ
analyzed: divaḥ dharman dharuṇe seduṣaḥ nñm jātaiḥ a jātān abhi ye nanakṣuḥ
translated: They who have grown from the unborn, from the seated one on the support of the sky, have surrounded the unborn.

original: aṅhoyuvas tanvas tanvate vi vayo mahad duṣṭaram pūrvyāya
analyzed: aṅhoyuvaḥ tanvaḥ tanvate vi vayaḥ mahat duṣṭaram pūrvyāya
translated: The young ones of the old one extend their bodies, their great, hard-to-cross life to the ancient one.

original: sa saṃvato navajātas tuturyāt siṅhaṃ na kruddham abhitaḥ pari ṣṭhuḥ
analyzed: sa saṃvataḥ nava jātaḥ tuturyāt siṅham na kruddham abhitas pari sthuḥ
translated: He, newly born, should roar around like an angry lion.

original: māteva yad bharase paprathāno janaṃjanaṃ dhāyase cakṣase ca
analyzed: mātā iva yat bharase paprathānaḥ janaṃjanam dhāyase cakṣase ca
translated: When, like a mother, you spread out for the bearing, you support and look upon each people.

original: vayovayo jarase yad dadhānaḥ pari tmanā viṣurūpo jigāsi🔽vājo nu te śavasas pātv antam uruṃ doghaṃ dharuṇaṃ deva rāyaḥ
analyzed: vayaḥ vayaḥ jarase yat dadhānaḥ pari tmanā viṣurūpaḥ jigāsi  vājaḥ nu te śavasaḥ pātu antam urum dogham dharuṇam deva rāyaḥ
translated: When, bearing each life to old age, you, of various forms, go around by yourself,🔽may your strength, O god, protect your end, your wide, long-lasting support, your wealth.

original: padaṃ na tāyur guhā dadhāno maho rāye citayann atrim aspaḥ
analyzed: padam na tāyuḥ guhā dadhānaḥ mahaḥ rāye citayan atrim aspaḥ
translated: You, holding the foot of the falcon in a secret place, have helped Atri in great wealth.

original: bṛhad vayo hi bhānave 'rcā devāyāgnaye
analyzed: bṛhat vayaḥ hi bhānave rcā devāya agnaye
translated: For the great life is in the light, praise the god Agni.

original: yam mitraṃ na praśastibhir martāso dadhire puraḥ🔽sa hi dyubhir janānāṃ hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ
analyzed: yam mitram na praśastibhiḥ martāsaḥ dadhire puras  sa hi dyubhiḥ janānām hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ
translated: Whom mortals have placed in front by their praises, as a friend,🔽For he, with his rays, is the Hotar in the arms of the people and of skill.

original: vi havyam agnir ānuṣag bhago na vāram ṛṇvati🔽asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vṛddhaśociṣaḥ
analyzed: vi havyam agniḥ ānuṣak bhagaḥ na vāram ṛṇvati  asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vṛddha śociṣaḥ
translated: Agni, in due course, turns the ladle as does Bhaga, the oblation.🔽In the praise of this Maghavan, in the friendship of him of increased radiance,

original: viśvā yasmin tuviṣvaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ
analyzed: viśvā yasmin tuviṣvaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ
translated: In whom all strength is placed, in the noble one of great power.

original: adhā hy agna eṣāṃ suvīryasya maṃhanā
analyzed: adhā hi agne eṣām su vīryasya maṃhanā
translated: For, O Agni, these (people) by the favour of good heroism

original: tam id yahvaṃ na rodasī pari śravo babhūvatuḥ
analyzed: tam id yahvam na rodasī pari śravaḥ babhūvatuḥ
translated: Have attained that youthful one, the heaven and earth have become his fame.

original: nū na ehi vāryam agne gṛṇāna ā bhara
analyzed: nu naḥ ehi vāryam agne gṛṇānaḥ ā bhara
translated: Now come, O Agni, to the good offering, bring (it),

original: ye vayaṃ ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacotaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
analyzed: ye vayam ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacā uta edhi pṛtsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: We who are (here), and the princes, may we all prosper together. Be present in our battles for our prosperity.

original: ā yajñair deva martya itthā tavyāṃsam ūtaye
analyzed: ā yajñaiḥ deva martyaḥ itthā tavyāṃsam ūtaye
translated: The mortal one, O god, with sacrifices, thus the most excellent one, for help,

original: agniṃ kṛte svadhvare pūrur īḷītāvase
analyzed: agnim kṛte su adhvare pūruḥ īḍīta avase
translated: Puru has praised Agni, in the performance of his own rite, for help.

original: asya hi svayaśastara āsā vidharman manyase
analyzed: asya hi sva yaśastaraḥ āsā vidharman manyase
translated: For this one, more famous than himself, you think of different law.

original: taṃ nākaṃ citraśociṣam mandram paro manīṣayā🔽asya vāsā u arciṣā ya āyukta tujā girā
analyzed: tam nākam citra śociṣam mandram paras manīṣayā  asya vā āsā u arciṣā yaḥ āyukta tujā girā
translated: That heaven, of variegated radiance, the pleasant one, with highest thought,🔽Whose garments are with this (Agni's) flame, he who is yoked with strength and song,

original: divo na yasya retasā bṛhac chocanty arcayaḥ
analyzed: divaḥ na yasya retasā bṛhat śocanti arcayaḥ
translated: Whose great rays shine like the moisture of heaven.

original: asya kratvā vicetaso dasmasya vasu ratha ā
analyzed: asya kratvā vicetasaḥ dasmasya vasu rathe ā
translated: By the wisdom of this wondrous one, the treasure-laden car

original: adhā viśvāsu havyo 'gnir vikṣu pra śasyate
analyzed: adhā viśvāsu havyaḥ gniḥ vikṣu pra śasyate
translated: Now in all the people Agni is to be praised, the oblation-bearer,

original: nū na id dhi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ
analyzed: nu naḥ id hi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ
translated: Now indeed the good things which the princes desire follow him,

original: ūrjo napād abhiṣṭaye pāhi śagdhi svastaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napāt abhiṣṭaye pāhi śagdhi svastaye uta edhi pṛtsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: From the foot of strength for protection, guard, be ready for our welfare, and be present in our battles for our prosperity.

original: prātar agniḥ purupriyo viśa stavetātithiḥ
analyzed: prātar agniḥ puru priyaḥ viśaḥ staveta atithiḥ
translated: In the morning Agni, much-loved, is to be praised by the people as a guest,

original: viśvāni yo amartyo havyā marteṣu raṇyati
analyzed: viśvāni yaḥ amartyaḥ havyā marteṣu raṇyati
translated: He who, immortal, delights in all the offerings among mortals.

original: dvitāya mṛktavāhase svasya dakṣasya maṃhanā🔽induṃ sa dhatta ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya
analyzed: dvitāya mṛktavāhase svasya dakṣasya maṃhanā  indum sa dhatte ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya
translated: To the two-horsed one who is praised, with the abundance of his own power,🔽The mortal who praises you, O immortal one, continuously offers the Soma.

original: taṃ vo dīrghāyuśociṣaṃ girā huve maghonām
analyzed: tam vaḥ dīrgha āyu śociṣam girā huve maghonām
translated: I invoke with a verse that Agni of long life and great radiance, the lord of the wealthy,

original: ariṣṭo yeṣāṃ ratho vy aśvadāvann īyate
analyzed: ariṣṭaḥ yeṣām rathaḥ vi aśva dāvan īyate
translated: Whose chariot, O giver of horses, moves uninjured,

original: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitir āsann ukthā pānti ye
analyzed: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitiḥ āsan ukthā pānti ye
translated: Or those in whom the wondrous thought is present, who protect the hymns,

original: stīrṇam barhiḥ svarṇare śravāṃsi dadhire pari
analyzed: stīrṇam barhiḥ svarṇare śravāṃsi dadhire pari
translated: The strewn grass, O golden one, they have made resplendent, they have gained fame.

original: ye me pañcāśataṃ dadur aśvānāṃ sadhastuti
analyzed: ye me pañcāśatam daduḥ aśvānām sadhastuti
translated: Those who have given me five hundred horses for the assembly,

original: dyumad agne mahi śravo bṛhat kṛdhi maghonāṃ nṛvad amṛta nṛṇām
analyzed: dyumat agne mahi śravaḥ bṛhat kṛdhi maghonām nṛvat amṛta nṛṇām
translated: Make great and glorious fame for the wealthy, O Agni, like that of men, O immortal one.

original: abhy avasthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavrer vavriś ciketa
analyzed: abhi avasthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavreḥ vavriḥ ciketa
translated: The offspring are born from the womb, the womb thinks.

original: upasthe mātur vi caṣṭe
analyzed: upasthe mātuḥ vi caṣṭe
translated: He looks down from the lap of his mother

original: juhure vi citayanto 'nimiṣaṃ nṛmṇam pānti
analyzed: juhure vi citayantaḥ nimiṣam nṛmṇam pānti
translated: The priests, reflecting, guard the unfailing manly power

original: ā dṛḷhām puraṃ viviśuḥ🔽ā śvaitreyasya jantavo dyumad vardhanta kṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: ā dṛḷhām puram viviśuḥ  ā śvaitreyasya jantavaḥ dyumat vardhanta kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: They have entered the firm citadel🔽The people of Śvitreyas' son increase in glory

original: niṣkagrīvo bṛhaduktha enā madhvā na vājayuḥ
analyzed: niṣka grīvaḥ bṛhat ukthaḥ enā madhvā na vājayuḥ
translated: Necklaced with gold, of lofty praise, he is like a racer to the prize

original: priyaṃ dugdhaṃ na kāmyam ajāmi jāmyoḥ sacā🔽gharmo na vājajaṭharo 'dabdhaḥ śaśvato dabhaḥ
analyzed: priyam dugdham na kāmyam ajāmi jāmyoḥ sacā  gharmaḥ na vāja jaṭharaḥ dabdhaḥ śaśvataḥ dabhaḥ
translated: Like sweet milk that is dear, I mix it together for the two sisters🔽Like a heated pan, with a belly for strength, uninjured, the destroyer of all

original: krīḷan no raśma ā bhuvaḥ sam bhasmanā vāyunā vevidānaḥ
analyzed: krīḍan naḥ raśmaḥ ā bhuvaḥ sam bhasmanā vāyunā vevidānaḥ
translated: Playing, come to us, O ray, in union with the smoke and wind

original: tā asya san dhṛṣajo na tigmāḥ susaṃśitā vakṣyo vakṣaṇesthāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ asya san dhṛṣajaḥ na tigmāḥ su saṃśitāḥ vakṣyaḥ vakṣaṇesthāḥ
translated: Those sharp teeth of his are firmly set, well-sharpened, in the jaws and cheeks

original: yam agne vājasātama tvaṃ cin manyase rayim
analyzed: yam agne vāja sātama tvam cit manyase rayim
translated: O Agni, the wealth which you think is best for gaining strength

original: taṃ no gīrbhiḥ śravāyyaṃ devatrā panayā yujam
analyzed: tam naḥ gīrbhiḥ śravāyyam devatrā panaya yujam
translated: That, with your songs, bring to us, to be heard, yoked, among the gods

original: ye agne nerayanti te vṛddhā ugrasya śavasaḥ
analyzed: ye agne na īrayanti te vṛddhāḥ ugrasya śavasaḥ
translated: O Agni, those who lead you, the aged, of mighty power

original: apa dveṣo apa hvaro 'nyavratasya saścire🔽hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe 'gne dakṣasya sādhanam
analyzed: apa dveṣaḥ apa hvaraḥ nyavratasya saścire  hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe gne dakṣasya sādhanam
translated: Away with hatred, away with contempt, for one who is constant in a different vow🔽We choose you as our priest, O Agni, the fulfiller of strength

original: yajñeṣu pūrvyaṃ girā prayasvanto havāmahe
analyzed: yajñeṣu pūrvyam girā prayasvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: The first in sacrifices, we invoke with our song, the bountiful ones

original: itthā yathā ta ūtaye sahasāvan divedive
analyzed: itthā yathā te ūtaye sahasāvan dive dive
translated: Thus, O mighty one, day by day, for help

original: rāya ṛtāya sukrato gobhiḥ ṣyāma sadhamādo vīraiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ
analyzed: rāye ṛtāya su krato gobhiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ vīraiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ
translated: O wise one, through cattle may we be sharers of your wealth, O bountiful one, through heroes may we be sharers of your wealth.

original: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi
analyzed: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi
translated: Like Manu we will establish you, like Manu we will kindle you.

original: agne manuṣvad aṅgiro devān devayate yaja🔽tvaṃ hi mānuṣe jane 'gne suprīta idhyase
analyzed: agne manuṣvat aṅgiraḥ devān devayate yaja  tvam hi mānuṣe jane gne su prītaḥ idhyase
translated: O Agni, like Manu, like Angiras, offer to the gods at the god's sacrifice.🔽For you, O Agni, are well-pleased when kindled among the human people.

original: srucas tvā yanty ānuṣak sujāta sarpirāsute
analyzed: srucaḥ tvā yanti ānuṣak su jāta sarpiḥ āsute
translated: The ladles come to you in order, O well-born one, for the sake of ghee.

original: tvāṃ viśve sajoṣaso devāso dūtam akrata
analyzed: tvām viśve sajoṣasaḥ devāsaḥ dūtam akrata
translated: All the gods of one mind have made you their messenger.

original: saparyantas tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īḷate
analyzed: saparyantaḥ tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īḍate
translated: They who serve you, O wise one, invoke the god at sacrifices.

original: devaṃ vo devayajyayāgnim īḷīta martyaḥ🔽samiddhaḥ śukra dīdihy ṛtasya yonim āsadaḥ sasasya yonim āsadaḥ
analyzed: devam vaḥ deva yajyayā agnim īḍīta martyaḥ  samiddhaḥ śukra dīdihi ṛtasya yonim āsadaḥ sasasya yonim āsadaḥ
translated: Let the mortal one invoke Agni, the god, through the worship of the gods.🔽Kindled, O bright one, shine forth, you have sat down in the womb of truth, you have sat down in the womb of the plant.

original: pra viśvasāmann atrivad arcā pāvakaśociṣe
analyzed: pra viśvasāman atri vat arca pāvaka śociṣe
translated: I praise the all-supporting one, like Atri, to the one whose radiance is like a flame,

original: yo adhvareṣv īḍyo hotā mandratamo viśi
analyzed: yaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ hotā mandratamaḥ viśi
translated: Who is to be praised at sacrifices, the most delightful Hotar in the assembly.

original: ny agniṃ jātavedasaṃ dadhātā devam ṛtvijam🔽pra yajña etv ānuṣag adyā devavyacastamaḥ
analyzed: ni agnim jātavedasam dadhāta devam ṛtvijam  pra yajñaḥ etu ānuṣak adyā deva vyacastamaḥ
translated: We have placed Agni, the all-knower, the god, the priest.🔽Let the sacrifice come in order today, most worthy of the gods.

original: cikitvinmanasaṃ tvā devam martāsa ūtaye
analyzed: cikitvinmanasam tvā devam martāsaḥ ūtaye
translated: We mortals have thought of you, the god with an understanding mind, for help.

original: vareṇyasya te 'vasa iyānāso amanmahi
analyzed: vareṇyasya te vaso iyānāsaḥ amanmahi
translated: We have thought of the help of you, the most excellent one.

original: agne cikiddhy asya na idaṃ vacaḥ sahasya
analyzed: agne cikiddhi asya naḥ idam vacaḥ sahasya
translated: O Agni, do thou accept this speech of ours, O thou of mighty power,

original: taṃ tvā suśipra dampate stomair vardhanty atrayo gīrbhiḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ
analyzed: tam tvā su śipra dampate stomaiḥ vardhanti atrayaḥ gīrbhiḥ śumbhanti atrayaḥ
translated: Thee, O thou of beautiful face, O lord of the house, the Atri-s exalt by praises, the Atri-s adorn by songs.

original: agne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya prāsahā rayim
analyzed: agne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya prāsahā rayim
translated: O Agni, bring hitherward the wealth that conquers in the contests for glory,

original: viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhy ṛsā vājeṣu sāsahat
analyzed: viśvāḥ yaḥ carṣaṇīḥ abhi ṛsā vājeṣu sāsahat
translated: He who surpasses all men, who is victorious in battles for booty.

original: tam agne pṛtanāṣahaṃ rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara🔽tvaṃ hi satyo adbhuto dātā vājasya gomataḥ🔽viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
analyzed: tam agne pṛtanāṣaham rayim sahasva ā bhara  tvam hi satyaḥ adbhutaḥ dātā vājasya gomataḥ  viśve hi tvā sajoṣasaḥ janāsaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: That wealth, O Agni, which conquers in battles, bring hitherward, O mighty one,🔽For thou art true, wondrous, the giver of strength and of wealth in cattle.🔽For all the people, of one mind, with trimmed grass,

original: hotāraṃ sadmasu priyaṃ vyanti vāryā puru
analyzed: hotāram sadmasu priyam vyanti vāryā puru
translated: Choose thee as the priest, dear in the abodes, for great boons.

original: sa hi ṣmā viśvacarṣaṇir abhimāti saho dadhe🔽agna eṣu kṣayeṣv ā revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi
analyzed: sa hi sma viśvacarṣaṇiḥ abhimāti sahaḥ dadhe  agne eṣu kṣayeṣu ā revat naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi
translated: For he, indeed, the all-powerful one, has laid up the strength that conquers the foe.🔽O Agni, shine here in our dwellings, O splendid one, shine with thy radiant light, shine with thy glorious light.

original: agne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhavā varūthyaḥ🔽vasur agnir vasuśravā achā nakṣi dyumattamaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: agne tvam naḥ antamaḥ uta trātā śivaḥ bhava varūthyaḥ  vasuḥ agniḥ vasu śravāḥ achā nakṣi dyumattamam rayim dāḥ
translated: O Agni, be thou our nearest friend, and a kind protector, a kind deliverer.🔽Agni is a good friend, of good fame; come to us, grant us the most glorious wealth.

original: sa no bodhi śrudhī havam uruṣyā ṇo aghāyataḥ samasmāt🔽taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ bodhi śrudhi havam uruṣyā naḥ aghāyataḥ samasmāt 🔽tam tvā śociṣṭha dīdivas sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Do thou be our protector, hear our call, guard us from the sinner, from him who is hostile to us.🔽Thee, O Agni, most radiant one, we now implore for bliss, for our friends.

original: achā vo agnim avase devaṃ gāsi sa no vasuḥ
analyzed: achā vaḥ agnim avase devam gāsi sa naḥ vasuḥ
translated: I call to you for help, to the god Agni, may he, the good one,

original: rāsat putra ṛṣūṇām ṛtāvā parṣati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: rāsat putraḥ ṛṣūṇām ṛtāvā parṣati dviṣaḥ
translated: May the son of the impetuous ones, the righteous one, carry us over our enemies.

original: sa hi satyo yam pūrve cid devāsaś cid yam īdhire
analyzed: sa hi satyaḥ yam pūrve cit devāsaḥ cit yam īdhire
translated: For he is the true one whom even the ancient gods have kindled.

original: hotāram mandrajihvam it sudītibhir vibhāvasum
analyzed: hotāram mandra jihvam id su dītibhiḥ vibhāvasum
translated: The priest with a sweet tongue, with his good lights, with his shining riches.

original: sa no dhītī variṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā ca sumatyā
analyzed: sa naḥ dhītī variṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā ca sumatyā
translated: May he with his best and most excellent thought and with his most auspicious favor,

original: agne rāyo didīhi naḥ suvṛktibhir vareṇya
analyzed: agne rāyaḥ didīhi naḥ suvṛktibhiḥ vareṇya
translated: O Agni, shine on us with good prayers, O most excellent one.

original: agnir deveṣu rājaty agnir marteṣv āviśan🔽agnir no havyavāhano 'gniṃ dhībhiḥ saparyata
analyzed: agniḥ deveṣu rājati agniḥ marteṣu āviśan  agniḥ naḥ havya vāhanaḥ gnim dhībhiḥ saparyata
translated: Agni rules among the gods, Agni has entered into mortals.🔽Agni, the bearer of our oblations, honor Agni with your thoughts.

original: agnis tuviśravastamaṃ tuvibrahmāṇam uttamam
analyzed: agniḥ tuvi śravastamam tuvi brahmāṇam uttamam
translated: Agni gives the most famous, the most powerful, the best,

original: atūrtaṃ śrāvayatpatim putraṃ dadāti dāśuṣe
analyzed: a tūrtam śrāvayat patim putram dadāti dāśuṣe
translated: The unvanquished one who proclaims, the son, he gives to the worshipper.

original: agnir dadāti satpatiṃ sāsāha yo yudhā nṛbhiḥ
analyzed: agniḥ dadāti sat patim sāsāha yaḥ yudhā nṛbhiḥ
translated: Agni gives the lord of the good, he who conquers in battle with men.

original: agnir atyaṃ raghuṣyadaṃ jetāram aparājitam
analyzed: agniḥ atyam raghuṣyadam jetāram aparājitam
translated: Agni gives the swift horse, the victorious, the undefeated.

original: yad vāhiṣṭhaṃ tad agnaye bṛhad arca vibhāvaso🔽mahiṣīva tvad rayis tvad vājā ud īrate
analyzed: yat vāhiṣṭham tat agnaye bṛhat arca vibhāvaso  mahiṣī iva tvat rayiḥ tvat vājāḥ ud īrate
translated: What is best, that is for Agni, O Brihat, with great light.🔽Like a mighty bull, your wealth, your powers rise up from you.

original: tava dyumanto arcayo grāvevocyate bṛhat
analyzed: tava dyumantaḥ arcayaḥ grāvā iva ucyate bṛhat
translated: Your shining rays, like a stone, are proclaimed as great.

original: uto te tanyatur yathā svāno arta tmanā divaḥ
analyzed: uta u te tanyatuḥ yathā svānaḥ arta tmanā divaḥ
translated: And your thunder, like a cloud, resounds by itself from the sky.

original: evāṃ agniṃ vasūyavaḥ sahasānaṃ vavandima
analyzed: eva ān agnim vasūyavaḥ sahasānam vavandima
translated: Thus we have praised Agni, the Vasus' son, the conqueror,

original: sa no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ parṣan nāveva sukratuḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ parṣat nāvā iva su kratuḥ
translated: May he, most wise, carry us over all enmities, as in a boat.

original: agne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā
analyzed: agne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā
translated: O Agni, O purifier, with thy radiant, delightful tongue, O god,

original: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
analyzed: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
translated: Do thou bring the gods and worship them.

original: taṃ tvā ghṛtasnav īmahe citrabhāno svardṛśam
analyzed: tam tvā ghṛtasno īmahe citrabhāno svar dṛśam
translated: We implore thee, O Agni, O thou who art sprinkled with ghee, O thou of wondrous light, O thou who beholdest the light,

original: devāṃ ā vītaye vaha🔽vītihotraṃ tvā kave dyumantaṃ sam idhīmahi
analyzed: devān ā vītaye vaha  vītihotram tvā kave dyumantam sam idhīmahi
translated: Do thou bring the gods to the feast.

original: agne bṛhantam adhvare
analyzed: agne bṛhantam adhvare
translated: Thee, O wise one, the priest of the sacrifice, we kindle, O Agni, the splendid one,🔽The great one at the sacrifice.

original: agne viśvebhir ā gahi devebhir havyadātaye
analyzed: agne viśvebhiḥ ā gahi devebhiḥ havya dātaye
translated: O Agni, come hither with all the gods to receive the oblation;

original: hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose thee as our Hotar.

original: yajamānāya sunvata āgne suvīryaṃ vaha
analyzed: yajamānāya sunvate ā agne su vīryam vaha
translated: O Agni, bring heroic strength to the sacrificer who presses (the Soma),

original: devair ā satsi barhiṣi
analyzed: devaiḥ ā satsi barhiṣi
translated: Do thou sit on the strew with the gods.

original: samidhānaḥ sahasrajid agne dharmāṇi puṣyasi
analyzed: samidhānaḥ sahasra jit agne dharmāṇi puṣyasi
translated: O Agni, kindled, thou prosperest the thousandfold ways,

original: devānāṃ dūta ukthyaḥ
analyzed: devānām dūtaḥ ukthyaḥ
translated: The envoy of the gods, worthy of lauds.

original: ny agniṃ jātavedasaṃ hotravāhaṃ yaviṣṭhyam🔽dadhātā devam ṛtvijam
analyzed: ni agnim jātavedasam hotra vāham yaviṣṭhyam  dadhāta devam ṛtvijam
translated: I place Agni, the all-knower, the bearer of the oblation, the youngest,🔽The god, the priest.

original: pra yajña etv ānuṣag adyā devavyacastamaḥ
analyzed: pra yajñaḥ etu ānuṣak adyā deva vyacastamaḥ
translated: Let the sacrifice go forward in due order today, most divine,

original: stṛṇīta barhir āsade
analyzed: stṛṇīta barhiḥ āsade
translated: Strew the strew for the sitting.

original: edam maruto aśvinā mitraḥ sīdantu varuṇaḥ
analyzed: ā idam marutaḥ aśvinā mitraḥ sīdantu varuṇaḥ
translated: Here, O Maruts, O Asvins, may Mitra, Varuna,

original: devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā
analyzed: devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā
translated: The gods, with the whole people, sit down.

original: anasvantā satpatir māmahe me gāvā cetiṣṭho asuro maghonaḥ
analyzed: anasvantā satpatiḥ māmahe me gāvā cetiṣṭhaḥ asuraḥ maghonaḥ
translated: The lord of the true, with two non-stumbling ones, is praised by me, the most excellent of the Asuras, the wealthy one,

original: traivṛṣṇo agne daśabhiḥ sahasrair vaiśvānara tryaruṇaś ciketa
analyzed: traivṛṣṇaḥ agne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ vaiśvānara tri aruṇaḥ ciketa
translated: O Agni Vaiśvānara, Traivṛṣṇa, with ten thousand, and the three-red one has thought (of you).

original: yo me śatā ca viṃśatiṃ ca gonāṃ harī ca yuktā sudhurā dadāti
analyzed: yaḥ me śatā ca viṃśatim ca gonām harī ca yuktā su dhurā dadāti
translated: He who gives me a hundred and twenty cows, and two well-yoked swift bay horses,

original: vaiśvānara suṣṭuto vāvṛdhāno 'gne yacha tryaruṇāya śarma
analyzed: vaiśvānara suṣṭutaḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ gne yaccha tri aruṇāya śarma
translated: O Vaiśvānara Agni, well-praised, grown great, grant protection to the three-red one.

original: evā te agne sumatiṃ cakāno naviṣṭhāya navamaṃ trasadasyuḥ
analyzed: eva te agne sumatim cakānaḥ naviṣṭhāya navamam trasadasyuḥ
translated: Thus, O Agni, longing for your favor, Trasadasyu, the youngest, to the newest one, the ninth,

original: yo me giras tuvijātasya pūrvīr yuktenābhi tryaruṇo gṛṇāti
analyzed: yaḥ me giraḥ tuvi jātasya pūrvīḥ yuktena abhi tri aruṇaḥ gṛṇāti
translated: The three-red one praises me, the well-born one, with a yoked (chariot), with many songs of mine.

original: yo ma iti pravocaty aśvamedhāya sūraye
analyzed: yaḥ me iti pravocati aśvamedhāya sūraye
translated: He who speaks to me thus, to the radiant one, to the one who sacrifices the horse,

original: dadad ṛcā saniṃ yate dadan medhām ṛtāyate
analyzed: dadat ṛcā sanim yate dadat medhām ṛtāyate
translated: Giving the prize to the one who strives with the Ṛc, giving wisdom to the one who strives with the truth,

original: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam uddharṣayanty ukṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam ud harṣayanti ukṣaṇaḥ
translated: Whose hundred rough oxen make me bristle,

original: aśvamedhasya dānāḥ somā iva tryṛśiraḥ
analyzed: aśvamedhasya dānāḥ somāḥ iva tri ṛśiraḥ
translated: The gifts of the horse sacrifice, like the three-peaked ones of Soma.

original: indrāgnī śatadāvny aśvamedhe suvīryam
analyzed: indra agnī śatadāvni aśvamedhe su vīryam
translated: O Indra and Agni, the hundred-giving ones, at the horse sacrifice, the good heroism,

original: kṣatraṃ dhārayatam bṛhad divi sūryam ivājaram
analyzed: kṣatram dhārayatam bṛhat divi sūryam iva ajaram
translated: Uphold the great lordship, like the imperishable sun in the sky.

original: samiddho agnir divi śocir aśret pratyaṅṅ uṣasam urviyā vi bhāti
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ divi śociḥ aśret pratyaṅ uṣasam urviyā vi bhāti
translated: Agni, the kindled one, his radiance shines in the sky, he shines over the dawn with his light.

original: eti prācī viśvavārā namobhir devāṃ īḷānā haviṣā ghṛtācī
analyzed: eti prācī viśva vārā namobhiḥ devān īḍānā haviṣā ghṛtācī
translated: She goes forth to the east, sought by all, inviting the gods with adorations, the oblation-bearer,

original: samidhyamāno amṛtasya rājasi haviṣ kṛṇvantaṃ sacase svastaye
analyzed: samidhyamānaḥ amṛtasya rājasi haviṣ kṛṇvantam sacase svastaye
translated: kindled, you rule as king of the immortal; you attend on him who makes the offering for his well-being.

original: viśvaṃ sa dhatte draviṇaṃ yam invasy ātithyam agne ni ca dhatta it puraḥ
analyzed: viśvam sa dhatte draviṇam yam invasi ātithyam agne ni ca dhatte id puras
translated: He bestows all wealth on him whom you quicken; you place in front the hospitality, O Agni.

original: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāny uttamāni santu🔽saṃ jāspatyaṃ suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭhā mahāṃsi
