analyzed: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāni uttamāni santu  sam jāspatyam suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭha mahāṃsi
translated: O Agni, strive for great good fortune; let your glories be the highest.🔽Make the lordship of the house easy to govern; overcome the great hostilities of the enemies.🔽Of you, O Agni, well-kindled, I praise the glory, the most excellent.

original: samiddhasya pramahaso 'gne vande tava śriyam🔽vṛṣabho dyumnavāṃ asi sam adhvareṣv idhyase
analyzed: samiddhasya pramahasaḥ gne vande tava śriyam  vṛṣabhaḥ dyumnavān asi sam adhvareṣu idhyase
translated: You are the bull, the glorious one; you are kindled in the sacrifices.

original: samiddho agna āhuta devān yakṣi svadhvara
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agne āhuta devān yakṣi su adhvara
translated: Well-kindled, O Agni, offered, worship the gods, O you of good vows,

original: tvaṃ hi havyavāḷ asi
analyzed: tvam hi havyavāṭ asi
translated: for you are the carrier of oblations.

original: ā juhotā duvasyatāgnim prayaty adhvare
analyzed: ā juhota ā duvasyata agnim prayati adhvare
translated: O sacrificer, serve Agni, who is sent forth at the sacrifice;

original: vṛṇīdhvaṃ havyavāhanam
analyzed: vṛṇīdhvam havyavāhanam
translated: choose the bearer of oblations.

original: try aryamā manuṣo devatātā trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta
analyzed: trī aryamā manuṣaḥ devatātā trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta
translated: Aryaman, the god of men, is threefold; three luminous spheres in the sky support him.

original: arcanti tvā marutaḥ pūtadakṣās tvam eṣām ṛṣir indrāsi dhīraḥ
analyzed: arcanti tvā marutaḥ pūta dakṣāḥ tvam eṣām ṛṣiḥ indra asi dhīraḥ
translated: The Maruts, with purified strength, praise you; you are their seer, O Indra, you are the wise one.

original: anu yad īm maruto mandasānam ārcann indram papivāṃsaṃ sutasya
analyzed: anu yat īm marutaḥ mandasānam ārcan indram papivāṃsam sutasya
translated: When the Maruts, rejoicing, praised Indra who had drunk the Soma juice,

original: ādatta vajram abhi yad ahiṃ hann apo yahvīr asṛjat sartavā u
analyzed: ādatta vajram abhi yat ahim han apaḥ yahvīḥ asṛjat sartavai u
translated: He took up the thunderbolt to slay the dragon, and let loose the young waters to flow.

original: uta brahmāṇo maruto me asyendraḥ somasya suṣutasya peyāḥ
analyzed: uta brahmāṇaḥ marutaḥ me asya indraḥ somasya suṣutasya peyāḥ
translated: The Brahmans, the Maruts, and Indra are my guests to drink the well-pressed Soma.

original: tad dhi havyam manuṣe gā avindad ahann ahim papivāṃ indro asya
analyzed: tat hi havyam manuṣe gāḥ avindat ahan ahim papivān indraḥ asya
translated: For that is the offering which he found for man; Indra, having drunk, slew the dragon.

original: ād rodasī vitaraṃ vi ṣkabhāyat saṃvivyānaś cid bhiyase mṛgaṃ kaḥ
analyzed: āt rodasī vitaram vi skabhāyat saṃvivyānaḥ cit bhiyase mṛgam kaḥ
translated: He cleft asunder the two world-halves, the broad expanse, even the fearful beast to be slain.

original: jigartim indro apajargurāṇaḥ prati śvasantam ava dānavaṃ han
analyzed: jigartim indraḥ apajargurāṇaḥ prati śvasantam ava dānavam han
translated: Indra, having slain the dragon, the hissing one, smote down the Dānava who breathed against him.

original: adha kratvā maghavan tubhyaṃ devā anu viśve adaduḥ somapeyam
analyzed: adha kratvā maghavan tubhyam devāḥ anu viśve adaduḥ soma peyam
translated: Then, O Maghavan, the gods gave to thee the right to drink the Soma, by their wisdom.

original: yat sūryasya haritaḥ patantīḥ puraḥ satīr uparā etaśe kaḥ
analyzed: yat sūryasya haritaḥ patantīḥ puras satīḥ uparāḥ etaśe kaḥ
translated: When the two bay horses of the sun, flying in front, were yoked to the chariot of Etaṣa,

original: nava yad asya navatiṃ ca bhogān sākaṃ vajreṇa maghavā vivṛścat
analyzed: nava yat asya navatim ca bhogān sākam vajreṇa maghavā vivṛścat
translated: Then Maghavan, with his thunderbolt, rent asunder his nine-and-ninety fetters.

original: arcantīndram marutaḥ sadhasthe traiṣṭubhena vacasā bādhata dyām
analyzed: arcanti indram marutaḥ sadhasthe traiṣṭubhena vacasā bādhata dyām
translated: The Maruts in the abode of Indra, with a verse in the Triṣṭubh metre, filled the heaven.

original: sakhā sakhye apacat tūyam agnir asya kratvā mahiṣā trī śatāni
analyzed: sakhā sakhye apacat tūyam agniḥ asya kratvā mahiṣā trī śatāni
translated: The friend, the friend's friend, Agni, cooked for him quickly; by his wisdom the bulls, the three hundred.

original: trī sākam indro manuṣaḥ sarāṃsi sutam pibad vṛtrahatyāya somam
analyzed: trī sākam indraḥ manuṣaḥ sarāṃsi sutam pibat vṛtra hatyāya somam
translated: Indra, the three lakes of men he drank together, the Soma, while slaying Vr̥itra, to make him strong.

original: trī yac chatā mahiṣāṇām agho mās trī sarāṃsi maghavā somyāpāḥ
analyzed: trī yat śatā mahiṣāṇām aghaḥ māḥ trī sarāṃsi maghavā somyā apāḥ
translated: The three hundred buffaloes he slaughtered, and Maghavan drank three lakes full of Soma.

original: kāraṃ na viśve ahvanta devā bharam indrāya yad ahiṃ jaghāna🔽uśanā yat sahasyair ayātaṃ gṛham indra jūjuvānebhir aśvaiḥ🔽vanvāno atra sarathaṃ yayātha kutsena devair avanor ha śuṣṇam🔽prānyac cakram avṛhaḥ sūryasya kutsāyānyad varivo yātave 'kaḥ
analyzed: kāram na viśve ahvanta devāḥ bharam indrāya yat ahim jaghāna  uśanā yat sahasyaiḥ ayātam gṛham indra jūjuvānebhiḥ aśvaiḥ  vanvānaḥ atra sa ratham yayātha kutsena devaiḥ avanoḥ ha śuṣṇam  pra anyat cakram avṛhaḥ sūryasya kutsāya anyat varivaḥ yātave kaḥ
translated: All the Gods have called for aid, for Indra, when he slew the Dragon, to bear his mighty load.

original: anāso dasyūṃr amṛṇo vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācaḥ🔽stomāsas tvā gaurivīter avardhann arandhayo vaidathināya piprum🔽ā tvām ṛjiśvā sakhyāya cakre pacan paktīr apibaḥ somam asya🔽navagvāsaḥ sutasomāsa indraṃ daśagvāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ🔽gavyaṃ cid ūrvam apidhānavantaṃ taṃ cin naraḥ śaśamānā apa vran
analyzed: an āsaḥ dasyūṃr amṛṇaḥ vadhena ni duryoṇe āvṛṇak mṛdhra vācaḥ 🔽stomāsaḥ tvā gaurivīteḥ avardhan arandhayaḥ vaidathināya piprum 🔽ā tvām ṛjiśvā sakhyāya cakre pacan paktīḥ apibaḥ somam asya 🔽navagvāsaḥ suta somāsaḥ indram daśagvāsaḥ abhī arcanti arkaiḥ 🔽gavyam cit ūrvam apidhānavantam tam cit naraḥ śaśamānāḥ apa vran
translated: When, O Indra, with the active, with the eager, with the strong, with the swift, with the fleet, with the impetuous, with the violent, with the violent ones, with the violent, with the violent ones, with the violent, with the violent ones, with the violent, with the violent ones, with the violent, with the violent ones, with the violent, with the violent ones, with the violent, with with the violent ones

original: katho nu te pari carāṇi vidvān vīryṛ maghavan yā cakartha
analyzed: kathā u nu te pari carāṇi vidvān vīryṛ maghavan yā cakartha
translated: How, knowing this, shall I praise your deeds, O mighty Indra, O Maghavan, which you have done?

original: yā co nu navyā kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha pred u tā te vidatheṣu bravāma
analyzed: yā ca u nu navyā kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha pra id u tā te vidatheṣu bravāma
translated: And which, O most powerful one, you will do anew? We will proclaim them even here in the assemblies.

original: etā viśvā cakṛvāṃ indra bhūry aparīto januṣā vīryeṇa
analyzed: etā viśvā cakṛvān indra bhūri aparītaḥ januṣā vīryeṇa
translated: All these things, O Indra, you have done, O bountiful one, with your unhindered birth and strength.

original: yā cin nu vajrin kṛṇavo dadhṛṣvān na te vartā taviṣyā asti tasyāḥ
analyzed: yā cit nu vajrin kṛṇavaḥ dadhṛṣvān na te vartā taviṣyāḥ asti tasyāḥ
translated: Whatever you have done, O wielder of the thunderbolt, with daring, there is no turning back for you from that.

original: indra brahma kriyamāṇā juṣasva yā te śaviṣṭha navyā akarma
analyzed: indra brahma kriyamāṇā juṣasva yā te śaviṣṭha navyā akarma
translated: O Indra, rejoice in the prayers that are made to you, O most powerful one, in the new rites.

original: vastreva bhadrā sukṛtā vasūyū rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam
analyzed: vastrā iva bhadrā su kṛtā vasūyuḥ ratham na dhīraḥ su apāḥ atakṣam
translated: Like a skillful craftsman fashions a beautiful garment, I have fashioned a hymn for you, O self-reliant one, like a chariot.

original: kva sya vīraḥ ko apaśyad indraṃ sukharatham īyamānaṃ haribhyām
analyzed: kva sya vīraḥ kaḥ apaśyat indram sukha ratham īyamānam haribhyām
translated: Where is that hero who has seen Indra, going on his easy chariot drawn by the two bay horses?

original: yo rāyā vajrī sutasomam ichan tad oko gantā puruhūta ūtī
analyzed: yaḥ rāyā vajrī suta somam icchan tat okaḥ gantā puruhūtaḥ ūtī
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, desiring wealth, goes to the house of the Soma-presser, O much-invoked one, for help.

original: avācacakṣam padam asya sasvar ugraṃ nidhātur anv āyam ichan🔽apṛcham anyāṃ uta te ma āhur indraṃ naro bubudhānā aśema
analyzed: avācacakṣam padam asya sasvar ugram nidhātuḥ anu āyam ichan  apṛccham anyām uta te me āhuḥ indram naraḥ bubudhānāḥ aśema
translated: I have looked for his place, desiring to reach the abode of the mighty one.🔽I have asked others, and they have told me: We have recognized Indra, O men.

original: pra nu vayaṃ sute yā te kṛtānīndra bravāma yāni no jujoṣaḥ
analyzed: pra nu vayam sute yā te kṛtāni indra bravāma yāni naḥ jujoṣaḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, we will tell you of the deeds we have done while pressing Soma, which you approve.

original: vedad avidvāñ chṛṇavac ca vidvān vahate 'yam maghavā sarvasenaḥ
analyzed: vedat a vidvān śṛṇavat ca vidvān vahate yam maghavā sarva senaḥ
translated: The ignorant one knows, the wise one hears, this Maghavan moves with the whole army.

original: sthiram manaś cakṛṣe jāta indra veṣīd eko yudhaye bhūyasaś cit
analyzed: sthiram manaḥ cakṛṣe jātaḥ indra veṣi id ekaḥ yudhaye bhūyasaḥ cit
translated: You have made your mind firm, O Indra, born, you seek to fight with many alone.

original: aśmānaṃ cic chavasā didyuto vi vido gavām ūrvam usriyāṇām
analyzed: aśmānam cit śavasā didyutaḥ vi vidaḥ gavām ūrvam usriyāṇām
translated: You have split the rock with your strength, you have found the stall of the cows, of the milk-cows.

original: paro yat tvam parama ājaniṣṭhāḥ parāvati śrutyaṃ nāma bibhrat
analyzed: paras yat tvam paramaḥ ājaniṣṭhāḥ parāvati śrutyam nāma bibhrat
translated: When you were born in the highest place, bearing a well-known name in the farthest place,

original: ataś cid indrād abhayanta devā viśvā apo ajayad dāsapatnīḥ
analyzed: atas cit indrāt abhayanta devāḥ viśvāḥ apaḥ ajayat dāsa patnīḥ
translated: From that very place the gods were afraid of Indra, he conquered all the waters, the wives of the Dāsa.

original: tubhyed ete marutaḥ suśevā arcanty arkaṃ sunvanty andhaḥ
analyzed: tubhya id ete marutaḥ su śevāḥ arcanti arkam sunvanti andhaḥ
translated: These Maruts, who are kind to you, praise you, they press the Soma and offer the sacrifice.

original: ahim ohānam apa āśayānam pra māyābhir māyinaṃ sakṣad indraḥ🔽vi ṣū mṛdho januṣā dānam invann ahan gavā maghavan saṃcakānaḥ
analyzed: ahim ohānam apaḥ āśayānam pra māyābhiḥ māyinam sakṣat indraḥ  vi ṣū mṛdhaḥ januṣā dānam invan ahan gavā maghavan saṃcakānaḥ
translated: Indra conquered with his illusions the illusionist Ahi, who lay in the waters, who was to be slain.🔽You, O bountiful one, having destroyed the enemies by birth, killed the cow, O Indra, who was to be killed.

original: atrā dāsasya namuceḥ śiro yad avartayo manave gātum ichan
analyzed: atrā dāsasya namuceḥ śiraḥ yat avartayaḥ manave gātum ichan
translated: Here, when you wanted to give a way to Manu, you turned off the head of the Dāsa Namuci.

original: yujaṃ hi mām akṛthā ād id indra śiro dāsasya namucer mathāyan
analyzed: yujam hi mām akṛthāḥ āt id indra śiraḥ dāsasya namuceḥ mathāyan
translated: For you have made me a yoke-fellow, O Indra, when you crushed the head of the Dāsa Namuci.

original: aśmānaṃ cit svaryaṃ vartamānam pra cakriyeva rodasī marudbhyaḥ
analyzed: aśmānam cit svaryam vartamānam pra cakriyā iva rodasī marudbhyaḥ
translated: You, as it were, with a wheel, for the Maruts, have rolled asunder the two world-halves, even the firm heaven.

original: striyo hi dāsa āyudhāni cakre kim mā karann abalā asya senāḥ
analyzed: striyaḥ hi dāsaḥ āyudhāni cakre kim mā karan abalāḥ asya senāḥ
translated: He made women and weapons his slaves. What will his weak army do to me?

original: antar hy akhyad ubhe asya dhene athopa praid yudhaye dasyum indraḥ
analyzed: antar hi akhyat ubhe asya dhene athā upa prait yudhaye dasyum indraḥ
translated: He has hidden both his cows. Then Indra went forth to fight the Dasyu.

original: sam atra gāvo 'bhito 'navanteheha vatsair viyutā yad āsan
analyzed: sam atra gāvaḥ bhitas navanta iha iha vatsaiḥ viyutāḥ yat āsan
translated: Here the cows have gathered from all around, here the calves have been united with their mothers,

original: saṃ tā indro asṛjad asya śākair yad īṃ somāsaḥ suṣutā amandan
analyzed: sam tāḥ indraḥ asṛjat asya śākaiḥ yat īm somāsaḥ suṣutāḥ amandan
translated: whom Indra has united with his own cows, when the well-pressed Soma juices have gladdened him.

original: yad īṃ somā babhrudhūtā amandann aroravīd vṛṣabhaḥ sādaneṣu
analyzed: yat īm somāḥ babhru dhūtāḥ amandan aroravīt vṛṣabhaḥ sādaneṣu
translated: When the Soma juices, urged on by the brown (horses), have gladdened him, the bull has roared in the assemblies.

original: puraṃdaraḥ papivāṃ indro asya punar gavām adadād usriyāṇām
analyzed: puraṃdaraḥ papivān indraḥ asya punar gavām adadāt usriyāṇām
translated: Indra, the breaker of forts, has drunk of this, and has given back the cows, the milch cows.

original: bhadram idaṃ ruśamā agne akran gavāṃ catvāri dadataḥ sahasrā
analyzed: bhadram idam ruśamāḥ agne akran gavām catvāri dadataḥ sahasrā
translated: The Rusamas have done this good deed, O Agni, in giving four thousand cows.

original: ṛṇaṃcayasya prayatā maghāni praty agrabhīṣma nṛtamasya nṛṇām
analyzed: ṛṇaṃcayasya prayatā maghāni prati agrabhīṣma nṛtamasya nṛṇām
translated: The rich gifts of Rṇacaya, the best of men, we have accepted in return.

original: supeśasam māva sṛjanty astaṃ gavāṃ sahasrai ruśamāso agne
analyzed: supeśasam mā ava sṛjanti astam gavām sahasraiḥ ruśamāsaḥ agne
translated: The Rusamas, O Agni, have not let slip the well-formed one, with thousands of cows.

original: tīvrā indram amamanduḥ sutāso 'ktor vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyāḥ
analyzed: tīvrāḥ indram amamanduḥ sutāsaḥ ktoḥ vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyāḥ
translated: The strong Soma juices have gladdened Indra at the dawn, at the rising of the sun.

original: auchat sā rātrī paritakmyā yām ṛṇaṃcaye rājani ruśamānām
analyzed: auchat sā rātrī paritakmyā yām ṛṇaṃcaye rājani ruśamānām
translated: That night of the dawn has passed away, when the Rusamas were in the power of king Rṇacaya.

original: atyo na vājī raghur ajyamāno babhruś catvāry asanat sahasrā
analyzed: atyaḥ na vājī raghuḥ ajyamānaḥ babhruḥ catvāri asanat sahasrā
translated: Like a swift, powerful, well-oiled horse, the brown one carried four thousand,

original: catuḥsahasraṃ gavyasya paśvaḥ praty agrabhīṣma ruśameṣv agne
analyzed: catur sahasram gavyasya paśvaḥ prati agrabhīṣma ruśameṣu agne
translated: Four thousand head of cattle we seized in the land of the Ruśamas, O Agni.

original: gharmaś cit taptaḥ pravṛje ya āsīd ayasmayas taṃ v ādāma viprāḥ
analyzed: gharmaḥ cit taptaḥ pravṛje yaḥ āsīt ayasmayaḥ tam u ādāma viprāḥ
translated: Even the heated, glowing iron one, O priests, we carry away.

original: indro rathāya pravataṃ kṛṇoti yam adhyasthān maghavā vājayantam
analyzed: indraḥ rathāya pravatam kṛṇoti yam adhyasthāt maghavā vājayantam
translated: Indra makes a path for the chariot on which the bountiful one rides, eager for strength.

original: yūtheva paśvo vy unoti gopā aṛiṣṭo yāti prathamaḥ siṣāsan
analyzed: yūthā iva paśvaḥ vi unoti gopāḥ a ṛiṣṭaḥ yāti prathamaḥ siṣāsan
translated: Like a herdsman driving away the cattle, he drives away the darkness, going unharmed, the first, thirsting.

original: ā pra drava harivo mā vi venaḥ piśaṅgarāte abhi naḥ sacasva🔽nahi tvad indra vasyo anyad asty amenāṃś cij janivataś cakartha
analyzed: ā pra drava harivas mā vi venaḥ piśaṅga rāte abhi naḥ sacasva  nahi tvat indra vasyaḥ anyat asti amenān cit janivataḥ cakartha
translated: Rush forward, O bearer of tawny wealth, do not be slow, be with us, O giver of the tawny gift.🔽For there is no better favor than you, O Indra, you have made even the unapproachable approachable.

original: ud yat sahaḥ sahasa ājaniṣṭa dediṣṭa indra indriyāṇi viśvā
analyzed: ud yat sahaḥ sahasaḥ ājaniṣṭa dediṣṭe indraḥ indriyāṇi viśvā
translated: When the mighty one was born, he revealed all the powers of Indra.

original: prācodayat sudughā vavre antar vi jyotiṣā saṃvavṛtvat tamo 'vaḥ🔽anavas te ratham aśvāya takṣan tvaṣṭā vajram puruhūta dyumantam
analyzed: prācodayat sudughāḥ vavre antar vi jyotiṣā saṃvavṛtvat tamaḥ vaḥ  anavaḥ te ratham aśvāya takṣan tvaṣṭā vajram puruhūta dyumantam
translated: He stirred the well-milking one, he filled the womb, he surrounded the light, he drove away the darkness.🔽They fashioned your chariot, O Indra, for the horse, Tvaṣṭar fashioned the mighty thunderbolt.

original: brahmāṇa indram mahayanto arkair avardhayann ahaye hantavā u
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ indram mahayantaḥ arkaiḥ avardhayan ahaye hantavai u
translated: The priests, extolling Indra with hymns, made him grow, to slay the demon.

original: vṛṣṇe yat te vṛṣaṇo arkam arcān indra grāvāṇo aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: vṛṣṇe yat te vṛṣaṇaḥ arkam arcān indra grāvāṇaḥ aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: O Vṛṣṇa, when the strong ones praise thy praise, O Indra, the pressing-stones in unison with Aditi,

original: anaśvāso ye pavayo 'rathā indreṣitā abhy avartanta dasyūn
analyzed: an aśvāsaḥ ye pavayaḥ rathāḥ indra iṣitāḥ abhī avartanta dasyūn
translated: The swift ones who are without horses or chariots, sent forth by Indra, have turned back the Dasyus.

original: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vocam pra nūtanā maghavan yā cakartha
analyzed: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vocam pra nūtanā maghavan yā cakartha
translated: I will proclaim thy former deeds, O Maghavan, and the new ones thou hast done.

original: śaktīvo yad vibharā rodasī ubhe jayann apo manave dānucitrāḥ
analyzed: śaktīvas yat vibharāḥ rodasī ubhe jayan apaḥ manave dānu citrāḥ
translated: When, as a mighty one, thou didst support both worlds, conquering, giving the waters to Manu, wondrous in bounty.

original: tad in nu te karaṇaṃ dasma viprāhiṃ yad ghnann ojo atrāmimīthāḥ
analyzed: tat id nu te karaṇam dasma vipra ahim yat ghnan ojaḥ atra āmimīthāḥ
translated: This, indeed, is thy deed, O wondrous sage, when, slaying, thou didst measure out thy strength here.

original: śuṣṇasya cit pari māyā agṛbhṇāḥ prapitvaṃ yann apa dasyūṃr asedhaḥ
analyzed: śuṣṇasya cit pari māyāḥ agṛbhṇāḥ prapitvam yan apa dasyūṃr asedhaḥ
translated: Thou didst seize the magic powers of Ṣushṇa himself, when, as a guest, thou didst drive away the Dasyus.

original: tvam apo yadave turvaśāyāramayaḥ sudughāḥ pāra indra
analyzed: tvam apaḥ yadave turvaśāya aramayaḥ su dughāḥ pāre indra
translated: Thou didst give the waters to Yadu and Turvaga, O Indra, the well-milking ones, as a gift.

original: ugram ayātam avaho ha kutsaṃ saṃ ha yad vām uśanāranta devāḥ
analyzed: ugram ayātam avahaḥ ha kutsam sam ha yat vām uśanā aranta devāḥ
translated: Ye have brought the fierce one, ye have brought Kutsa, when the gods, O Uśanâ, have been united with you.

original: indrākutsā vahamānā rathenā vām atyā api karṇe vahantu
analyzed: indrākutsā vahamānā rathena ā vām atyāḥ api karṇe vahantu
translated: O Indra and Kutsa, may they carry you on your chariot, may they carry you to the edge of the ear.

original: niḥ ṣīm adbhyo dhamatho niḥ ṣadhasthān maghono hṛdo varathas tamāṃsi
analyzed: niḥ sīm adbhyaḥ dhamathaḥ niḥ sadhasthāt maghonaḥ hṛdaḥ varathaḥ tamāṃsi
translated: Ye have driven away the waters from the pits, ye have driven away the hearts of the niggards, the darkness.

original: vātasya yuktān suyujaś cid aśvān kaviś cid eṣo ajagann avasyuḥ
analyzed: vātasya yuktān su yujaḥ cit aśvān kaviḥ cit eṣaḥ ajagan avasyuḥ
translated: The sage has come, even he who is in need, the well-yoked horses of Vāta are yoked.

original: viśve te atra marutaḥ sakhāya indra brahmāṇi taviṣīm avardhan
analyzed: viśve te atra marutaḥ sakhāyaḥ indra brahmāṇi taviṣīm avardhan
translated: All the Maruts here are thy friends, O Indra, they have increased thy strength, thy holy prayers.

original: sūraś cid ratham paritakmyāyām pūrvaṃ karad uparaṃ jūjuvāṃsam
analyzed: sūraḥ cit ratham paritakmyāyām pūrvam karat uparam jūjuvāṃsam
translated: The sun, in the conflict, makes the chariot of the one who is to be conquered go first, the one who is to be defeated goes last.

original: bharac cakram etaśaḥ saṃ riṇāti puro dadhat saniṣyati kratuṃ naḥ
analyzed: bharat cakram etaśaḥ sam riṇāti puras dadhat saniṣyati kratum naḥ
translated: The charioteer of the horse draws the wheel, he places the oblation in front, he will accomplish our sacrifice.

original: āyaṃ janā abhicakṣe jagāmendraḥ sakhāyaṃ sutasomam ichan
analyzed: ā ayam janāḥ abhicakṣe jagāma indraḥ sakhāyam suta somam ichan
translated: This people have looked upon him, Indra has come, desiring a friend who has pressed Soma.

original: vadan grāvāva vedim bhriyāte yasya jīram adhvaryavaś caranti
analyzed: vadan grāvā ava vedim bhriyāte yasya jīram adhvaryavaḥ caranti
translated: The pressing-stone speaks, it is placed on the altar, for whom the Adhvaryus move about with the residue.

original: ye cākananta cākananta nū te martā amṛta mo te aṃha āran
analyzed: ye cākananta cākananta nu te martāḥ amṛta mā u te aṃhaḥ āran
translated: Those who have desired, have desired, O immortal one, no evil has befallen thee, O mortal one.

original: vāvandhi yajyūṃr uta teṣu dhehy ojo janeṣu yeṣu te syāma🔽adardar utsam asṛjo vi khāni tvam arṇavān badbadhānāṃ aramṇāḥ
analyzed: vāvandhi yajyūṃr uta teṣu dhehi ojaḥ janeṣu yeṣu te syāma  adardar utsam asṛjaḥ vi khāni tvam arṇavān badbadhānām aramṇāḥ
translated: Bind the sacrificers, and bestow strength on those people among whom we may be.🔽Thou hast burst open the dam, thou hast opened the openings, thou hast made the swollen waters flow freely.

original: mahāntam indra parvataṃ vi yad vaḥ sṛjo vi dhārā ava dānavaṃ han
analyzed: mahāntam indra parvatam vi yat var sṛjaḥ vi dhārāḥ ava dānavam han
translated: O great Indra, when thou didst burst open the mountain, thou didst let loose the streams, thou didst slay the demon.

original: tvam utsām ṛtubhir badbadhānāṃ araṃha ūdhaḥ parvatasya vajrin
analyzed: tvam utsām ṛtubhiḥ badbadhānām araṃhaḥ ūdhaḥ parvatasya vajrin
translated: Thou, O wielder of the thunderbolt, hast loosened with the seasons the swollen dam of the mountain's udder.

original: ahiṃ cid ugra prayutaṃ śayānaṃ jaghanvāṃ indra taviṣīm adhatthāḥ
analyzed: ahim cit ugra prayutam śayānam jaghanvān indra taviṣīm adhatthāḥ
translated: Thou, O fierce one, hast struck down the sleeping Ahi, O Indra, thou hast placed thy strength in the knee.

original: tyasya cin mahato nir mṛgasya vadhar jaghāna taviṣībhir indraḥ
analyzed: tyasya cit mahataḥ niḥ mṛgasya vadhar jaghāna taviṣībhiḥ indraḥ
translated: He slew with his powers the great wild beast, the boar, Indra,

original: ya eka id apratir manyamāna ād asmād anyo ajaniṣṭa tavyān
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id apratiḥ manyamānaḥ āt asmāt anyaḥ ajaniṣṭa tavyān
translated: Who, alone and unrestrained, thought himself better than this one, born from him.

original: tyaṃ cid eṣāṃ svadhayā madantam miho napātaṃ suvṛdhaṃ tamogām
analyzed: tyam cit eṣām svadhayā madantam mihaḥ napātam suvṛdham tamaḥ gām
translated: Even him of them who rejoices in his own nature, the son of the waters, the very strong one, the dark one,

original: vṛṣaprabharmā dānavasya bhāmaṃ vajreṇa vajrī ni jaghāna śuṣṇam
analyzed: vṛṣa prabharmā dānavasya bhāmam vajreṇa vajrī ni jaghāna śuṣṇam
translated: The bull-strong one, with his thunderbolt, the wielder of the thunderbolt, struck down the Dānava's weapon, Śuṣṇa.

original: tyaṃ cid asya kratubhir niṣattam amarmaṇo vidad id asya marma🔽yad īṃ sukṣatra prabhṛtā madasya yuyutsantaṃ tamasi harmye dhāḥ
analyzed: tyam cit asya kratubhiḥ niṣattam amarmaṇaḥ vidat id asya marma  yat īm su kṣatra prabhṛtā madasya yuyutsantam tamasi harmye dhāḥ
translated: Even him who was firmly fixed by his own will, he, the one without a wound, found his wound,🔽Whom, O Sukṣatra, you placed in the darkness, in the house, eager for the gift, eager for the battle.

original: tyaṃ cid itthā katpayaṃ śayānam asūrye tamasi vāvṛdhānam
analyzed: tyam cit itthā katpayam śayānam asūrye tamasi vāvṛdhānam
translated: Even him who was lying here, the one to be pitied, grown in the darkness, in the absence of the sun,

original: taṃ cin mandāno vṛṣabhaḥ sutasyoccair indro apagūryā jaghāna
analyzed: tam cit mandānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ sutasya uccais indraḥ apagūrya jaghāna
translated: Even him, while rejoicing, the bull, with the pressed (Soma), Indra, the high-minded one, struck down.

original: ud yad indro mahate dānavāya vadhar yamiṣṭa saho apratītam
analyzed: ud yat indraḥ mahate dānavāya vadhar yamiṣṭa sahaḥ apratītam
translated: When Indra gave to the great Dānava the weapon, the blow, which was irresistible,

original: yad īṃ vajrasya prabhṛtau dadābha viśvasya jantor adhamaṃ cakāra
analyzed: yat īm vajrasya prabhṛtau dadābha viśvasya jantoḥ adhamam cakāra
translated: When he gave it in the throwing of the thunderbolt, he made it the lowest of all living beings.

original: tyaṃ cid arṇam madhupaṃ śayānam asinvaṃ vavram mahy ādad ugraḥ
analyzed: tyam cit arṇam madhupam śayānam asinvam vavram mahi ādat ugraḥ
translated: Even the sleeping honey-sweet water, the unwounded, the great, the strong one took away.

original: apādam atram mahatā vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācam🔽ko asya śuṣmaṃ taviṣīṃ varāta eko dhanā bharate apratītaḥ🔽ime cid asya jrayaso nu devī indrasyaujaso bhiyasā jihāte🔽ny asmai devī svadhitir jihīta indrāya gātur uśatīva yeme
analyzed: a pādam atram mahatā vadhena ni duryoṇe āvṛṇak mṛdhra vācam  kaḥ asya śuṣmam taviṣīm varāte ekaḥ dhanā bharate apratītaḥ  ime cit asya jrayasaḥ nu devī indrasya ojasaḥ bhiyasā jihāte  ni asmai devī svadhitiḥ jihīte indrāya gātuḥ uśatī iva yeme
translated: With great slaughter he has covered with his feet the reviler in his own abode.🔽Who can endure Indra's might and power, who alone brings home the spoil unconquered?

original: saṃ yad ojo yuvate viśvam ābhir anu svadhāvne kṣitayo namanta🔽ekaṃ nu tvā satpatim pāñcajanyaṃ jātaṃ śṛṇomi yaśasaṃ janeṣu🔽tam me jagṛbhra āśaso naviṣṭhaṃ doṣā vastor havamānāsa indram🔽evā hi tvām ṛtuthā yātayantam maghā viprebhyo dadataṃ śṛṇomi🔽kiṃ te brahmāṇo gṛhate sakhāyo ye tvāyā nidadhuḥ kāmam indra🔽mahi mahe tavase dīdhye nṝn indrāyetthā tavase atavyān🔽yo asmai sumatiṃ vājasātau stuto jane samaryaś ciketa
analyzed: sam yat ojaḥ yuvate viśvam ābhiḥ anu svadhāvne kṣitayaḥ namanta 🔽ekam nu tvā sat patim pāñcajanyam jātam śṛṇomi yaśasam janeṣu 🔽tam me jagṛbhre āśasaḥ naviṣṭham doṣā vastoḥ havamānāsaḥ indram 🔽eva hi tvām ṛtuthā yātayantam maghā viprebhyaḥ dadatam śṛṇomi 🔽kim te brahmāṇaḥ sakhāyaḥ ye tvāyā nidadhuḥ kāmam indra 🔽mahi mahe tavase dīdhye nṝn indrāya itthā tavase a tavyān 🔽yaḥ asmai sumatim vājasātau stutaḥ jane samaryaḥ ciketa
translated: Even these, the terrible, the divine, the mighty, the fearful, the irresistible, the irresistible, the irresistible, the irresistible, the irresistible, the irresistible, the irresistible, the irresistible, the irresistible, the irresistible,

original: sa tvaṃ na indra dhiyasāno arkair harīṇāṃ vṛṣan yoktram aśreḥ
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra dhiyasānaḥ arkaiḥ harīṇām vṛṣan yoktram aśreḥ
translated: So, O Indra, thou who art to be praised by hymns, O bull, yoke the two bay horses to draw the chariot

original: yā itthā maghavann anu joṣaṃ vakṣo abhi prāryaḥ sakṣi janān
analyzed: yāḥ itthā maghavan anu joṣam vakṣaḥ abhi pra aryaḥ sakṣi janān
translated: O bountiful one, who, as thou likest, wouldst carry the people to the breast of the noble one

original: na te ta indrābhy asmad ṛṣvāyuktāso abrahmatā yad asan
analyzed: na te te indra abhi asmat ṛṣvāḥ a yuktāsaḥ a brahma tā yat asan
translated: Those, O Indra, who are not yoked to us, O lofty one, who are not devoted to prayer, are not thine

original: tiṣṭhā ratham adhi taṃ vajrahastā raśmiṃ deva yamase svaśvaḥ
analyzed: tiṣṭha ratham adhi tam vajra hasta ā raśmim deva yamase su aśvaḥ
translated: Stand on that chariot, O thou whose hand wields the thunderbolt, O god, harness thy own good horses

original: purū yat ta indra santy ukthā gave cakarthorvarāsu yudhyan
analyzed: purū yat te indra santi ukthā gave cakartha urvarāsu yudhyan
translated: Many are the praises, O Indra, that are thine, when thou didst make the cow in the battles for the uplands

original: tatakṣe sūryāya cid okasi sve vṛṣā samatsu dāsasya nāma cit
analyzed: tatakṣe sūryāya cit okasi sve vṛṣā samatsu dāsasya nāma cit
translated: Thou didst carve out the name of the Dāsa even in the abode of the sun, O bull, in the battles

original: vayaṃ te ta indra ye ca naraḥ śardho jajñānā yātāś ca rathāḥ
analyzed: vayam te te indra ye ca naraḥ śardhaḥ jajñānāḥ yātāḥ ca rathāḥ
translated: We are thine, O Indra, and those men who have been born in the host, and the chariots that have gone forth

original: āsmāñ jagamyād ahiśuṣma satvā bhago na havyaḥ prabhṛtheṣu cāruḥ
analyzed: ā asmām jagamyāt ahi śuṣma satvā bhagaḥ na havyaḥ prabhṛtheṣu cāruḥ
translated: Let him come to us, the one with the strength of a snake, lovely like Bhaga, to be invoked in sacrifices

original: papṛkṣeṇyam indra tve hy ojo nṛmṇāni ca nṛtamāno amartaḥ
analyzed: papṛkṣeṇyam indra tve hi ojaḥ nṛmṇāni ca nṛtamānaḥ amartaḥ
translated: The strength that is to be desired, O Indra, is in thee, and the manly deeds, O immortal one, who rejoices in battles

original: sa na enīṃ vasavāno rayiṃ dāḥ prārya stuṣe tuvimaghasya dānam
analyzed: sa naḥ enīm vasavānaḥ rayim dāḥ pra aryaḥ stuṣe tuvi maghasya dānam
translated: Give us that variegated wealth, O wealthy one, I praise the gift of the very bountiful one

original: evā na indrotibhir ava pāhi gṛṇataḥ śūra kārūn
analyzed: eva naḥ indra ūtibhiḥ ava pāhi gṛṇataḥ śūra kārūn
translated: Thus, O Indra, protect us with thy powers, O hero, the singers, the helpers

original: uta tvacaṃ dadato vājasātau piprīhi madhvaḥ suṣutasya cāroḥ
analyzed: uta tvacam dadataḥ vājasātau piprīhi madhvaḥ suṣutasya cāroḥ
translated: And when you give the skin in the battle for strength, delight in the sweetness of the well-pressed drink.

original: uta tye mā paurukutsyasya sūres trasadasyor hiraṇino rarāṇāḥ
analyzed: uta tye mā paurukutsyasya sūreḥ trasadasyoḥ hiraṇinaḥ rarāṇāḥ
translated: And may those tawny ones of Purukutsa's son Trasadasyu, bestowing gold,

original: vahantu mā daśa śyetāso asya gairikṣitasya kratubhir nu saśce
analyzed: vahantu mā daśa śyetāsaḥ asya gairikṣitasya kratubhiḥ nu saśce
translated: Carry me with the impetuous one's powers.

original: uta tye mā mārutāśvasya śoṇāḥ kratvāmaghāso vidathasya rātau
analyzed: uta tye mā mārutāśvasya śoṇāḥ kratvāmaghāsaḥ vidathasya rātau
translated: And may those red horses of Marut's son, the wise, in the gift of the sacrifice,

original: sahasrā me cyavatāno dadāna ānūkam aryo vapuṣe nārcat
analyzed: sahasrā me cyavatānaḥ dadānaḥ ānūkam aryaḥ vapuṣe nā arcat
translated: Give me a thousand, O you who are free from enemies, as a present for the dear form.

original: uta tye mā dhvanyasya juṣṭā lakṣmaṇyasya suruco yatānāḥ
analyzed: uta tye mā dhvanyasya juṣṭāḥ lakṣmaṇyasya su rucaḥ yatānāḥ
translated: And may those dear to Dhvanîya and Lakṣmaṇîya, of good radiance, when they have come,

original: mahnā rāyaḥ saṃvaraṇasya ṛṣer vrajaṃ na gāvaḥ prayatā api gman
analyzed: mahnā rāyaḥ saṃvaraṇasya ṛṣeḥ vrajam na gāvaḥ prayatāḥ api gman
translated: With the greatness of the sacrifice of Saṃvaraṇa the Ṛṣi, go to the cow-pen as cows are led.

original: ajātaśatrum ajarā svarvaty anu svadhāmitā dasmam īyate
analyzed: ajāta śatrum ajarā svarvatī anu svadhā amitā dasmam īyate
translated: The one who has no enemy, the immortal one, the one who dwells in heaven, goes to the wondrous one according to his own nature.

original: sunotana pacata brahmavāhase puruṣṭutāya prataraṃ dadhātana
analyzed: sunotana pacata brahma vāhase puruṣṭutāya prataram dadhātana
translated: Press out (the Soma), cook (the oblations) for the Brahman priest, give a ford to the much-praised one.

original: ā yaḥ somena jaṭharam apipratāmandata maghavā madhvo andhasaḥ
analyzed: ā yaḥ somena jaṭharam apiprata amandata maghavā madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: He who has filled his belly with Soma, the bountiful one, is delighted with the sweet juice.

original: yad īm mṛgāya hantave mahāvadhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭim uśanā vadhaṃ yamat
analyzed: yat īm mṛgāya hantave mahā vadhaḥ sahasra bhṛṣṭim uśanāḥ vadham yamat
translated: When I sent the great killer, the thousand-pointed weapon, to kill the deer, to Yama.

original: yo asmai ghraṃsa uta vā ya ūdhani somaṃ sunoti bhavati dyumāṃ aha
analyzed: yaḥ asmai ghraṃse uta vā yaḥ ūdhani somam sunoti bhavati dyumān aha
translated: He who presses Soma for him, whether in the trough or on the udder, becomes resplendent.

original: apāpa śakras tatanuṣṭim ūhati tanūśubhram maghavā yaḥ kavāsakhaḥ🔽yasyāvadhīt pitaraṃ yasya mātaraṃ yasya śakro bhrātaraṃ nāta īṣate
analyzed: apa apa śakraḥ tatanuṣṭim ūhati tanū śubhram maghavā yaḥ kavāsakhaḥ  yasya avadhīt pitaram yasya mātaram yasya śakraḥ bhrātaram na atas īṣate
translated: The sinless Śakra removes his misfortune, the bountiful one who has good comrades.🔽Whose father he has slain, whose mother, whose brother, Śakra does not fear.

original: vetīd v asya prayatā yataṃkaro na kilbiṣād īṣate vasva ākaraḥ
analyzed: veti id u asya prayatā yataṃkaraḥ na kilbiṣāt īṣate vasvaḥ ākaraḥ
translated: He knows his own, the one who acts with care; he does not fear from sin, he is the source of wealth.

original: na pañcabhir daśabhir vaṣṭy ārabhaṃ nāsunvatā sacate puṣyatā cana
analyzed: na pañcabhiḥ daśabhiḥ vaṣṭi ārabham na a sunvatā sacate puṣyatā cana
translated: He does not wait for five or ten; he does not associate with one who does not offer, even if he is prosperous.

original: jināti ved amuyā hanti vā dhunir ā devayum bhajati gomati vraje
analyzed: jināti vā id amuyā hanti vā dhuniḥ ā devayum bhajati gomati vraje
translated: He conquers with his own strength, he strikes with his thunderbolt; he favors the one who is devoted to the gods in a cow-rich pasture.

original: vitvakṣaṇaḥ samṛtau cakramāsajo 'sunvato viṣuṇaḥ sunvato vṛdhaḥ
analyzed: vitvakṣaṇaḥ samṛtau cakramāsajaḥ sunvataḥ viṣuṇaḥ sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ
translated: The watchful one, in the two truths, has made the wheel his companion; he is the punisher of the non-offerer, the promoter of the offerer.

original: indro viśvasya damitā vibhīṣaṇo yathāvaśaṃ nayati dāsam āryaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ viśvasya damitā vibhīṣaṇaḥ yathāvaśam nayati dāsam āryaḥ
translated: Indra, the tamer of all, the one who inspires fear, leads the slave according to his will, the noble one.

original: sam īm paṇer ajati bhojanam muṣe vi dāśuṣe bhajati sūnaraṃ vasu
analyzed: sam īm paṇeḥ ajati bhojanam muṣe vi dāśuṣe bhajati sūnaram vasu
translated: He brings the food of the one who is to be fed, he takes away the food of the one who offers; he bestows excellent wealth.

original: durge cana dhriyate viśva ā puru jano yo asya taviṣīm acukrudhat
analyzed: durge cana dhriyate viśvaḥ ā puru janaḥ yaḥ asya taviṣīm acukrudhat
translated: Even in a difficult situation, he is supported by all, the people who have become angry at his power.

original: saṃ yaj janau sudhanau viśvaśardhasāv aved indro maghavā goṣu śubhriṣu
analyzed: sam yat janau su dhanau viśva śardhasau avet indraḥ maghavā goṣu śubhriṣu
translated: When the two rich people, all-powerful, are united, Indra, the wealthy one, knows about the white cows.

original: yujaṃ hy anyam akṛta pravepany ud īṃ gavyaṃ sṛjate satvabhir dhuniḥ
analyzed: yujam hi anyam akṛta pravepanī ud īm gavyam sṛjate satvabhiḥ dhuniḥ
translated: For he has made another trembling one his companion. The shaker sends forth the one with cattle with his heroes.

original: sahasrasām āgniveśiṃ gṛṇīṣe śatrim agna upamāṃ ketum aryaḥ
analyzed: sahasra sām āgniveśim gṛṇīṣe śatrim agne upamām ketum aryaḥ
translated: I praise the thousand-winning one who dwells with Agni, the enemy, Agni, the standard of the noble one.

original: tasmā āpaḥ saṃyataḥ pīpayanta tasmin kṣatram amavat tveṣam astu
analyzed: tasmai āpaḥ saṃyataḥ pīpayanta tasmin kṣatram amavat tveṣam astu
translated: From him the waters, well-controlled, have flowed. In him may the powerful, awe-inspiring lordship be.

original: yas te sādhiṣṭho 'vasa indra kratuṣ ṭam ā bhara
analyzed: yaḥ te sādhiṣṭhaḥ vaso indra kratuḥ ṭam ā bhara
translated: O Indra, bring that power of yours which is most helpful to us,

original: asmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sasniṃ vājeṣu duṣṭaram
analyzed: asmabhyam carṣaṇī saham sasnim vājeṣu duṣṭaram
translated: Which conquers the people, which is strong, hard to overcome in battles.

original: yad indra te catasro yac chūra santi tisraḥ
analyzed: yat indra te catasraḥ yat śūra santi tisraḥ
translated: O Indra, O hero, if you have four, if you have three,

original: yad vā pañca kṣitīnām avas tat su na ā bhara
analyzed: yat vā pañca kṣitīnām avaḥ tat su naḥ ā bhara
translated: Or if you have five of the abodes, bring that to us.

original: ā te 'vo vareṇyaṃ vṛṣantamasya hūmahe
analyzed: ā te vaḥ vareṇyam vṛṣantamasya hūmahe
translated: We invoke your most excellent favor, O most powerful one, of this (sacrifice).

original: vṛṣajūtir hi jajñiṣa ābhūbhir indra turvaṇiḥ
analyzed: vṛṣa jūtiḥ hi jajñiṣe ābhūbhiḥ indra turvaṇiḥ
translated: For you are born with the powers of a bull, O Indra, for the sake of Turvaga.

original: vṛṣā hy asi rādhase jajñiṣe vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ🔽svakṣatraṃ te dhṛṣan manaḥ satrāham indra pauṃsyam
analyzed: vṛṣā hi asi rādhase jajñiṣe vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ  svakṣatram te dhṛṣat manaḥ satrāham indra pauṃsyam
translated: For you are a bull for the gift (of Soma), you are born, O bull, your strength.🔽Your mind is bold, your lordship is firm, O Indra, your manliness is a stronghold.

original: tvaṃ tam indra martyam amitrayantam adrivaḥ
analyzed: tvam tam indra martyam amitrayantam adrivas
translated: You, O Indra, the bolt-wielder, that mortal who is hostile to us,

original: sarvarathā śatakrato ni yāhi śavasas pate🔽tvām id vṛtrahantama janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
analyzed: sarvarathā śatakrato ni yāhi śavasaḥ pate  tvām id vṛtra hantama janāsaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: O Indra, come to all our chariots, O Lord of Strength!🔽You, O best of Vritra-slayers, are invoked by the people with strewn sacrificial grass

original: ugram pūrvīṣu pūrvyaṃ havante vājasātaye🔽asmākam indra duṣṭaram puroyāvānam ājiṣu
analyzed: ugram pūrvīṣu pūrvyam havante vājasātaye  asmākam indra duṣṭaram puras yāvānam ājiṣu
translated: For the sake of gaining strength, as the most powerful in many battles.🔽O Indra, our invincible chariot, which goes in front in the races,

original: sayāvānaṃ dhanedhane vājayantam avā ratham
analyzed: sa yāvānam dhanedhane vājayantam ava ratham
translated: Which is victorious in every battle, which is urged on to gain booty, - may it come to us.

original: asmākam indrehi no ratham avā puraṃdhyā
analyzed: asmākam indra ihi naḥ ratham ava puraṃdhyā
translated: O Indra, come to our chariot with your highest favour.

original: vayaṃ śaviṣṭha vāryaṃ divi śravo dadhīmahi divi stomam manāmahe
analyzed: vayam śaviṣṭha vāryam divi śravaḥ dadhīmahi divi stomam manāmahe
translated: O most powerful one, we wish to obtain in heaven the highest prize, in heaven we form the hymn of praise.

original: sa ā gamad indro yo vasūnāṃ ciketad dātuṃ dāmano rayīṇām🔽dhanvacaro na vaṃsagas tṛṣāṇaś cakamānaḥ pibatu dugdham aṃśum
analyzed: saḥ ā gamat indraḥ yaḥ vasūnām ciketat dātum dāmanaḥ rayīṇām  dhanva caraḥ na vaṃsagaḥ tṛṣāṇaḥ cakamānaḥ pibatu dugdham aṃśum
translated: May Indra come, who knows how to bestow wealth and treasures as a bountiful giver.🔽Like a thirsty deer roaming the desert, eager, may he drink the milk-filled stalk.

original: ā te hanū harivaḥ śūra śipre ruhat somo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhe
analyzed: ā te hanū harivas śūra śipre ruhat somaḥ na parvatasya pṛṣṭhe
translated: O Indra, the tawny-coloured Soma juice rises to your jaws, O hero, on the back of the mountain.

original: anu tvā rājann arvato na hinvan gīrbhir madema puruhūta viśve
analyzed: anu tvā rājan arvataḥ na hinvan gīrbhiḥ madema puruhūta viśve
translated: O King, may we all, O much-invoked one, rejoice in you, as in a swift horse, with our songs.

original: cakraṃ na vṛttam puruhūta vepate mano bhiyā me amater id adrivaḥ
analyzed: cakram na vṛttam puruhūta vepate manaḥ bhiyā me amateḥ id adrivas
translated: The wheel, O much-invoked one, trembles like a circle, my mind is agitated with fear of death, O wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: rathād adhi tvā jaritā sadāvṛdha kuvin nu stoṣan maghavan purūvasuḥ
analyzed: rathāt adhi tvā jaritā sadāvṛdha kuvid nu stoṣat maghavan purūvasuḥ
translated: O you who are always to be praised, O Maghavan, from your chariot, on what account should the one who praises you, O you who possess much wealth, praise you?

original: eṣa grāveva jaritā ta indreyarti vācam bṛhad āśuṣāṇaḥ
analyzed: eṣa grāvā iva jaritā te indra iyarti vācam bṛhat āśuṣāṇaḥ
translated: This one, like a stone, the singer, O Indra, sends forth his voice, seeking great things.

original: pra savyena maghavan yaṃsi rāyaḥ pra dakṣiṇid dharivo mā vi venaḥ🔽vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhatu dyaur vṛṣā vṛṣabhyāṃ vahase haribhyām
analyzed: pra savyena maghavan yaṃsi rāyaḥ pra dakṣiṇit harivas mā vi venaḥ  vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇam vardhatu dyauḥ vṛṣā vṛṣabhyām vahase haribhyām
translated: With thy left, O bountiful one, bestow wealth, with thy right, O giver of boons, do not be niggardly.🔽May the bull, O sky, make thee, the bull, grow. With two bulls thou carriest, with two tawny ones.

original: sa no vṛṣā vṛṣarathaḥ suśipra vṛṣakrato vṛṣā vajrin bhare dhāḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣā vṛṣa rathaḥ su śipra vṛṣa krato vṛṣā vajrin bhare dhāḥ
translated: O bull, O thou with the beautiful eyebrows, O bull, O thou of mighty thought, O bull, O thou who hast the thunderbolt, support us in battle.

original: yo rohitau vājinau vājinīvān tribhiḥ śataiḥ sacamānāv adiṣṭa
analyzed: yaḥ rohitau vājinau vājinīvān tribhiḥ śataiḥ sacamānau adiṣṭa
translated: He who, rich in strength, has directed two red strong horses, accompanied by three hundred,

original: yūne sam asmai kṣitayo namantāṃ śrutarathāya maruto duvoyā
analyzed: yūne sam asmai kṣitayaḥ namantām śruta rathāya marutaḥ duvoyā
translated: To him, O Maruts, whose chariot is renowned, let the people bow down, ready to serve.

original: sam bhānunā yatate sūryasyājuhvāno ghṛtapṛṣṭhaḥ svañcāḥ
analyzed: sam bhānunā yatate sūryasya ājuhvānaḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ svañcāḥ
translated: He who is invoked, whose back is anointed with ghee, strives with the light of the sun.

original: tasmā amṛdhrā uṣaso vy uchān ya indrāya sunavāmety āha
analyzed: tasmai amṛdhrāḥ uṣasaḥ vi uchān yaḥ indrāya sunavāma iti āha
translated: For him, for Indra, let the unfailing dawns rise, who says, 'Let us press for Indra.'

original: samiddhāgnir vanavat stīrṇabarhir yuktagrāvā sutasomo jarāte🔽grāvāṇo yasyeṣiraṃ vadanty ayad adhvaryur haviṣāva sindhum
analyzed: samiddha agniḥ vanavat stīrṇa barhiḥ yukta grāvā suta somaḥ jarāte  grāvāṇaḥ yasya iṣiram vadanti ayat adhvaryuḥ haviṣā ava sindhum
translated: With his fire kindled, his grass strewn, his pressing-stone yoked, his Soma pressed, he is ready.🔽For him whose pressing-stones speak loudly, whose Adhvaryu sends the river of oblations,

original: vadhūr iyam patim ichanty eti ya īṃ vahāte mahiṣīm iṣirām
analyzed: vadhūḥ iyam patim icchantī eti yaḥ īm vahāte mahiṣīm iṣirām
translated: This young wife goes, seeking a husband, whom ye two carry, the strong, the great queen.

original: āsya śravasyād ratha ā ca ghoṣāt purū sahasrā pari vartayāte
analyzed: ā asya śravasyāt rathaḥ ā ca ghoṣāt purū sahasrā pari vartayāte
translated: From the sound of his mouth, from the rattle of his chariot, he whirls around many thousands.

original: na sa rājā vyathate yasminn indras tīvraṃ somam pibati gosakhāyam
analyzed: na sa rājā vyathate yasmin indraḥ tīvram somam pibati go sakhāyam
translated: The king in whom Indra drinks the strong Soma together with the cows is not afflicted.

original: ā satvanair ajati hanti vṛtraṃ kṣeti kṣitīḥ subhago nāma puṣyan
analyzed: ā satvanaiḥ ajati hanti vṛtram kṣeti kṣitīḥ subhagaḥ nāma puṣyan
translated: He goes with the heroes, he slays Vṛtra, he rests, the prosperous one, nourishing his name.

original: puṣyāt kṣeme abhi yoge bhavāty ubhe vṛtau saṃyatī saṃ jayāti
analyzed: puṣyāt kṣeme abhi yoge bhavāti ubhe vṛtau saṃyatī sam jayāti
translated: He prospers in peace, in the encounter he becomes, he conquers both the surrounded and the attacking.

original: priyaḥ sūrye priyo agnā bhavāti ya indrāya sutasomo dadāśat
analyzed: priyaḥ sūrye priyaḥ agnā bhavāti yaḥ indrāya suta somaḥ dadāśat
translated: He becomes dear to the sun, dear to Agni, he who offers to Indra the Soma that is pressed.

original: uroṣ ṭa indra rādhaso vibhvī rātiḥ śatakrato
analyzed: uroḥ te indra rādhasaḥ vibhvī rātiḥ śatakrato
translated: O Indra, the gift of the generous one is ready for you, O you of a hundred powers.

original: adhā no viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā sukṣatra maṃhaya
analyzed: adhā naḥ viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā su kṣatra maṃhaya
translated: Now, O you who are worshipped by all, O you of good rule, exalt our glory.

original: yad īm indra śravāyyam iṣaṃ śaviṣṭha dadhiṣe
analyzed: yat īm indra śravāyyam iṣam śaviṣṭha dadhiṣe
translated: O Indra, when you, O most powerful one, possess the food that is worthy of fame,

original: paprathe dīrghaśruttamaṃ hiraṇyavarṇa duṣṭaram
analyzed: paprathe dīrghaśruttamam hiraṇya varṇa duṣṭaram
translated: You extend it, most famous, golden-hued, hard to bear.

original: śuṣmāso ye te adrivo mehanā ketasāpaḥ
analyzed: śuṣmāsaḥ ye te adrivas mehanā ketasāpaḥ
translated: O you who have thunder, the powers that are yours, the impetuous ones, the swift ones,

original: ubhā devāv abhiṣṭaye divaś ca gmaś ca rājathaḥ
analyzed: ubhā devau abhiṣṭaye divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca rājathaḥ
translated: You two gods rule for the protection of both heaven and earth.

original: uto no asya kasya cid dakṣasya tava vṛtrahan
analyzed: uta u naḥ asya kasya cit dakṣasya tava vṛtrahan
translated: And for us of this one, of your power, O slayer of Vrtra,

original: asmabhyaṃ nṛmṇam ā bharāsmabhyaṃ nṛmaṇasyase
analyzed: asmabhyam nṛmṇam ā bhara asmabhyam nṛmaṇasyase
translated: Bring us manliness, for us you are the bestower of manliness.

original: nū ta ābhir abhiṣṭibhis tava śarmañ chatakrato
analyzed: nu te ābhiḥ abhiṣṭibhiḥ tava śarmam śatakrato
translated: Now with these aids of thine, O Śarman, O thou of a hundred powers,

original: indra syāma sugopāḥ śūra syāma sugopāḥ
analyzed: indra syāma su gopāḥ śūra syāma su gopāḥ
translated: May we be well protected by Indra, O hero, may we be well protected.

original: yad indra citra mehanāsti tvādātam adrivaḥ
analyzed: yat indra citra mehanā asti tvādātam adrivas
translated: If, O Indra, there be anything wonderful to be gained by thee, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: rādhas tan no vidadvasa ubhayāhasty ā bhara
analyzed: rādhaḥ tat naḥ vidadvaso ubhayāhasti ā bhara
translated: That bounty, O thou who hast all good things, bring to us with both hands.

original: yan manyase vareṇyam indra dyukṣaṃ tad ā bhara
analyzed: yat manyase vareṇyam indra dyukṣam tat ā bhara
translated: Whatever thou thinkest to be most excellent, O Indra, fit for the sky, bring that.

original: vidyāma tasya te vayam akūpārasya dāvane
analyzed: vidyāma tasya te vayam akūpārasya dāvane
translated: May we know that of thine, O thou of boundless bounty, in order to give.

original: yat te ditsu prarādhyam mano asti śrutam bṛhat
analyzed: yat te ditsu prarādhyam manaḥ asti śrutam bṛhat
translated: That mind of thine which is willing to bestow, which is renowned and great,

original: tena dṛḷhā cid adriva ā vājaṃ darṣi sātaye
analyzed: tena dṛḍhā cit adrivas ā vājam darṣi sātaye
translated: With that, O thou of the thunderbolt, do thou break through even strong things, and win booty.

original: maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vo maghonāṃ rājānaṃ carṣaṇīnām
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭham vaḥ maghonām rājānam carṣaṇīnām
translated: Most bountiful are ye of the rich, the king of men,

original: indram upa praśastaye pūrvībhir jujuṣe giraḥ
analyzed: indram upa praśastaye pūrvībhiḥ jujuṣe giraḥ
translated: Indra, for praise, with many songs thou acceptest.

original: asmā it kāvyaṃ vaca uktham indrāya śaṃsyam
analyzed: asmai id kāvyam vacaḥ uktham indrāya śaṃsyam
translated: This thought, this hymn is to be extolled for Indra.

original: tasmā u brahmavāhase giro vardhanty atrayo giraḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ
analyzed: tasmai u brahma vāhase giraḥ vardhanti atrayaḥ giraḥ śumbhanti atrayaḥ
translated: For him, the bearer of prayer, the Atri hymns are exalted, the Atri hymns are adorned.

original: ā yāhy adribhiḥ sutaṃ somaṃ somapate piba
analyzed: ā yāhi adribhiḥ sutam somam soma pate piba
translated: Come hither with the stones to the pressed Soma, O lord of the Soma, drink.

original: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
analyzed: vṛṣan indra vṛṣabhiḥ vṛtra hantama
translated: O bull, O Indra, with the bulls, O Vr̥itra-slayer,

original: vṛṣā grāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṃ sutaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā grāvā vṛṣā madaḥ vṛṣā somaḥ ayam sutaḥ
translated: The stone is a bull, the rapture is a bull, this Soma is pressed out, a bull.

original: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
analyzed: vṛṣan indra vṛṣabhiḥ vṛtra hantama
translated: O bull, O Indra, best at slaying Vr̥itra,

original: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ huve vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇam huve vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: I call on thee, the bull, the mighty one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, with wondrous aids.

original: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
analyzed: vṛṣan indra vṛṣabhiḥ vṛtra hantama
translated: O bull, O Indra, best at slaying Vr̥itra,

original: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhas turāṣāṭ chuṣmī rājā vṛtrahā somapāvā
analyzed: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhaḥ turāṣāh śuṣmī rājā vṛtra hā soma pāvā
translated: The vigorous, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the bull, the conqueror, the strong, the king, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the drinker of the Soma,

original: yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsad arvāṅ mādhyaṃdine savane matsad indraḥ
analyzed: yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsat arvāṅ mādhyaṃdine savane matsat indraḥ
translated: Having yoked thy two bay steeds, may Indra come hither to the midday libation, to rejoice.

original: yat tvā sūrya svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ
analyzed: yat tvā sūrya svarbhānuḥ tamasā vidhyat āsuraḥ
translated: When, O Sûrya, the Asura Svarbhânu pierced thee with darkness,

original: akṣetravid yathā mugdho bhuvanāny adīdhayuḥ
analyzed: a kṣetra vid yathā mugdhaḥ bhuvanāni adīdhayuḥ
translated: As one ignorant of the field, the worlds were agitated.

original: svarbhānor adha yad indra māyā avo divo vartamānā avāhan
analyzed: svarbhānoḥ adha yat indra māyāḥ avas divaḥ vartamānāḥ avāhan
translated: When, O Indra, thou didst overthrow the magic of Svarbhânu, which was spreading from the sky,

original: gūḷhaṃ sūryaṃ tamasāpavratena turīyeṇa brahmaṇāvindad atriḥ
analyzed: gūḍham sūryam tamasā apavratena turīyeṇa brahmaṇā avindat atriḥ
translated: With the fourth prayer Atri found the hidden Sûrya, with darkness as his covering.

original: mā mām imaṃ tava santam atra irasyā drugdho bhiyasā ni gārīt
analyzed: mā mām imam tava santam atra irasyā drugdhaḥ bhiyasā ni gārīt
translated: Let not this wicked one, with fear, with imprecation, harm me, who am here, who am thine.

original: tvam mitro asi satyarādhās tau mehāvataṃ varuṇaś ca rājā
analyzed: tvam mitraḥ asi satya rādhāḥ tau mā iha āvatam varuṇaḥ ca rājā
translated: Thou art Mitra, O truthful one, and thou, O king Varuna, have helped me.

original: grāvṇo brahmā yuyujānaḥ saparyan kīriṇā devān namasopaśikṣan
analyzed: grāvṇaḥ brahmā yuyujānaḥ saparyan kīriṇā devān namasā upaśikṣan
translated: The Brahman, the priest, yoking the pressing-stones, worshipping, with the Kîra hymn, instructing the gods with reverence,

original: atriḥ sūryasya divi cakṣur ādhāt svarbhānor apa māyā aghukṣat
analyzed: atriḥ sūryasya divi cakṣuḥ ādhāt svarbhānoḥ apa māyāḥ aghukṣat
translated: Atri hath set the eye of Sûrya in the sky: he hath destroyed the magic of Svarbhânu.

original: yaṃ vai sūryaṃ svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ
analyzed: yam vai sūryam svarbhānuḥ tamasā vidhyat āsuraḥ
translated: When the demon Svarbhānu with darkness pierced the sun,

original: atrayas tam anv avindan nahy anye aśaknuvan
analyzed: atrayaḥ tam anu avindan nahi anye aśaknuvan
translated: The Atri-s found him, for others were not able.🔽Who, O Mitra and Varuṇa, observing the truth, would protect us

original: ko nu vām mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāyan divo vā mahaḥ pārthivasya vā de
analyzed: kaḥ nu vām mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāyan divaḥ vā mahaḥ pārthivasya vā de
translated: In the abode of truth, or in the great heaven, or on earth, O gods,

original: ṛtasya vā sadasi trāsīthāṃ no yajñāyate vā paśuṣo na vājān
analyzed: ṛtasya vā sadasi trāsīthām naḥ yajñāyate vā paśu sas na vājān
translated: Or in the performance of sacrifice, or in cattle, or in strength?

original: te no mitro varuṇo aryamāyur indra ṛbhukṣā maruto juṣanta
analyzed: te naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ aryamā āyuḥ indraḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ marutaḥ juṣanta
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman, Ṛbhukṣan, Indra, the Maruts accept our life.

original: namobhir vā ye dadhate suvṛktiṃ stomaṃ rudrāya mīḷhuṣe sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: namobhiḥ vā ye dadhate suvṛktim stomam rudrāya mīḍhuṣe sajoṣāḥ
translated: Those who, with homage, offer good praise to Rudra, the rain-giver, in unison,

original: ā vāṃ yeṣṭhāśvinā huvadhyai vātasya patman rathyasya puṣṭau
analyzed: ā vām yeṣṭha aśvinā huvadhyai vātasya patman rathyasya puṣṭau
translated: You, O most desirable Aśvins, I invoke on the path of the wind, on the path of the chariot, for prosperity.

original: uta vā divo asurāya manma prāndhāṃsīva yajyave bharadhvam
analyzed: uta vā divaḥ asurāya manma pra andhāṃsi iva yajyave bharadhvam
translated: Or bring to the Asura of the sky a hymn, as if bringing forward oblations to the sacrificer.

original: pra sakṣaṇo divyaḥ kaṇvahotā trito divaḥ sajoṣā vāto agniḥ
analyzed: pra sakṣaṇaḥ divyaḥ kaṇva hotā tritaḥ divaḥ sajoṣāḥ vātaḥ agniḥ
translated: The divine messenger, the Kṇva priest, Trita of the sky, Vāta, Agni in unison with the sky,

original: pūṣā bhagaḥ prabhṛthe viśvabhojā ājiṃ na jagmur āśvaśvatamāḥ
analyzed: pūṣā bhagaḥ prabhṛthe viśva bhojāḥ ājim na jagmuḥ āśvaśvatamāḥ
translated: Pūṣan, Bhaga, all-nourishing in the assembly, have gone to the race as if to horses.

original: pra vo rayiṃ yuktāśvam bharadhvaṃ rāya eṣe 'vase dadhīta dhīḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ rayim yukta aśvam bharadhvam rāyaḥ eṣe vase dadhīta dhīḥ
translated: Bring forth your wealth with yoked horses, set your thought in motion for the sake of wealth and help.

original: suśeva evair auśijasya hotā ye va evā marutas turāṇām
analyzed: su śevaḥ evaiḥ auśijasya hotā ye vaḥ evā marutaḥ turāṇām
translated: The priest of Auśija, very gracious with the offerings, those offerings of the swift Maruts,

original: pra vo vāyuṃ rathayujaṃ kṛṇudhvam pra devaṃ vipram panitāram arkaiḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ vāyum ratha yujam kṛṇudhvam pra devam vipram panitāram arkaiḥ
translated: Make Vayu, who yokes the chariot, yours, make the god, the sage, the impeller with hymns,

original: iṣudhyava ṛtasāpaḥ puraṃdhīr vasvīr no atra patnīr ā dhiye dhuḥ
analyzed: iṣudhyavaḥ ṛtasāpaḥ puraṃdhīḥ vasvīḥ naḥ atra patnīḥ ā dhiye dhuḥ
translated: The active ones, the guardians of truth, the wise ones; may the wives bring us wealth here in our thought.

original: upa va eṣe vandyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ pra yahvī divaś citayadbhir arkaiḥ
analyzed: upa vaḥ eṣe vandyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ pra yahvī divaḥ citayadbhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: I will approach with these praiseworthy powers, with the young, far-seeing hymns of heaven,

original: uṣāsānaktā viduṣīva viśvam ā hā vahato martyāya yajñam🔽abhi vo arce poṣyāvato nṝn vāstoṣ patiṃ tvaṣṭāraṃ rarāṇaḥ
analyzed: uṣāsānaktā viduṣī iva viśvam ā hā vahataḥ martyāya yajñam  abhi vaḥ arce poṣyāvataḥ nṝn vāstoḥ patim tvaṣṭāram rarāṇaḥ
translated: Dawn and Night, as if knowing all, bring the sacrifice to the mortal one.🔽I praise you, O men who are to be nourished, I delight Vastospati and Tvastr,

original: dhanyā sajoṣā dhiṣaṇā namobhir vanaspatīṃr oṣadhī rāya eṣe
analyzed: dhanyā sajoṣāḥ dhiṣaṇā namobhiḥ vanaspatīṃr oṣadhīḥ rāyaḥ eṣe
translated: The bountiful, the Dhisanas of one accord with salutations, the trees and plants, for the sake of wealth.

original: tuje nas tane parvatāḥ santu svaitavo ye vasavo na vīrāḥ
analyzed: tuje naḥ tane parvatāḥ santu svaitavaḥ ye vasavaḥ na vīrāḥ
translated: May the mountains be easy for us in the contest, the Vasus who are like our heroes.

original: panita āptyo yajataḥ sadā no vardhān naḥ śaṃsaṃ naryo abhiṣṭau
analyzed: panitaḥ āptyaḥ yajataḥ sadā naḥ vardhāt naḥ śaṃsam naryaḥ abhiṣṭau
translated: May Aptáya, the sacrificer, always help us; may the man, the praiser, strengthen us.

original: vṛṣṇo astoṣi bhūmyasya garbhaṃ trito napātam apāṃ suvṛkti
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ astoṣi bhūmyasya garbham tritaḥ napātam apām suvṛkti
translated: I praise the son of the mighty one, the child of the earth, Trita, the offspring of the waters, with good praise.

original: gṛṇīte agnir etarī na śūṣaiḥ śociṣkeśo ni riṇāti vanā
analyzed: gṛṇīte agniḥ etarī na śūṣaiḥ śociṣkeśaḥ ni riṇāti vanā
translated: Agni, the red-haired one, with his powers, burns the woods.

original: kathā mahe rudriyāya bravāma kad rāye cikituṣe bhagāya
analyzed: kathā mahe rudriyāya bravāma kad rāye cikituṣe bhagāya
translated: How shall we speak to the great one, to Rudra, how to the discerning Bhaga for wealth?

original: āpa oṣadhīr uta no 'vantu dyaur vanā girayo vṛkṣakeśāḥ🔽śṛṇotu na ūrjām patir giraḥ sa nabhas tarīyāṃ iṣiraḥ parijmā
analyzed: āpaḥ oṣadhīḥ uta naḥ vantu dyauḥ vanā girayaḥ vṛkṣa keśāḥ  śṛṇotu naḥ ūrjām patiḥ giraḥ sa nabhaḥ tarīyān iṣiraḥ parijmā
translated: May the waters and plants protect us, may Dyaus, the woods, the mountains with trees for hair,🔽May the lord of strength listen to our songs, he, the swift one, is the most distant of the clouds.

original: śṛṇvantv āpaḥ puro na śubhrāḥ pari sruco babṛhāṇasyādreḥ
analyzed: śṛṇvantu āpaḥ puras na śubhrāḥ pari srucaḥ babṛhāṇasya adreḥ
translated: May the bright waters in front listen, the ladles of the expanding mountain.

original: vidā cin nu mahānto ye va evā bravāma dasmā vāryaṃ dadhānāḥ🔽vayaś cana subhva āva yanti kṣubhā martam anuyataṃ vadhasnaiḥ
analyzed: vidā cit nu mahāntaḥ ye vaḥ evāḥ bravāma dasmāḥ vāryam dadhānāḥ  vayaḥ cana su bhvaḥ āva yanti kṣubhā martam anuyatam vadhasnaiḥ
translated: We will proclaim even those great ones who know, bestowing wondrous treasure.🔽Even the strong ones come to the mortal who is restrained by the noose of death.

original: ā daivyāni pārthivāni janmāpaś cāchā sumakhāya vocam
analyzed: ā daivyāni pārthivāni janmā apaḥ ca achā su makhāya vocam
translated: I call to the divine and earthly beings, and the waters, for your good sacrifice.

original: vardhantāṃ dyāvo giraś candrāgrā udā vardhantām abhiṣātā arṇāḥ
analyzed: vardhantām dyāvaḥ giraḥ candra agrāḥ udāḥ vardhantām abhiṣātāḥ arṇāḥ
translated: May the praises with their moon-like heads and the waters to be conquered increase.

original: padepade me jarimā ni dhāyi varūtrī vā śakrā yā pāyubhiś ca
analyzed: pade pade me jarimā ni dhāyi varūtrī vā śakrā yā pāyubhiḥ ca
translated: At every step of mine let old age be laid down, or let the protecting Śakra be with his aids.

original: siṣaktu mātā mahī rasā naḥ smat sūribhir ṛjuhasta ṛjuvaniḥ
analyzed: siṣaktu mātā mahī rasā naḥ smat sūribhiḥ ṛju hastaḥ ṛju vaniḥ
translated: Let the great mother, the essence of our life, be joined with us, with upright hands and upright mind.

original: kathā dāśema namasā sudānūn evayā maruto achoktau praśravaso maruto achoktau
analyzed: kathā dāśema namasā sudānūn eva yāḥ marutaḥ achoktau praśravasaḥ marutaḥ achoktau
translated: How shall we serve the bountiful ones with homage? The swift Maruts, the Maruts with flowing streams, the Maruts who have been invoked.

original: mā no 'hir budhnyo riṣe dhād asmākam bhūd upamātivaniḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ hiḥ budhnyaḥ riṣe dhāt asmākam bhūt upamāti vaniḥ
translated: Let not the water-dwelling serpent harm us in the sacrifice. Let him be one who accepts our offerings.

original: iti cin nu prajāyai paśumatyai devāso vanate martyo va ā devāso vanate martyo vaḥ
analyzed: iti cit nu prajāyai paśumatyai devāsaḥ vanate martyaḥ vaḥ ā devāsaḥ vanate martyaḥ vaḥ
translated: O ye Gods, do ye bestow upon the man who hath cattle, for the sake of offspring.

original: atrā śivāṃ tanvo dhāsim asyā jarāṃ cin me nirṛtir jagrasīta
analyzed: atrā śivām tanvaḥ dhāsim asyāḥ jarām cit me nirṛtiḥ jagrasīta
translated: Here may I lay up for this my body a store of bliss, lest even old age should seize me.

original: tāṃ vo devāḥ sumatim ūrjayantīm iṣam aśyāma vasavaḥ śasā goḥ
analyzed: tām vaḥ devāḥ sumatim ūrjayantīm iṣam aśyāma vasavaḥ śasā goḥ
translated: That favour of yours, O Gods, which brings prosperity, may we obtain, O Vasus, by the praise of the cow.

original: sā naḥ sudānur mṛḷayantī devī prati dravantī suvitāya gamyāḥ
analyzed: sā naḥ sudānuḥ mṛḍayantī devī prati dravantī suvitāya gamyāḥ
translated: May she, the bountiful, the gracious Goddess, come to us, flowing to us for our welfare.

original: abhi na iḷā yūthasya mātā sman nadībhir urvaśī vā gṛṇātu
analyzed: abhi naḥ iḷā yūthasya mātā smat nadībhiḥ urvaśī vā gṛṇātu
translated: May Iḷā, the Mother of the herd, or Urvaṣī with the streams, sing to us.

original: urvaśī vā bṛhaddivā gṛṇānābhyūrṇvānā prabhṛthasyāyoḥ
analyzed: urvaśī vā bṛhat divā gṛṇānā abhyūrṇvānā prabhṛthasya āyoḥ
translated: Or may Urvaṣī, singing with lofty voice, be gracious to us at the sacrifice's birth.

original: siṣaktu na ūrjavyasya puṣṭeḥ /
analyzed: siṣaktu naḥ ūrjavyasya puṣṭeḥ
translated: May she impel us to the growth of strength.

original: pra śaṃtamā varuṇaṃ dīdhitī gīr mitram bhagam aditiṃ nūnam aśyāḥ
analyzed: pra śaṃtamā varuṇam dīdhitī gīḥ mitram bhagam aditim nūnam aśyāḥ
translated: May I now obtain the most propitious Varuna, Mitra, Bhaga, and Aditi with my song.

original: pṛṣadyoniḥ pañcahotā śṛṇotv atūrtapanthā asuro mayobhuḥ
analyzed: pṛṣat yoniḥ pañca hotā śṛṇotu a tūrta panthāḥ asuraḥ mayobhuḥ
translated: May the five-priest, the swift-born, the all-surveying, the immortal, the prosperous, hear our call.

original: prati me stomam aditir jagṛbhyāt sūnuṃ na mātā hṛdyaṃ suśevam
analyzed: prati me stomam aditiḥ jagṛbhyāt sūnum na mātā hṛdyam su śevam
translated: May Aditi receive my hymn as a mother her son, dear to her heart and most gracious.

original: brahma priyaṃ devahitaṃ yad asty aham mitre varuṇe yan mayobhu
analyzed: brahma priyam deva hitam yat asti aham mitre varuṇe yat mayobhu
translated: Whatever prayer is dear to the Gods, and well-pleasing to Mitra and Varuna,

original: ud īraya kavitamaṃ kavīnām unattainam abhi madhvā ghṛtena
analyzed: ud īraya kavitamam kavīnām unatta enam abhi madhvā ghṛtena
translated: Exalt the most wise of the wise, raise him up with sweet ghee

original: sa no vasūni prayatā hitāni candrāṇi devaḥ savitā suvāti
analyzed: sa naḥ vasūni prayatā hitāni candrāṇi devaḥ savitā suvāti
translated: May the god Savitar grant us the well-ordered, the well-placed, the beautiful treasures

original: sam indra ṇo manasā neṣi gobhiḥ saṃ sūribhir harivaḥ saṃ svasti
analyzed: sam indra naḥ manasā neṣi gobhiḥ sam sūribhiḥ harivas sam svasti
translated: O Indra, lead us with your mind to the cattle, lead us to the patrons, O you who love the Maruts, lead us to welfare

original: sam brahmaṇā devahitaṃ yad asti saṃ devānāṃ sumatyā yajñiyānām
analyzed: sam brahmaṇā deva hitam yat asti sam devānām sumatyā yajñiyānām
translated: With the Brahman that is dear to the gods, with the good will of the worshipful gods,

original: devo bhagaḥ savitā rāyo aṃśa indro vṛtrasya saṃjito dhanānām
analyzed: devaḥ bhagaḥ savitā rāyaḥ aṃśaḥ indraḥ vṛtrasya saṃjitaḥ dhanānām
translated: The god Bhaga, Savitar, the portion of wealth, Indra, the conqueror of Vritra, of treasures

original: ṛbhukṣā vāja uta vā puraṃdhir avantu no amṛtāsas turāsaḥ
analyzed: ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ uta vā puraṃdhiḥ avantu naḥ amṛtāsaḥ turāsaḥ
translated: May Ribhu, Vaja, and also Purandhi, the immortal strong ones, protect us

original: marutvato apratītasya jiṣṇor ajūryataḥ pra bravāmā kṛtāni
analyzed: marutvataḥ apratītasya jiṣṇoḥ a jūryataḥ pra bravāma kṛtāni
translated: Of the Maruts, of the unconquered, of the victorious, of the undecaying, we proclaim the deeds

original: na te pūrve maghavan nāparāso na vīryaṃ nūtanaḥ kaś canāpa
analyzed: na te pūrve maghavan na aparāsaḥ na vīryam nūtanaḥ kaḥ cana āpa
translated: Neither your former, O Maghavan, nor your later deeds, nor your new valor is equal to

original: upa stuhi prathamaṃ ratnadheyam bṛhaspatiṃ sanitāraṃ dhanānām
analyzed: upa stuhi prathamam ratna dheyam bṛhaspatim sanitāram dhanānām
translated: Praise first the giver of treasure, Brihaspati, the winner of riches

original: yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhaḥ purūvasur āgamaj johuvānam
analyzed: yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhaḥ purūvasuḥ āgamat johuvānam
translated: Who, most auspicious, with many treasures, comes to the one who praises and extols him

original: tavotibhiḥ sacamānā ariṣṭā bṛhaspate maghavānaḥ suvīrāḥ
analyzed: tava ūtibhiḥ sacamānāḥ ariṣṭāḥ bṛhaspate maghavānaḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: The prosperous ones, O Brihaspati, the powerful ones, accompanied by your aids, unharmed,

original: ye aśvadā uta vā santi godā ye vastradāḥ subhagās teṣu rāyaḥ
analyzed: ye aśva dāḥ uta vā santi go dāḥ ye vastra dāḥ subhagāḥ teṣu rāyaḥ
translated: Those who give horses and those who give cows, those who give garments and are fortunate, to them are riches.

original: visarmāṇaṃ kṛṇuhi vittam eṣāṃ ye bhuñjate apṛṇanto na ukthaiḥ
analyzed: visarmāṇam kṛṇuhi vittam eṣām ye bhuñjate apṛṇantaḥ naḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Make their wealth scattered, those who enjoy without giving with praises.

original: apavratān prasave vāvṛdhānān brahmadviṣaḥ sūryād yāvayasva
analyzed: apavratān prasave vāvṛdhānān brahma dviṣaḥ sūryāt yāvayasva
translated: Drive away from the sun those who are against the vow, who grow in birth, who hate the holy power.

original: ya ohate rakṣaso devavītāv acakrebhis tam maruto ni yāta
analyzed: yaḥ ohate rakṣasaḥ deva vītau acakrebhiḥ tam marutaḥ ni yāta
translated: The one who is defeated by the Raksas in the divine assembly, O Maruts, go to him with your wheels.

original: yo vaḥ śamīṃ śaśamānasya nindāt tuchyān kāmān karate siṣvidānaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śamīm śaśamānasya nindāt tuchyān kāmān karate siṣvidānaḥ
translated: The one who, being greedy, has stolen the sacrificial food of you who are striving, the one who has made your desires fruitless and trembling,

original: tam u ṣṭuhi yaḥ sviṣuḥ sudhanvā yo viśvasya kṣayati bheṣajasya
analyzed: tam u stuhi yaḥ su iṣuḥ su dhanvā yaḥ viśvasya kṣayati bheṣajasya
translated: Praise him who is the good archer, who rules over all the medicine.

original: yakṣvā mahe saumanasāya rudraṃ namobhir devam asuraṃ duvasya
analyzed: yakṣva mahe saumanasāya rudram namobhiḥ devam asuram duvasya
translated: Worship Rudra for great favor, serve the god Asura with salutations.

original: damūnaso apaso ye suhastā vṛṣṇaḥ patnīr nadyo vibhvataṣṭāḥ
analyzed: damūnasaḥ apasaḥ ye su hastāḥ vṛṣṇaḥ patnīḥ nadyaḥ vibhva taṣṭāḥ
translated: The skillful ones with good hands, the wives of the bull, the rivers fashioned by Vibhvan,

original: sarasvatī bṛhaddivota rākā daśasyantīr varivasyantu śubhrāḥ
analyzed: sarasvatī bṛhat divā uta rākā daśasyantīḥ varivasyantu śubhrāḥ
translated: Sarasvatī, Bṛhat, Divodā, Rākā, may the auspicious ones, bestowing, be favorable.

original: pra sū mahe suśaraṇāya medhāṃ giram bhare navyasīṃ jāyamānām
analyzed: pra su mahe su śaraṇāya medhām giram bhare navyasīm jāyamānām
translated: I bring forth a new hymn of praise, a song, to the great one who is a good protector,

original: ya āhanā duhitur vakṣaṇāsu rūpā mināno akṛṇod idaṃ naḥ
analyzed: yaḥ āhanāḥ duhituḥ vakṣaṇāsu rūpā minānaḥ akṛṇot idam naḥ
translated: The one who, diminishing the form in the lap of his daughter, has made this for us.

original: pra suṣṭuti stanayantaṃ ruvantam iḷas patiṃ jaritar nūnam aśyāḥ🔽yo abdimāṃ udanimāṃ iyarti pra vidyutā rodasī ukṣamāṇaḥ
analyzed: pra suṣṭuti stanayantam ruvantam iḷaḥ patim jaritar nūnam aśyāḥ  yaḥ abdimān udanimān iyarti pra vidyutā rodasī ukṣamāṇaḥ
translated: The singer must now call to the thundering lord of the people, to the roaring one, to the well-praised one.🔽He who moves the water-bearing and cloud-bearing (bull), pouring out the rain with lightning, filling the two worlds.

original: eṣa stomo mārutaṃ śardho achā rudrasya sūnūṃr yuvanyūṃr ud aśyāḥ
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ mārutam śardhaḥ achā rudrasya sūnūn yuvanyūn ud aśyāḥ
translated: This praise has come to the Marut host, to the young sons of Rudra. I will call to them.

original: kāmo rāye havate mā svasty upa stuhi pṛṣadaśvāṃ ayāsaḥ
analyzed: kāmaḥ rāye havate mā svasti upa stuhi pṛṣat aśvān ayāsaḥ
translated: Desire calls to me for wealth and well-being. Praise the swift-horsed ones who are not weary.

original: praiṣa stomaḥ pṛthivīm antarikṣaṃ vanaspatīṃr oṣadhī rāye aśyāḥ
analyzed: pra eṣa stomaḥ pṛthivīm antarikṣam vanaspatīn oṣadhīḥ rāye aśyāḥ
translated: The Stoma, the envoy, the earth, the atmosphere, the trees, the plants, I will call to for wealth.

original: devodevaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt
analyzed: devodevaḥ su havaḥ bhūtu mahyam mā naḥ mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt
translated: May each god be a good impeller for me. May the mother earth not place us in evil thought.

original: urau devā anibādhe syāma
analyzed: urau devāḥ anibādhe syāma
translated: May we be in the wide, unobstructed (earth), O gods.

original: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema🔽ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni
analyzed: sam aśvinoḥ avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā su praṇītī gamema  ā naḥ rayim vahatam ā uta vīrān ā viśvāni amṛtā saubhagāni
translated: With the new favour of the two Ashvins, bountiful, with good guidance, may we go.🔽Bring to us wealth and heroes, O immortal ones, and all good things.

original: ā dhenavaḥ payasā tūrṇyarthā amardhantīr upa no yantu madhvā
analyzed: ā dhenavaḥ payasā tūrṇi arthāḥ a mardhantīḥ upa naḥ yantu madhvā
translated: Let the milch-cows, swift in purpose, come to us with milk that does not fail, with sweetness.

original: maho rāye bṛhatīḥ sapta vipro mayobhuvo jaritā johavīti
analyzed: mahaḥ rāye bṛhatīḥ sapta vipraḥ mayobhuvaḥ jaritā johavīti
translated: The great seven, the bountiful, the far-reaching, the singer calls to the praise of great wealth.

original: ā suṣṭutī namasā vartayadhyai dyāvā vājāya pṛthivī amṛdhre
analyzed: ā suṣṭutī namasā vartayadhyai dyāvā vājāya pṛthivī amṛdhre
translated: Turn to us with good praises and reverence, O heaven and earth, for the sake of strength, O unthwartable ones.

original: pitā mātā madhuvacāḥ suhastā bharebhare no yaśasāv aviṣṭām
analyzed: pitā mātā madhu vacāḥ su hastā bharebhare naḥ yaśasau aviṣṭām
translated: Father, mother, sweet-voiced, with fair hands, be ye two glorious ones to help us in every need.

original: adhvaryavaś cakṛvāṃso madhūni pra vāyave bharata cāru śukram
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ cakṛvāṃsaḥ madhūni pra vāyave bharata cāru śukram
translated: O Adhvaryus, having performed the sweet offerings, bring the beautiful bright (Soma) to Vayu.

original: hoteva naḥ prathamaḥ pāhy asya deva madhvo rarimā te madāya
analyzed: hotā iva naḥ prathamaḥ pāhi asya deva madhvaḥ rarimā te madāya
translated: O god, as the first Hotri, protect this of ours: we have pressed the sweet (Soma) for thy rapture.

original: daśa kṣipo yuñjate bāhū adriṃ somasya yā śamitārā suhastā
analyzed: daśa kṣipaḥ yuñjate bāhū adrim somasya yā śamitārā su hastā
translated: The ten fingers, the two arms, the stone, the two pressing-boards of Soma, the two fair-handed distributors,

original: madhvo rasaṃ sugabhastir giriṣṭhāṃ caniścadad duduhe śukram aṃśuḥ
analyzed: madhvaḥ rasam su gabhastiḥ giriṣṭhām caniścadat duduhe śukram aṃśuḥ
translated: The fair-handed one has drawn the juice of the sweet (Soma), the essence of the mountain, the pure drop has flowed.

original: asāvi te jujuṣāṇāya somaḥ kratve dakṣāya bṛhate madāya
analyzed: asāvi te jujuṣāṇāya somaḥ kratve dakṣāya bṛhate madāya
translated: Soma has flowed for thee, the willing one, for great wisdom and rapture.

original: harī rathe sudhurā yoge arvāg indra priyā kṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ
analyzed: harī rathe su dhurā yoge arvāk indra priyā kṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ
translated: O Indra, being invoked, make the two well-yoked swift bays dear to thee in the harness.

original: ā no mahīm aramatiṃ sajoṣā gnāṃ devīṃ namasā rātahavyām
analyzed: ā naḥ mahīm aramatim sajoṣāḥ gnām devīm namasā rāta havyām
translated: In unison, with homage, bring us the great favour, the bountiful goddess, the consort,

original: madhor madāya bṛhatīm ṛtajñām āgne vaha pathibhir devayānaiḥ
analyzed: madhoḥ madāya bṛhatīm ṛta jñām ā agne vaha pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: The great one who knows the truth, for the rapture of the sweet (Soma). O Agni, bring (her) by the paths that lead to the gods.

original: añjanti yam prathayanto na viprā vapāvantaṃ nāgninā tapantaḥ
analyzed: añjanti yam prathayantaḥ na viprāḥ vapāvantam na agninā tapantaḥ
translated: The priests, spreading him, anoint him, not scorching him with fire, as if he were a calf.

original: pitur na putra upasi preṣṭha ā gharmo agnim ṛtayann asādi
analyzed: pituḥ na putraḥ upasi preṣṭhaḥ ā gharmaḥ agnim ṛtayan asādi
translated: The son, dearer than his father, the son, the dear one, has sat down by the fire, praising Agni.

original: achā mahī bṛhatī śaṃtamā gīr dūto na gantv aśvinā huvadhyai🔽mayobhuvā sarathā yātam arvāg gantaṃ nidhiṃ dhuram āṇir na nābhim🔽pra tavyaso namaktiṃ turasyāham pūṣṇa uta vāyor adikṣi
analyzed: achā mahī bṛhatī śaṃtamā gīḥ dūtaḥ na gantu aśvinā huvadhyai  mayobhuvā sa rathā yātam arvāk gantam nidhim dhuram āṇiḥ na nābhim  pra tavyasaḥ namaktim turasya aham pūṣṇaḥ uta vāyoḥ adikṣi
translated: Come to the great, vast, most auspicious praise, as a messenger to invoke the Ashvins.

original: yā rādhasā coditārā matīnāṃ yā vājasya draviṇodā uta tman🔽ā nāmabhir maruto vakṣi viśvān ā rūpebhir jātavedo huvānaḥ🔽yajñaṃ giro jarituḥ suṣṭutiṃ ca viśve ganta maruto viśva ūtī🔽ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ā sarasvatī yajatā gantu yajñam🔽havaṃ devī jujuṣāṇā ghṛtācī śagmāṃ no vācam uśatī śṛṇotu🔽ā vedhasaṃ nīlapṛṣṭham bṛhantam bṛhaspatiṃ sadane sādayadhvam🔽sādadyoniṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsaṃ hiraṇyavarṇam aruṣaṃ sapema
analyzed: yā rādhasā coditārā matīnām yā vājasya draviṇaḥ dā uta tman  ā nāmabhiḥ marutaḥ vakṣi viśvān ā rūpebhiḥ jātavedaḥ huvānaḥ  yajñam giraḥ jarituḥ suṣṭutim ca viśve ganta marutaḥ viśve ūtī  ā naḥ divaḥ bṛhataḥ parvatāt ā sarasvatī yajatā gantu yajñam  havam devī jujuṣāṇā ghṛtācī śagmām naḥ vācam uśatī śṛṇotu  ā vedhasam nīla pṛṣṭham bṛhantam bṛhaspatim sadane sādayadhvam  sādadyonim dame ā dīdivāṃsam hiraṇya varṇam aruṣam sapema
translated: Come with the bountiful ones, with your chariot, come to the treasure, the yoke, the nave.

original: ā dharṇasir bṛhaddivo rarāṇo viśvebhir gantv omabhir huvānaḥ
analyzed: ā dharṇasiḥ bṛhat divaḥ rarāṇaḥ viśvebhiḥ gantu omabhiḥ huvānaḥ
translated: I have turned to the homage of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift one, to the praise of the bountiful one, to the praise of the swift

original: gnā vasāna oṣadhīr amṛdhras tridhātuśṛṅgo vṛṣabho vayodhāḥ🔽mātuṣ pade parame śukra āyor vipanyavo rāspirāso agman
analyzed: gnāḥ vasānaḥ oṣadhīḥ amṛdhraḥ tri dhātu śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vayodhāḥ  mātuṣ pade parame śukre āyoḥ vipanyavaḥ rāspirāsaḥ agman
translated: The Gnas, clothed in the plants, the unimpaired, the bull with horns of three kinds, the bestower of life,🔽In the highest place of the mother, in the pure abode of life, the rays have come, the breathings.

original: suśevyaṃ namasā rātahavyāḥ śiśum mṛjanty āyavo na vāse
analyzed: su śevyam namasā rāta havyāḥ śiśum mṛjanti āyavaḥ na vāse
translated: With homage, seeking gifts, they cleanse the lovely child, the living ones, for his abode.

original: bṛhad vayo bṛhate tubhyam agne dhiyājuro mithunāsaḥ sacanta🔽devodevaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt
analyzed: bṛhat vayaḥ bṛhate tubhyam agne dhiyā juraḥ mithunāsaḥ sacanta  devodevaḥ su havaḥ bhūtu mahyam mā naḥ mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt
translated: The great life, for the great one, O Agni, the pairs, with devotion, follow.🔽May each god be easy to invoke for me. May our mother earth place us not in misfortune.

original: urau devā anibādhe syāma🔽sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema
analyzed: urau devāḥ anibādhe syāma  sam aśvinoḥ avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā su praṇītī gamema
translated: In the wide room, O gods, may we be free from trouble.🔽With the new favour of the Asvins, bringing bliss, may we go with good guidance.

original: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim vahatam ā uta vīrān ā viśvāni amṛtā saubhagāni
translated: Bring to us wealth and heroes, O ye immortal ones, and all good things.

original: tam pratnathā pūrvathā viśvathemathā jyeṣṭhatātim barhiṣadaṃ svarvidam🔽pratīcīnaṃ vṛjanaṃ dohase girāśuṃ jayantam anu yāsu vardhase
