analyzed: tam pratnathā pūrvathā viśvathā imathā jyeṣṭhatātim barhiṣadam svar vidam  pratīcīnam vṛjanam dohase girā āśum jayantam anu yāsu vardhase
translated: Him, as of old, as in the beginning, in every way, the lord of the highest rule, who sits on the grass, the finder of light,🔽The moving multitude, which goes to the milking, with the hymn, the swift one, whom thou aidest in the battles,

original: śriye sudṛśīr uparasya yāḥ svar virocamānaḥ kakubhām acodate
analyzed: śriye su dṛśīḥ uparasya yāḥ svar virocamānaḥ kakubhām a codate
translated: The beautiful ones of the highest one, which are for his glory, he, shining in the heaven, moves among the peaks.

original: sugopā asi na dabhāya sukrato paro māyābhir ṛta āsa nāma te
analyzed: su gopāḥ asi na dabhāya sukrato paras māyābhiḥ ṛte āsa nāma te
translated: Thou art a good guardian, O wise one, not to be deceived. Above all illusions is thy name, O truth.

original: atyaṃ haviḥ sacate sac ca dhātu cāriṣṭagātuḥ sa hotā sahobhariḥ
analyzed: atyam haviḥ sacate sat ca dhātu ca ariṣṭa gātuḥ sa hotā sahaḥ bhariḥ
translated: The horse, the oblation, goes to the true abode, the priest with unimpaired path, bearing strength.

original: prasarsrāṇo anu barhir vṛṣā śiśur madhye yuvājaro visruhā hitaḥ🔽pra va ete suyujo yāmann iṣṭaye nīcīr amuṣmai yamya ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
analyzed: prasarsrāṇaḥ anu barhiḥ vṛṣā śiśuḥ madhye yuvā ajaraḥ visruhā hitaḥ  pra vaḥ ete su yujaḥ yāman iṣṭaye nīcīḥ amuṣmai yamyaḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: The bull, the child, spreading along the strew, young, in the middle, ageless, with wide openings, is set.🔽These well-yoked ones, for the sake of the sacrifice, go low for him, the righteous ones who strengthen the law.

original: suyantubhiḥ sarvaśāsair abhīśubhiḥ krivir nāmāni pravaṇe muṣāyati
analyzed: suyantubhiḥ sarva śāsaiḥ abhīśubhiḥ kriviḥ nāmāni pravaṇe muṣāyati
translated: With well-controlled, all-governing horses, with reins, he hurls the names of Krivi into the slope.

original: saṃjarbhurāṇas tarubhiḥ sutegṛbhaṃ vayākinaṃ cittagarbhāsu susvaruḥ
analyzed: saṃjarbhurāṇaḥ tarubhiḥ sutegṛbham vayākinam citta garbhāsu susvaruḥ
translated: Roaring together with the trees, the well-grasping, the singing one, in the hearts of the women, the well-sounding one.

original: dhāravākeṣv ṛjugātha śobhase vardhasva patnīr abhi jīvo adhvare
analyzed: dhāravākeṣu ṛju gātha śobhase vardhasva patnīḥ abhi jīvaḥ adhvare
translated: In the milk-pots, with straight songs, you shine. Grow, O life, for the wives in the sacrifice.

original: yādṛg eva dadṛśe tādṛg ucyate saṃ chāyayā dadhire sidhrayāpsv ā
analyzed: yādṛś eva dadṛśe tādṛś ucyate sam chāyayā dadhire sidhrayā apsu ā
translated: As he is seen, so he is told. They have taken up the prosperous shadow in the waters.

original: mahīm asmabhyam uruṣām uru jrayo bṛhat suvīram anapacyutaṃ sahaḥ
analyzed: mahīm asmabhyam uru sām uru jrayaḥ bṛhat su vīram an apacyutam sahaḥ
translated: For us, O vast one, the great strength, with wide-reaching strength, the great, with good heroes, the imperishable strength.

original: vety agrur janivān vā ati spṛdhaḥ samaryatā manasā sūryaḥ kaviḥ
analyzed: veti agruḥ janivān vai ati spṛdhaḥ samaryatā manasā sūryaḥ kaviḥ
translated: The swift one has come, the one who has conquered, or has overcome the enemies. Sūrya, the wise one, with the mind, for the battle.

original: ghraṃsaṃ rakṣantam pari viśvato gayam asmākaṃ śarma vanavat svāvasuḥ
analyzed: ghraṃsam rakṣantam pari viśvatas gayam asmākam śarma vanavat svāvasuḥ
translated: The one who protects the falling, the all-supporting wealth, may he, the one with good wealth, provide us with protection.

original: jyāyāṃsam asya yatunasya ketuna ṛṣisvaraṃ carati yāsu nāma te
analyzed: jyāyāṃsam asya yatunasya ketuna ṛṣi svaram carati yāsu nāma te
translated: In which the name of the one who is greater than this lord of the sacrifice, the banner, moves with the voice of a seer,

original: yādṛśmin dhāyi tam apasyayā vidad ya u svayaṃ vahate so araṃ karat
analyzed: yādṛśmin dhāyi tam apasyayā vidat yaḥ u svayam vahate saḥ aram karat
translated: He who knows that which is placed in the rays by the eye, he who carries himself, makes it easy.

original: samudram āsām ava tasthe agrimā na riṣyati savanaṃ yasminn āyatā🔽atrā na hārdi kravaṇasya rejate yatrā matir vidyate pūtabandhanī
analyzed: samudram āsām ava tasthe agrimā na riṣyati savanam yasmin āyatā  atrā na hārdi kravaṇasya rejate yatrā matiḥ vidyate pūta bandhanī
translated: The foremost of these has stood in the ocean, the libation in which is extended is not injured.🔽Here the heart of the greedy one does not tremble, where there is a thought bound with purity.

original: sa hi kṣatrasya manasasya cittibhir evāvadasya yajatasya sadhreḥ
analyzed: sa hi kṣatrasya manasasya cittibhiḥ evāvadasya yajatasya sadhreḥ
translated: For he, with the thoughts of the lord of the people and the mind, is the impeller of the one who sacrifices in the assembly.

original: avatsārasya spṛṇavāma raṇvabhiḥ śaviṣṭhaṃ vājaṃ viduṣā cid ardhyam
analyzed: avatsārasya spṛṇavāma raṇvabhiḥ śaviṣṭham vājam viduṣā cit ardhyam
translated: We will win with the gentle ones the most powerful prize, to be gained even by the wise, of the one who is to be sought.

original: śyena āsām aditiḥ kakṣyo mado viśvavārasya yajatasya māyinaḥ
analyzed: śyenaḥ āsām aditiḥ kakṣyaḥ madaḥ viśva vārasya yajatasya māyinaḥ
translated: The hawk, the joy of the womb of these, the wise one of the all-giving one who sacrifices,

original: sam anyamanyam arthayanty etave vidur viṣāṇam paripānam anti te🔽sadāpṛṇo yajato vi dviṣo vadhīd bāhuvṛktaḥ śrutavit taryo vaḥ sacā
analyzed: sam anyam anyam arthayanti etave viduḥ viṣāṇam paripānam anti te  sadāpṛṇaḥ yajataḥ vi dviṣaḥ vadhīt bāhuvṛktaḥ śrutavid taryaḥ vaḥ sacā
translated: They seek each other for the sake of strength; they know the horn, the drinking vessel, from within.🔽The ever-increasing one, the one who is praised by the strong, the one who knows the heard, the one who is to be crossed, kills the enemies of the one who sacrifices.

original: ubhā sa varā praty eti bhāti ca yad īṃ gaṇam bhajate suprayāvabhiḥ
analyzed: ubhā sa varā prati eti bhāti ca yat īm gaṇam bhajate su prayāvabhiḥ
translated: He goes to both the prizes and shines, when he joins the group with the well-going ones.

original: sutambharo yajamānasya satpatir viśvāsām ūdhaḥ sa dhiyām udañcanaḥ
analyzed: sutambharaḥ yajamānasya sat patiḥ viśvāsām ūdhaḥ sa dhiyām
translated: The supporter of the son, the lord of the sacrifice, the udder of all desires, the impeller of thoughts,

original: bharad dhenū rasavac chiśriye payo 'nubruvāṇo adhy eti na svapan
analyzed: bharat dhenuḥ rasavat śiśriye payaḥ nubruvāṇaḥ adhi eti na svapan
translated: Bearing the two milch-cows, he has filled himself with nourishing milk; he goes on reciting, not sleeping.

original: yo jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante yo jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
analyzed: yaḥ jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante yaḥ jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
translated: The Rikas desire him who has been awake; the Samans go to him who has been awake.

original: yo jāgāra tam ayaṃ soma āha tavāham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ jāgāra tam ayam somaḥ āha tava aham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
translated: This Soma says to him who has been awake: 'I am thine in friendship, I am thine in love.'

original: agnir jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante 'gnir jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
analyzed: agniḥ jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante gniḥ jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
translated: The Rikas desire Agni who has been awake; the Samans go to Agni who has been awake.

original: agnir jāgāra tam ayaṃ soma āha tavāham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
analyzed: agniḥ jāgāra tam ayam somaḥ āha tava aham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
translated: This Soma says to Agni who has been awake: 'I am thine in friendship, I am thine in love.'

original: vidā divo viṣyann adrim ukthair āyatyā uṣaso arcino guḥ
analyzed: vidā divaḥ viṣyan adrim ukthaiḥ āyatyāḥ uṣasaḥ arcinaḥ guḥ
translated: Finding the sky, cleaving the rock with hymns, the Uṣṇihs have come for the sake of the dawns.

original: apāvṛta vrajinīr ut svar gād vi duro mānuṣīr deva āvaḥ
analyzed: apāvṛta vrajinīḥ ud svar gāt vi duraḥ mānuṣīḥ devaḥ āvaḥ
translated: Thou hast opened the stalls, the doors of men, from the light of heaven.

original: vi sūryo amatiṃ na śriyaṃ sād orvād gavām mātā jānatī gāt
analyzed: vi sūryaḥ amatim na śriyam sāt ā ūrvāt gavām mātā jānatī gāt
translated: The sun has brought the mother of the cows, the sky, from the other side, knowing, to the praise.

original: dhanvarṇaso nadyaḥ khādoarṇā sthūṇeva sumitā dṛṃhata dyauḥ
analyzed: dhanu arṇasaḥ nadyaḥ khādoarṇā sthūṇā iva su mitā dṛṃhata dyauḥ
translated: The rivers with their wealth of water, the earth with its wealth of food, firm as a pillar, the sky is well-built.

original: asmā ukthāya parvatasya garbho mahīnāṃ januṣe pūrvyāya
analyzed: asmai ukthāya parvatasya garbhaḥ mahīnām januṣe pūrvyāya
translated: For this hymn, for the birth of the great ones, the child of the mountain, the ancient one,

original: vi parvato jihīta sādhata dyaur āvivāsanto dasayanta bhūma
analyzed: vi parvataḥ jihīta sādhata dyauḥ āvivāsantaḥ dasayanta bhūma
translated: The mountain was cleft asunder, the sky was made ready, they who were dwelling together made the earth ready.

original: sūktebhir vo vacobhir devajuṣṭair indrā nv agnī avase huvadhyai
analyzed: sūktebhiḥ vaḥ vacobhiḥ deva juṣṭaiḥ indrā nu agnī avase huvadhyai
translated: With your hymns, your words dear to the gods, I invoke Indra and Agni for help.

original: ukthebhir hi ṣmā kavayaḥ suyajñā āvivāsanto maruto yajanti
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ hi sma kavayaḥ su yajñāḥ āvivāsantaḥ marutaḥ yajanti
translated: For the wise ones, the well-sacrificing ones, the Maruts, dwelling together, worship with hymns.

original: eto nv adya sudhyo bhavāma pra duchunā minavāmā varīyaḥ
analyzed: nu adya sudhyaḥ bhavāma pra duchunāḥ minavāma varīyaḥ
translated: Let us be well-disposed today, let us drive away evil, let us make a wider space.

original: āre dveṣāṃsi sanutar dadhāmāyāma prāñco yajamānam acha
analyzed: āre dveṣāṃsi sanutar dadhāma āyāma prāñcaḥ yajamānam acha
translated: Let us place far away, O bountiful one, enmities. Let us go forward to the sacrificer.

original: etā dhiyaṃ kṛṇavāmā sakhāyo 'pa yā mātām ṛṇuta vrajaṃ goḥ
analyzed: etā dhiyam kṛṇavāmā sakhāyau pa yā mātām ṛṇuta vrajam goḥ
translated: Let us make this hymn, O friends, let us open the mother's stall, the cow-pen,

original: yayā manur viśiśipraṃ jigāya yayā vaṇig vaṅkur āpā purīṣam
analyzed: yayā manuḥ viśiśipram jigāya yayā vaṇij vaṅkuḥ āpa purīṣam
translated: With which Manu conquered Vishishthira, with which the merchant Vankur obtained wealth.

original: anūnod atra hastayato adrir ārcan yena daśa māso navagvāḥ
analyzed: anūnot atra hasta yataḥ adriḥ ārcan yena daśa māsaḥ navagvāḥ
translated: The mountain, the worker of wonders, has risen up, by which the Dasha and Navagvas

original: ṛtaṃ yatī saramā gā avindad viśvāni satyāṅgirāś cakāra
analyzed: ṛtam yatī saramā gāḥ avindat viśvāni satyā aṅgirāḥ cakāra
translated: Saramā, going by the path of truth, found the cows. All things did Angiras make true.

original: viśve asyā vyuṣi māhināyāḥ saṃ yad gobhir aṅgiraso navanta
analyzed: viśve asyāḥ vyuṣi māhināyāḥ sam yat gobhiḥ aṅgirasaḥ navanta
translated: All these of her who is mighty in the light, when the Angirases rejoice with the cows,

original: utsa āsām parame sadhastha ṛtasya pathā saramā vidad gāḥ
analyzed: utsaḥ āsām parame sadhasthe ṛtasya pathā saramā vidat gāḥ
translated: The highest abode of these is the spring. By the path of truth Saramā found the cows.

original: ā sūryo yātu saptāśvaḥ kṣetraṃ yad asyorviyā dīrghayāthe
analyzed: ā sūryaḥ yātu sapta aśvaḥ kṣetram yat asya urviyā dīrgha yāthe
translated: Let the sun go with the seven horses to the place which is his by his far-reaching power.

original: raghuḥ śyenaḥ patayad andho achā yuvā kavir dīdayad goṣu gachan🔽ā sūryo aruhac chukram arṇo 'yukta yad dharito vītapṛṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: raghuḥ śyenaḥ patayat andhaḥ achā yuvā kaviḥ dīdayat goṣu gachan  ā sūryaḥ aruhat śukram arṇaḥ yukta yat haritaḥ vīta pṛṣṭhāḥ
translated: The swift-flying falcon, the blind one, has flown away, the young sage shines, going to the cows🔽The sun has ascended the bright path, when the two tawny ones with wide backs are yoked

original: udnā na nāvam anayanta dhīrā āśṛṇvatīr āpo arvāg atiṣṭhan
analyzed: udnā na nāvam anayanta dhīrāḥ āśṛṇvatīḥ āpaḥ arvāk atiṣṭhan
translated: The wise ones have led the boat across the water, the obedient waters have stood to the right

original: dhiyaṃ vo apsu dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ yayātaran daśa māso navagvāḥ
analyzed: dhiyam vaḥ apsu dadhiṣe svarṣām yayā ataran daśa māsaḥ navagvāḥ
translated: I place in the waters your thought, which shines by itself, by which the ten-month-old Navagvas came

original: ayā dhiyā syāma devagopā ayā dhiyā tuturyāmāty aṃhaḥ
analyzed: ayā dhiyā syāma deva gopāḥ ayā dhiyā tuturyāma ati aṃhaḥ
translated: By that thought may we be protected by the gods, by that thought may we overcome evil

original: hayo na vidvāṃ ayuji svayaṃ dhuri tāṃ vahāmi prataraṇīm avasyuvam
analyzed: hayaḥ na vidvān ayuji svayam dhuri tām vahāmi prataraṇīm avasyuvam
translated: Like a wise horse I have yoked myself to the pole, I carry that which saves, which is to be sought

original: nāsyā vaśmi vimucaṃ nāvṛtam punar vidvān pathaḥ puraeta ṛju neṣati
analyzed: na asyāḥ vaśmi vimucam na āvṛtam punar vidvān pathaḥ puraetā ṛju neṣati
translated: I do not find its release nor its turning back, the wise one leads the path straight forward as the forerunner

original: agna indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta mārutota viṣṇo
analyzed: agne indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta māruta uta viṣṇo
translated: O Agni, Indra, Varuna, Mitra, O gods, the Marut host moves forward, and also Vishnu

original: ubhā nāsatyā rudro adha gnāḥ pūṣā bhagaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta
analyzed: ubhā nāsatyā rudraḥ adha gnāḥ pūṣā bhagaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta
translated: The two Nâsatyas, Rudra, the Adhvaryus, Pûshan, Bhaga, Sarasvatî accept (the sacrifice)

original: indrāgnī mitrāvaruṇāditiṃ svaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām marutaḥ parvatāṃ apaḥ
analyzed: indra agnī mitrāvaruṇā aditim svar pṛthivīm dyām marutaḥ parvatān apaḥ
translated: Indra-Agni, Mitra-Varuṇa, Aditi, heaven, earth, the Maruts, the mountains, the waters

original: huve viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim bhagaṃ nu śaṃsaṃ savitāram ūtaye
analyzed: huve viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇaḥ patim bhagam nu śaṃsam savitāram ūtaye
translated: I invoke Vishnu, Pûshan, the lord of holy power, Bhaga, Nûshans, and Savitar for help

original: uta no viṣṇur uta vāto asridho draviṇodā uta somo mayas karat
analyzed: uta naḥ viṣṇuḥ uta vātaḥ asridhaḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ uta somaḥ mayaḥ karat
translated: May Vishnu, Vata who gives us wealth, and Soma, the bestower of bliss, grant us this.

original: uta ṛbhava uta rāye no aśvinota tvaṣṭota vibhvānu maṃsate
analyzed: uta ṛbhavaḥ uta rāye naḥ aśvinā uta tvaṣṭā uta vibhvā anu maṃsate
translated: May the Rbhus, the two Asvins, Tvashtar, and the all-powerful one favor us with wealth.

original: uta tyan no mārutaṃ śardha ā gamad divikṣayaṃ yajatam barhir āsade
analyzed: uta tyad naḥ mārutam śardhaḥ ā gamat divikṣayam yajatam barhiḥ āsade
translated: And may that Marut host come to us, seeking the sky, to sacrifice, to sit on the sacred grass.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ śarma pūṣota no yamad varūthyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ śarma pūṣā uta naḥ yamat varūthyam varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: May Brihaspati, and also Pusan, Yama, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman grant us protection.

original: uta tye naḥ parvatāsaḥ suśastayaḥ sudītayo nadyas trāmaṇe bhuvan
analyzed: uta tye naḥ parvatāsaḥ su śastayaḥ su dītayaḥ nadyaḥ trāmaṇe bhuvan
translated: And may those mountains, those well-praised ones, those well-sounding rivers be favorable to us.

original: bhago vibhaktā śavasāvasā gamad uruvyacā aditiḥ śrotu me havam🔽devānām patnīr uśatīr avantu naḥ prāvantu nas tujaye vājasātaye
analyzed: bhagaḥ vibhaktā śavasā avasā gamat uru vyacāḥ aditiḥ śrotu me havam  devānām patnīḥ uśatīḥ avantu naḥ prāvantu naḥ tujaye vājasātaye
translated: May Bhaga, the distributor, come to us with the strength of his power. May Aditi, of wide expanse, hear my call.🔽May the wives of the gods, the eager ones, favor us. May they favor us for victory and gaining strength.

original: yāḥ pārthivāso yā apām api vrate tā no devīḥ suhavāḥ śarma yachata
analyzed: yāḥ pārthivāsaḥ yāḥ apām api vrate tāḥ naḥ devīḥ su havāḥ śarma yacchata
translated: Those who are on earth and those who are in the waters' rule, may those goddesses, the swift ones, grant us protection.

original: uta gnā vyantu devapatnīr indrāṇy agnāyy aśvinī rāṭ
analyzed: uta gnāḥ vyantu deva patnīḥ indrāṇī agnāyī aśvinī rāj
translated: And may the Gnas, the wives of the gods, be favorable: Indrani, Agnari, Asvini, Ratha-Antari.

original: ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīr ya ṛtur janīnām
analyzed: ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīḥ yaḥ ṛtuḥ janīnām
translated: May Varuni hear the two world-halves. May the goddesses who are the seasons of women be favorable.

original: prayuñjatī diva eti bruvāṇā mahī mātā duhitur bodhayantī
analyzed: prayuñjatī divaḥ eti bruvāṇā mahī mātā duhituḥ bodhayantī
translated: She who sends forth, goes, speaking from the sky, the great mother, awakening her daughter,

original: āvivāsantī yuvatir manīṣā pitṛbhya ā sadane johuvānā
analyzed: āvivāsantī yuvatiḥ manīṣā pitṛbhyaḥ ā sadane johuvānā
translated: The young maiden, the thought, is calling to the Fathers, to their seat, in the house.

original: ajirāsas tadapa īyamānā ātasthivāṃso amṛtasya nābhim
analyzed: ajirāsaḥ tad apaḥ īyamānāḥ ātasthivāṃsaḥ amṛtasya nābhim
translated: The swift ones, then, are going away, settling on the navel of immortality.

original: anantāsa uravo viśvataḥ sīm pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti panthāḥ
analyzed: anantāsaḥ uravaḥ viśvatas sīm pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti panthāḥ
translated: The endless serpents, on every side, go along the paths that encircle the sky and earth.

original: ukṣā samudro aruṣaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yonim pitur ā viveśa
analyzed: ukṣā samudraḥ aruṣaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yonim pituḥ ā viveśa
translated: The bull, the ocean, the red bird has entered the birthplace of the eastern father.

original: madhye divo nihitaḥ pṛśnir aśmā vi cakrame rajasas pāty antau
analyzed: madhye divaḥ nihitaḥ pṛśniḥ aśmā vi cakrame rajasaḥ pāti antau
translated: The speckled stone is set in the middle of the sky, it moves along, guarding the ends of the atmosphere.

original: catvāra īm bibhrati kṣemayanto daśa garbhaṃ carase dhāpayante
analyzed: catvāraḥ īm bibhrati kṣemayantaḥ daśa garbham carase dhāpayante
translated: Four support him, making him secure, ten cause the embryo to move for action.

original: tridhātavaḥ paramā asya gāvo divaś caranti pari sadyo antān
analyzed: tri dhātavaḥ paramāḥ asya gāvaḥ divaḥ caranti pari sadyas antān
translated: His cows, of three forms, are the highest, they move around the ends of the sky.

original: idaṃ vapur nivacanaṃ janāsaś caranti yan nadyas tasthur āpaḥ🔽dve yad īm bibhṛto mātur anye iheha jāte yamyṛ sabandhū
analyzed: idam vapuḥ nivacanam janāsaḥ caranti yat nadyaḥ tasthuḥ āpaḥ  dve yat īm bibhṛtaḥ mātuḥ anye iha iha jāte yamyṛ sabandhū
translated: This form, this speech of men, they move along, the rivers and waters that stand still.🔽Two others support him, born here, the twins, the relatives.

original: vi tanvate dhiyo asmā apāṃsi vastrā putrāya mātaro vayanti
analyzed: vi tanvate dhiyaḥ asmai apāṃsi vastrā putrāya mātaraḥ vayanti
translated: They spread out the thoughts for him, the garments, the mothers weave for the son.

original: upaprakṣe vṛṣaṇo modamānā divas pathā vadhvo yanty acha
analyzed: upaprakṣe vṛṣaṇaḥ modamānāḥ divaḥ pathā vadhvaḥ yanti acha
translated: The two bulls, rejoicing, the brides go along the path of the sky, to the union.

original: tad astu mitrāvaruṇā tad agne śaṃ yor asmabhyam idam astu śastam
analyzed: tat astu mitrāvaruṇā tat agne śam yos asmabhyam idam astu śastam
translated: Let that be for Mitra and Varuna, let that be for Agni, let that be for the two Asvins. Let that be for us, O Agni, for our welfare and prosperity.

original: aśīmahi gādham uta pratiṣṭhāṃ namo dive bṛhate sādanāya
analyzed: aśīmahi gādham uta pratiṣṭhām namaḥ dive bṛhate sādanāya
translated: We would reach the ford and the firm ground. Homage to the great heaven, the seat of the sacrifice.

original: kad u priyāya dhāmne manāmahe svakṣatrāya svayaśase mahe vayam
analyzed: kad u priyāya dhāmne manāmahe svakṣatrāya sva yaśase mahe vayam
translated: How shall we think of the dear abode, of the one with his own power, his own glory, for great (things)?

original: āmenyasya rajaso yad abhra āṃ apo vṛṇānā vitanoti māyinī
analyzed: āmenyasya rajasaḥ yat abhre ām apaḥ vṛṇānā vitanoti māyinī
translated: When the cloud, of the changeable realm of the sky, taking the waters, spreads out, the magical one.

original: tā atnata vayunaṃ vīravakṣaṇaṃ samānyā vṛtayā viśvam ā rajaḥ
analyzed: tāḥ atnata vayunam vīra vakṣaṇam samānyā vṛtayā viśvam ā rajaḥ
translated: They have spread out the wind, the one with heroic strength, with a common covering, through the whole realm.

original: apo apācīr aparā apejate pra pūrvābhis tirate devayur janaḥ
analyzed: apaḥ apācīḥ aparāḥ apejate pra pūrvābhiḥ tirate devayuḥ janaḥ
translated: The one who is devoted to the gods goes beyond the waters that go to the west, and passes through the eastern ones.

original: ā grāvabhir ahanyebhir aktubhir variṣṭhaṃ vajram ā jigharti māyini
analyzed: ā grāvabhiḥ ahanyebhiḥ aktubhiḥ variṣṭham vajram ā jigharti māyini
translated: With the pressing-stones, with the daily oblations, the magical one hurls the most excellent thunderbolt.

original: śataṃ vā yasya pracaran sve dame saṃvartayanto vi ca vartayann ahā
analyzed: śatam vā yasya pracaran sve dame saṃvartayantaḥ vi ca vartayan ahā
translated: He whose hundred (powers) move in his own abode, turning together and turning apart the days.

original: tām asya rītim paraśor iva praty anīkam akhyam bhuje asya varpasaḥ
analyzed: tām asya rītim paraśoḥ iva prati anīkam akhyam bhuje asya varpasaḥ
translated: I have declared his way, like that of an axe, the front of his form, which one should avoid.

original: sacā yadi pitumantam iva kṣayaṃ ratnaṃ dadhāti bharahūtaye viśe
analyzed: sacā yadi pitumantam iva kṣayam ratnam dadhāti bhara hūtaye viśe
translated: If he places wealth in a house like one who has a father, for the sake of the assembly that is invited.

original: sa jihvayā caturanīka ṛñjate cāru vasāno varuṇo yatann arim
analyzed: sa jihvayā catur anīkaḥ ṛñjate cāru vasānaḥ varuṇaḥ yatan arim
translated: He, the four-cornered one, strives with his tongue, Varuna, the one who strives for freedom, beautifully clothed.

original: na tasya vidma puruṣatvatā vayaṃ yato bhagaḥ savitā dāti vāryam
analyzed: na tasya vidma puruṣatva tā vayam yatas bhagaḥ savitā dāti vāryam
translated: We know not his manhood, from whom the blessed Savitar bestows the boon.

original: devaṃ vo adya savitāram eṣe bhagaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ
analyzed: devam vaḥ adya savitāram eṣe bhagam ca ratnam vibhajantam āyoḥ
translated: To you today I go for help, to Savitar the God, and to Bhaga who distributes the treasure of life.

original: ā vāṃ narā purubhujā vavṛtyāṃ divedive cid aśvinā sakhīyan
analyzed: ā vām narā puru bhujā vavṛtyām dive dive cit aśvinā sakhīyan
translated: I would turn to you, O Heroes, O you who bestow much, O Asvins, even day by day, as a friend.

original: prati prayāṇam asurasya vidvān sūktair devaṃ savitāraṃ duvasya
analyzed: prati prayāṇam asurasya vidvān sūktaiḥ devam savitāram duvasya
translated: Knowing the course of the Asura, worship with hymns the God Savitar.

original: upa bruvīta namasā vijānañ jyeṣṭhaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ
analyzed: upa bruvīta namasā vijānam jyeṣṭham ca ratnam vibhajantam āyoḥ
translated: One should speak to him with reverence, knowing the best treasure which he distributes of life.

original: adatrayā dayate vāryāṇi pūṣā bhago aditir vasta usraḥ
analyzed: adatrayā dayate vāryāṇi pūṣā bhagaḥ aditiḥ vaste usraḥ
translated: Pūṣan, Bhaga, Aditi, the cow bestow the boons which are not to be surpassed.

original: indro viṣṇur varuṇo mitro agnir ahāni bhadrā janayanta dasmāḥ
analyzed: indraḥ viṣṇuḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ ahāni bhadrā janayanta dasmāḥ
translated: Indra, Viṣṇu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, the terrible ones, produce the auspicious days.

original: tan no anarvā savitā varūthaṃ tat sindhava iṣayanto anu gman
analyzed: tat naḥ anarvā savitā varūtham tat sindhavaḥ iṣayantaḥ anu gman
translated: That protection of ours, O Savitar, that the rivers have attained in their course,

original: upa yad voce adhvarasya hotā rāyaḥ syāma patayo vājaratnāḥ
analyzed: upa yat voce adhvarasya hotā rāyaḥ syāma patayaḥ vāja ratnāḥ
translated: To which the Hotar of the sacrifice speaks, may we be lords of wealth, O you who possess the treasure.

original: pra ye vasubhya īvad ā namo dur ye mitre varuṇe sūktavācaḥ🔽avaitv abhvaṃ kṛṇutā varīyo divaspṛthivyor avasā madema
analyzed: pra ye vasubhyaḥ īvat ā namaḥ duḥ ye mitre varuṇe sūkta vācaḥ 🔽avaitu abhvam kṛṇuta varīyaḥ divaspṛthivyoḥ avasā madema
translated: Those who have bowed to the Vasus, and those who have offered praise to Mitra and Varuṇa,🔽May they remove the fear, make a wider way, and may we rejoice in the help of heaven and earth.

original: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam
analyzed: viśvaḥ devasya netuḥ martaḥ vurīta sakhyam
translated: May every mortal man win the friendship of the guiding God.

original: viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase
analyzed: viśvaḥ rāyaḥ iṣudhyati dyumnam vṛṇīta puṣyase
translated: Every one longs for wealth: choose glory that you may prosper.

original: te te deva netar ye cemāṃ anuśase
analyzed: te te deva netar ye ca imām anuśase
translated: Those, O God, who follow this (teaching) of yours, O leader,

original: te rāyā te hy ṛpṛce sacemahi sacathyaḥ
analyzed: te rāyā te hi ṛpṛce sacemahi sacathyaḥ
translated: they are rich, for they are to be invoked. We will be companions, O companion.

original: ato na ā nñn atithīn ataḥ patnīr daśasyata
analyzed: atas naḥ ā atithīn atas patnīḥ daśasyata
translated: From here do not pass over the guests, from here do not injure the wives.

original: āre viśvam patheṣṭhāṃ dviṣo yuyotu yūyuviḥ
analyzed: āre viśvam patheṣṭhām dviṣaḥ yuyotu yūyuviḥ
translated: Keep away all the paths of the foe. Let the pursuer pursue (him).

original: yatra vahnir abhihito dudravad droṇyaḥ paśuḥ
analyzed: yatra vahniḥ abhihitaḥ dudravat droṇyaḥ paśuḥ
translated: Where the fire, the animal, was driven away, having been pointed out, to the troughs,

original: nṛmaṇā vīrapastyo 'rṇā dhīreva sanitā
analyzed: nṛmaṇāḥ vīra pastyoḥ rṇā dhīrā iva sanitā
translated: The man-conquering, hero-loving (fire), the deep one, is to be won like a thought.

original: eṣa te deva netā rathaspatiḥ śaṃ rayiḥ
analyzed: eṣa te deva netā rathaspatiḥ śam rayiḥ
translated: This, O God, is your leader, the lord of the chariot, prosperity.

original: śaṃ rāye śaṃ svastaya iṣastuto manāmahe devastuto manāmahe
analyzed: śam rāye śam svastaye iṣa stutaḥ manāmahe deva stutaḥ manāmahe
translated: For prosperity, for well-being, we think of the one praised by many, we think of the one praised by the gods.

original: agne sutasya pītaye viśvair ūmebhir ā gahi
analyzed: agne sutasya pītaye viśvaiḥ ūmebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: O Agni, come with all the Urmis to drink the pressed (Soma).

original: devebhir havyadātaye
analyzed: devebhiḥ havya dātaye
translated: With the gods to bring the oblation.

original: ṛtadhītaya ā gata satyadharmāṇo adhvaram
analyzed: ṛta dhītayaḥ ā gata satya dharmāṇaḥ adhvaram
translated: O you who have truth for your law, come to the sacrifice.

original: agneḥ pibata jihvayā
analyzed: agneḥ pibata jihvayā
translated: Drink with Agni's tongue.

original: viprebhir vipra santya prātaryāvabhir ā gahi
analyzed: viprebhiḥ vipra santya prātaryāvabhiḥ ā gahi
translated: O you who are wise with the wise, come with the morning-farers.

original: devebhiḥ somapītaye
analyzed: devebhiḥ soma pītaye
translated: With the gods to drink the Soma.

original: ayaṃ somaś camū suto 'matre pari ṣicyate
analyzed: ayam somaḥ camū sutaḥ matre pari sicyate
translated: This Soma, pressed in the mortar, is poured into the cup.

original: priya indrāya vāyave
analyzed: priyaḥ indrāya vāyave
translated: It is dear to Indra and Vayu.

original: vāyav ā yāhi vītaye juṣāṇo havyadātaye
analyzed: vāyo ā yāhi vītaye juṣāṇaḥ havya dātaye
translated: O Vayu, come for the feast, rejoicing in the offering of oblations

original: pibā sutasyāndhaso abhi prayaḥ
analyzed: pibā sutasya andhasaḥ abhi prayaḥ
translated: Drink of the pressed Soma, for the sake of the oblation

original: indraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ sutānām pītim arhathaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ ca vāyo eṣām sutānām pītim arhathaḥ
translated: O Indra and Vayu, you are worthy to drink of these pressed juices

original: tāñ juṣethām arepasāv abhi prayaḥ
analyzed: tām juṣethām arepasau abhi prayaḥ
translated: Enjoy them, you who are unsullied, for the sake of the oblation

original: sutā indrāya vāyave somāso dadhyāśiraḥ
analyzed: sutāḥ indrāya vāyave somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: The pressed Soma juices for Indra and Vayu are placed in the churning vessel

original: nimnaṃ na yanti sindhavo 'bhi prayaḥ
analyzed: nimnam na yanti sindhavaḥ bhi prayaḥ
translated: Like rivers flowing down to the lowlands, for the sake of the oblation

original: sajūr viśvebhir devebhir aśvibhyām uṣasā sajūḥ
analyzed: sajūs viśvebhiḥ devebhiḥ aśvibhyām uṣasā sajūs
translated: United with all the gods, with the Ashvins, with Ushas,

original: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa
analyzed: ā yāhi agne atri vat sute raṇa
translated: Come, O Agni, to the pressing, like Atri

original: sajūr mitrāvaruṇābhyāṃ sajūḥ somena viṣṇunā
analyzed: sajūs mitrāvaruṇābhyām sajūs somena viṣṇunā
translated: United with Mitra and Varuna, united with Soma and Vishnu,

original: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa
analyzed: ā yāhi agne atri vat sute raṇa
translated: Come, O Agni, to the pressing, like Atri

original: sajūr ādityair vasubhiḥ sajūr indreṇa vāyunā
analyzed: sajūs ādityaiḥ vasubhiḥ sajūs indreṇa vāyunā
translated: United with the Adityas, with the Vasus, united with Indra and Vayu,

original: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa🔽svasti no mimītām aśvinā bhagaḥ svasti devy aditir anarvaṇaḥ
analyzed: ā yāhi agne atri vat sute raṇa  svasti naḥ mimītām aśvinā bhagaḥ svasti devī aditiḥ anarvaṇaḥ
translated: Come, O Agni, to the pressing, like Atri🔽May the two Ashvins, Bhaga, and the divine Aditi, who is not to be overcome, grant us welfare

original: svasti pūṣā asuro dadhātu naḥ svasti dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā
analyzed: svasti pūṣā asuraḥ dadhātu naḥ svasti dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā
translated: May the Asura Pusan grant us welfare, and heaven and earth with good guidance

original: svastaye vāyum upa bravāmahai somaṃ svasti bhuvanasya yas patiḥ
analyzed: svastaye vāyum upa bravāmahai somam svasti bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ
translated: For welfare we will invoke Vayu, and Soma, who is the lord of the world

original: bṛhaspatiṃ sarvagaṇaṃ svastaye svastaya ādityāso bhavantu naḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspatim sarva gaṇam svastaye svastaye ādityāsaḥ bhavantu naḥ
translated: Brihaspati, all the hosts, for welfare, may the Adityas be for our welfare

original: viśve devā no adyā svastaye vaiśvānaro vasur agniḥ svastaye
analyzed: viśve devāḥ naḥ adya svastaye vaiśvānaraḥ vasuḥ agniḥ svastaye
translated: May all the gods today for our welfare, may the good Agni Vaisvānara for our welfare,

original: devā avantv ṛbhavaḥ svastaye svasti no rudraḥ pātv aṃhasaḥ
analyzed: devāḥ avantu ṛbhavaḥ svastaye svasti naḥ rudraḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May the gods, the Ṛbhus, protect us for our welfare. May Rudra protect us from distress.

original: svasti mitrāvaruṇā svasti pathye revati
analyzed: svasti mitrāvaruṇā svasti pathye revati
translated: May there be welfare from Mitra and Varuṇa, may there be welfare from the path, O Revati.

original: svasti na indraś cāgniś ca svasti no adite kṛdhi
analyzed: svasti naḥ indraḥ ca agniḥ ca svasti naḥ adite kṛdhi
translated: May there be welfare for us from Indra and Agni. May there be welfare for us, O Aditi.

original: svasti panthām anu carema sūryācandramasāv iva
analyzed: svasti panthām anu carema sūryācandramasau iva
translated: May we follow the path of welfare, like the sun and the moon.

original: punar dadatāghnatā jānatā saṃ gamemahi
analyzed: punar dadatā a ghnatā jānatā sam gamemahi
translated: May we meet again, giving, striking, knowing.

original: pra śyāvāśva dhṛṣṇuyārcā marudbhir ṛkvabhiḥ
analyzed: pra śyāvāśva dhṛṣṇuyā arca marudbhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: O Śyāvāśva, with the Maruts who delight in praise, with the singers,

original: ye adrogham anuṣvadhaṃ śravo madanti yajñiyāḥ🔽te hi sthirasya śavasaḥ sakhāyaḥ santi dhṛṣṇuyā
analyzed: ye adrogham anuṣvadham śravaḥ madanti yajñiyāḥ  te hi sthirasya śavasaḥ sakhāyaḥ santi dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: Those who rejoice in the truthful, the straight path, the worshipful ones,🔽For they are the friends of firm strength, of daring.

original: te yāmann ā dhṛṣadvinas tmanā pānti śaśvataḥ
analyzed: te yāman ā dhṛṣadvinaḥ tmanā pānti śaśvataḥ
translated: They, in their own way, always protect the daring ones.

original: te syandrāso nokṣaṇo 'ti ṣkandanti śarvarīḥ
analyzed: te syandrāsaḥ na ukṣaṇaḥ ti skandanti śarvarīḥ
translated: Those impetuous ones, those anointed ones, leap over the nights.

original: marutām adhā maho divi kṣamā ca manmahe
analyzed: marutām adhā mahaḥ divi kṣamā ca manmahe
translated: We think of the great glory of the Maruts in the sky and on earth.

original: marutsu vo dadhīmahi stomaṃ yajñaṃ ca dhṛṣṇuyā
analyzed: marutsu vaḥ dadhīmahi stomam yajñam ca dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: We will place our praise and sacrifice in the Maruts, with daring.

original: viśve ye mānuṣā yugā pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ
analyzed: viśve ye mānuṣā yugā pānti martyam riṣaḥ
translated: All those who protect the human generations from the harm of mortals,

original: arhanto ye sudānavo naro asāmiśavasaḥ
analyzed: arhantaḥ ye sudānavaḥ naraḥ asāmi śavasaḥ
translated: Those worthy ones, the bountiful ones, the men who have abundant strength,

original: pra yajñaṃ yajñiyebhyo divo arcā marudbhyaḥ
analyzed: pra yajñam yajñiyebhyaḥ divaḥ arca marudbhyaḥ
translated: To the sacrifice of the Maruts, to the worthy of sacrifice, send the hymn from the sky

original: ā rukmair ā yudhā nara ṛṣvā ṛṣṭīr asṛkṣata
analyzed: ā rukmaiḥ ā yudhā naraḥ ṛṣvāḥ ṛṣṭīḥ asṛkṣata
translated: With their bright ornaments, the men, the mighty, have sent forth their spears

original: anv enāṃ aha vidyuto maruto jajjhatīr iva bhānur arta tmanā divaḥ
analyzed: anu enām aha vidyutaḥ marutaḥ jajjhatīḥ iva bhānuḥ arta tmanā divaḥ
translated: The Maruts, O Agni, with their lightning, as if shaking, follow this (sacrifice)

original: ye vāvṛdhanta pārthivā ya urāv antarikṣa ā
analyzed: ye vāvṛdhanta pārthivāḥ ye urau antarikṣe ā
translated: Those who have grown on earth, who in the wide atmosphere,

original: vṛjane vā nadīnāṃ sadhasthe vā maho divaḥ
analyzed: vṛjane vā nadīnām sadhasthe vā mahaḥ divaḥ
translated: In the race of the rivers, or in the great abode of the sky

original: śardho mārutam uc chaṃsa satyaśavasam ṛbhvasam
analyzed: śardhaḥ mārutam ud śaṃsa satya śavasam ṛbhvasam
translated: Praise the Marut host, of true strength, of mighty power

original: uta sma te śubhe naraḥ pra syandrā yujata tmanā
analyzed: uta sma te śubhe naraḥ pra syandrā yujata tmanā
translated: And, O men, those of you who are good, yoke your own chariot, O Indra

original: uta sma te paruṣṇyām ūrṇā vasata śundhyavaḥ
analyzed: uta sma te paruṣṇyām ūrṇāḥ vasata śundhyavaḥ
translated: And those of you who dwell in the Parushni, with wool, with pure dwellings

original: uta pavyā rathānām adrim bhindanty ojasā
analyzed: uta pavyā rathānām adrim bhindanti ojasā
translated: And the wheels of your chariots, with your might, burst the rock

original: āpathayo vipathayo 'ntaspathā anupathāḥ
analyzed: āpathayaḥ vipathayaḥ ntaspathāḥ anupathāḥ
translated: The straight-going, the cross-going, the going in the middle, the going along

original: etebhir mahyaṃ nāmabhir yajñaṃ viṣṭāra ohate
analyzed: etebhiḥ mahyam nāmabhiḥ yajñam viṣṭāre ohate
translated: With these names of yours, O Viṣṭara, you carry the sacrifice

original: adhā naro ny ohate 'dhā niyuta ohate
analyzed: adhā naraḥ ni ohate dhāḥ niyutaḥ ohate
translated: Then the men, then the teams, are carried

original: adhā pārāvatā iti citrā rūpāṇi darśyā
analyzed: adhā pārāvatāḥ iti citrā rūpāṇi darśyā
translated: Then the pigeons, showing various forms,

original: chandastubhaḥ kubhanyava utsam ā kīriṇo nṛtuḥ
analyzed: chanda stubhaḥ kubhanyavaḥ utsam ā kīriṇaḥ nṛtuḥ
translated: The singers of the metres, the skilful ones, have danced to the spring

original: te me ke cin na tāyava ūmā āsan dṛśi tviṣe
analyzed: te me ke cit na tāyavaḥ ūmāḥ āsan dṛśi tviṣe
translated: Some of them, O Tviṣi, have been good to me, some have not been good

original: ya ṛṣvā ṛṣṭividyutaḥ kavayaḥ santi vedhasaḥ🔽tam ṛṣe mārutaṃ gaṇaṃ namasyā ramayā girā
analyzed: ye ṛṣvāḥ ṛṣṭi vidyutaḥ kavayaḥ santi vedhasaḥ  tam ṛṣe mārutam gaṇam namasya ramaya girā
translated: Those who are lofty, whose weapons flash like lightning, who are wise and creative,🔽To that sage, to the Marut host, I pay homage with delightful words.

original: acha ṛṣe mārutaṃ gaṇaṃ dānā mitraṃ na yoṣaṇā
analyzed: acha ṛṣe mārutam gaṇam dānā mitram na yoṣaṇā
translated: O sage, the Marut host, like a woman to a friend,

original: divo vā dhṛṣṇava ojasā stutā dhībhir iṣaṇyata
analyzed: divaḥ vā dhṛṣṇavaḥ ojasā stutāḥ dhībhiḥ iṣaṇyata
translated: Or like those who are impetuous in heaven with their strength, be encouraged by our thoughts.

original: nū manvāna eṣāṃ devāṃ achā na vakṣaṇā
analyzed: nu manvānaḥ eṣām devān achā na vakṣaṇā
translated: Now, thinking of them, the gods have come to me, not to my chest,

original: dānā saceta sūribhir yāmaśrutebhir añjibhiḥ
analyzed: dānā saceta sūribhiḥ yāma śrutebhiḥ añjibhiḥ
translated: Together with the wise lords, with the famous ones, with the anointed ones.

original: pra ye me bandhveṣe gāṃ vocanta sūrayaḥ pṛśniṃ vocanta mātaram
analyzed: pra ye me bandhu eṣe gām vocanta sūrayaḥ pṛśnim vocanta mātaram
translated: Those who have proclaimed to me in the assembly the cow, the relatives, the mothers, they have proclaimed the dappled mother.

original: adhā pitaram iṣmiṇaṃ rudraṃ vocanta śikvasaḥ
analyzed: adhā pitaram iṣmiṇam rudram vocanta śikvasaḥ
translated: Now the impetuous father, Rudra, the powerful ones have proclaimed.

original: sapta me sapta śākina ekamekā śatā daduḥ
analyzed: sapta me sapta śākinaḥ ekam ekā śatā daduḥ
translated: Seven of them have given me seven strong ones, one hundred each.

original: yamunāyām adhi śrutam ud rādho gavyam mṛje ni rādho aśvyam mṛje
analyzed: yamunāyām adhi śrutam ud rādhaḥ gavyam mṛje ni rādhaḥ aśvyam mṛje
translated: Heard on the Yamuna, I have obtained the gift of cattle, I have obtained the gift of horses.

original: ko veda jānam eṣāṃ ko vā purā sumneṣv āsa marutām
analyzed: kaḥ veda jānam eṣām kaḥ vā purā sumneṣu āsa marutām
translated: Who knows their lineage? Who has been with them in the past in their favors, of the Maruts,

original: yad yuyujre kilāsyaḥ
analyzed: yat yuyujre kilāsyaḥ
translated: When they yoked their swift-moving chariots?

original: aitān ratheṣu tasthuṣaḥ kaḥ śuśrāva kathā yayuḥ
analyzed: ā etān ratheṣu tasthuṣaḥ kaḥ śuśrāva kathā yayuḥ
translated: Who has heard them standing in their chariots? How have they gone?

original: kasmai sasruḥ sudāse anv āpaya iḷābhir vṛṣṭayaḥ saha
analyzed: kasmai sasruḥ sudāse anu āpayaḥ iḷābhiḥ vṛṣṭayaḥ saha
translated: For what good man have the rains followed with the Iḷās?

original: te ma āhur ya āyayur upa dyubhir vibhir made
analyzed: te me āhuḥ ye āyayuḥ upa dyubhiḥ vibhiḥ made
translated: They have told me those who have come to me with the luminous ones, with the radiant ones, in the intoxication.

original: naro maryā arepasa imān paśyann iti ṣṭuhi
analyzed: naraḥ maryāḥ arepasaḥ imān paśyan iti stuhi
translated: Looking on these men, free from blemish, say, 'Praise!'

original: ye añjiṣu ye vāśīṣu svabhānavaḥ srakṣu rukmeṣu khādiṣu
analyzed: ye añjiṣu ye vāśīṣu sva bhānavaḥ srakṣu rukmeṣu khādiṣu
translated: Those who are in the anointed ones, or in the swords, self-shining, in the shafts, in the golden ones, in the eaters,

original: śrāyā ratheṣu dhanvasu
analyzed: śrāyāḥ ratheṣu dhanvasu
translated: In the chariots, in the bows.

original: yuṣmākaṃ smā rathāṃ anu mude dadhe maruto jīradānavaḥ
analyzed: yuṣmākam smā rathān anu mude dadhe marutaḥ jīra dānavaḥ
translated: I have placed my joy in your chariots, O Maruts, you who give quickly,

original: vṛṣṭī dyāvo yatīr iva🔽ā yaṃ naraḥ sudānavo dadāśuṣe divaḥ kośam acucyavuḥ
analyzed: vṛṣṭī dyāvaḥ yatīḥ iva  ā yam naraḥ sudānavaḥ dadāśuṣe divaḥ kośam acucyavuḥ
translated: Like the rain-bearing clouds that are moving.🔽The men who are bountiful have shaken for the worshipper the quiver of heaven.

original: vi parjanyaṃ sṛjanti rodasī anu dhanvanā yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ🔽tatṛdānāḥ sindhavaḥ kṣodasā rajaḥ pra sasrur dhenavo yathā
analyzed: vi parjanyam sṛjanti rodasī anu dhanvanā yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ  tatṛdānāḥ sindhavaḥ kṣodasā rajaḥ pra sasruḥ dhenavaḥ yathā
translated: They send forth Parjanya, the two world-halves follow, the rains move along the water-courses.🔽The rivers, with their flood, the dust, have flowed forth, like cows,

original: syannā aśvā ivādhvano vimocane vi yad vartanta enyaḥ
analyzed: syannāḥ aśvāḥ iva adhvanaḥ vimocane vi yat vartante enyaḥ
translated: Like horses on the starting-post, when they are loosed for the race, so do they move apart.

original: ā yāta maruto diva āntarikṣād amād uta
analyzed: ā yāta marutaḥ divaḥ āntarikṣāt amāt uta
translated: Come, O Maruts, from the sky, from the atmosphere, and from the earth!

original: māva sthāta parāvataḥ
analyzed: mā ava sthāta parāvataḥ
translated: Do not stay away from afar!

original: mā vo rasānitabhā kubhā krumur mā vaḥ sindhur ni rīramat
analyzed: mā vaḥ rasā anitabhā kubhā krumuḥ mā vaḥ sindhuḥ ni rīramat
translated: Let not the water-loving Kuṃbha deceive you, let not the river hold you back!

original: mā vaḥ pari ṣṭhāt sarayuḥ purīṣiṇy asme īt sumnam astu vaḥ
analyzed: mā vaḥ pari sthāt sarayuḥ purīṣiṇī asme īd sumnam astu vaḥ
translated: Let not the Sarayu, the dusty one, stay you. Be with us. Let there be bliss for you.

original: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ rathānāṃ tveṣaṃ gaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām
analyzed: tam vaḥ śardham rathānām tveṣam gaṇam mārutam navyasīnām
translated: That your troop of chariots, that your brilliant host, the Marut host, of the newest,

original: anu pra yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: anu pra yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: The rains follow it.

original: śardhaṃśardhaṃ va eṣāṃ vrātaṃvrātaṃ gaṇaṃgaṇaṃ suśastibhiḥ
analyzed: śardham śardham vaḥ eṣām vrātam vrātam gaṇam gaṇam su śastibhiḥ
translated: With their own troops, with their own bands, with their own groups, with their own praises,

original: anu krāmema dhītibhiḥ🔽kasmā adya sujātāya rātahavyāya pra yayuḥ
analyzed: anu krāmema dhītibhiḥ  kasmai adya sujātāya rāta havyāya pra yayuḥ
translated: we will follow them with our thoughts.🔽To what good-born one, to whom oblations are offered, have the Maruts gone today

original: enā yāmena marutaḥ
analyzed: enā yāmena marutaḥ
translated: with that same chariot-drive?

original: yena tokāya tanayāya dhānyam bījaṃ vahadhve akṣitam🔽asmabhyaṃ tad dhattana yad va īmahe rādho viśvāyu saubhagam
analyzed: yena tokāya tanayāya dhānyam bījam vahadhve akṣitam  asmabhyam tat dhattana yat vaḥ īmahe rādhaḥ viśvāyu saubhagam
translated: With which you carry for your offspring and sons grain, seed that is inexhaustible,🔽grant us that, O you who have all life, prosperity and good fortune, which we desire.

original: atīyāma nidas tiraḥ svastibhir hitvāvadyam arātīḥ
analyzed: atīyāma nidaḥ tiras svastibhiḥ hitvā avadyam arātīḥ
translated: May we pass over the curses, over the evil, with your blessings, having left behind sin and hatred.

original: vṛṣṭvī śaṃ yor āpa usri bheṣajaṃ syāma marutaḥ saha
analyzed: vṛṣṭvī śam yoḥ āpaḥ usri bheṣajam syāma marutaḥ saha
translated: May we be, O Maruts, the medicine of the rain-giving, auspicious, watery one.

original: sudevaḥ samahāsati suvīro naro marutaḥ sa martyaḥ
analyzed: su devaḥ samaha asati su vīraḥ naraḥ marutaḥ sa martyaḥ
translated: The man who has good gods, O Maruts, who has good heroes, that mortal

original: yaṃ trāyadhve syāma te
analyzed: yam trāyadhve syāma te
translated: whom you protect, may we be like him.

original: stuhi bhojān stuvato asya yāmani raṇan gāvo na yavase
analyzed: stuhi bhojān stuvataḥ asya yāmani raṇan gāvaḥ na yavase
translated: Praise the Bhojas, praise them on the way of this praiser. The cows low like in a pasture.

original: yataḥ pūrvāṃ iva sakhīṃr anu hvaya girā gṛṇīhi kāminaḥ
analyzed: yatas pūrvān iva sakhīṃr anu hvaya girā gṛṇīhi kāminaḥ
translated: From where you call the old friends, as it were, with a song, praise the lovers.

original: pra śardhāya mārutāya svabhānava imāṃ vācam anajā parvatacyute
analyzed: pra śardhāya mārutāya sva bhānave imām vācam anajā parvata cyute
translated: To the rushing Maruts, to those who shine by themselves, to the ones who shake the mountains, direct this speech.

original: gharmastubhe diva ā pṛṣṭhayajvane dyumnaśravase mahi nṛmṇam arcata
analyzed: gharma stubhe divaḥ ā pṛṣṭhayajvane dyumna śravase mahi nṛmṇam arcata
translated: To the one who has the heat as his emblem, who offers the oblations in the sky, to the one who has fame for glory, praise great manliness.

original: pra vo marutas taviṣā udanyavo vayovṛdho aśvayujaḥ parijrayaḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ marutaḥ taviṣāḥ udanyavaḥ vayaḥ vṛdhaḥ aśva yujaḥ parijrayaḥ
translated: Your Maruts, powerful, ascending, increasing strength, yoked with horses, wandering around,

original: saṃ vidyutā dadhati vāśati tritaḥ svaranty āpo 'vanā parijrayaḥ
analyzed: sam vidyutā dadhati vāśati tritaḥ svaranti āpaḥ vanā parijrayaḥ
translated: They join with lightning, Trita roars, the waters sing, wandering around.

original: vidyunmahaso naro aśmadidyavo vātatviṣo marutaḥ parvatacyutaḥ
analyzed: vidyut mahasaḥ naraḥ aśma didyavaḥ vāta tviṣaḥ marutaḥ parvata cyutaḥ
translated: The men with lightning power, stone-throwers, the Maruts with wind-force, falling from the mountains,

original: abdayā cin muhur ā hrādunīvṛta stanayadamā rabhasā udojasaḥ
analyzed: abdayā cit muhur ā hrādunīvṛta stanaya damāḥ rabhasāḥ udojasaḥ
translated: Though roaring like a cloud, they are quickly covered, thundering, impetuous, full of vigor.🔽The Rudras with their pointed spears have scattered the rays, the days,

original: vy aktūn rudrā vy ahāni śikvaso vy antarikṣaṃ vi rajāṃsi dhūtayaḥ
analyzed: vi aktūn rudrāḥ vi ahāni śikvasaḥ vi antarikṣam vi rajāṃsi dhūtayaḥ
translated: The atmosphere, the regions, the swift ones.

original: vi yad ajrāṃ ajatha nāva īṃ yathā vi durgāṇi maruto nāha riṣyatha
analyzed: vi yat ajrām ajatha nāvaḥ īm yathā vi durgāṇi marutaḥ na aha riṣyatha
translated: When you have gone through the unyielding ones like a boat, through the difficulties, O Maruts, you do not perish.

original: tad vīryaṃ vo maruto mahitvanaṃ dīrghaṃ tatāna sūryo na yojanam
analyzed: tat vīryam vaḥ marutaḥ mahitvanam dīrgham tatāna sūryaḥ na yojanam
translated: That is your heroic deed, O Maruts, your greatness, which the sun has stretched out long like a yoke.

original: etā na yāme agṛbhītaśociṣo 'naśvadāṃ yan ny ayātanā girim
analyzed: etāḥ na yāme a gṛbhīta śociṣaḥ naśva dām yat ni ayātana girim
translated: These, not to be turned back, with their radiance not grasped, when you went to the mountain that does not give horses,

original: abhrāji śardho maruto yad arṇasam moṣathā vṛkṣaṃ kapaneva vedhasaḥ
analyzed: abhrāji śardhaḥ marutaḥ yat arṇasam moṣatha vṛkṣam kapanā iva vedhasaḥ
translated: The Marut host, when you shook the watery one, you destroyed the tree like clever ones in a contest.

original: adha smā no aramatiṃ sajoṣasaś cakṣur iva yantam anu neṣathā sugam
analyzed: adha smā naḥ aramatim sajoṣasaḥ cakṣuḥ iva yantam anu neṣathāḥ sugam
translated: Now, O Maruts of one mind with us, lead us to an easy path, as if it were the moving eye.

original: na sa jīyate maruto na hanyate na sredhati na vyathate na riṣyati
analyzed: na sa jīyate marutaḥ na hanyate na sredhati na vyathate na riṣyati
translated: He is not conquered, O Maruts, he is not slain, he does not languish, he does not suffer, he does not perish,

original: nāsya rāya upa dasyanti notaya ṛṣiṃ vā yaṃ rājānaṃ vā suṣūdatha
analyzed: na asya rāyaḥ upa dasyanti na ūtayaḥ ṛṣim vā yam rājānam vā suṣūdatha
translated: His wealth does not fail, nor his means of livelihood, whether you have purified a seer or a king.

original: niyutvanto grāmajito yathā naro 'ryamaṇo na marutaḥ kabandhinaḥ
analyzed: niyutvantaḥ grāma jitaḥ yathā naraḥ ryamaṇaḥ na marutaḥ kabandhinaḥ
translated: Like men who conquer villages, the Maruts, the Kabandhin brothers, the Aryaman brothers,

original: pinvanty utsaṃ yad ināso asvaran vy undanti pṛthivīm madhvo andhasā
analyzed: pinvanti utsam yat ināsaḥ asvaran vi undanti pṛthivīm madhvaḥ andhasā
translated: They make the spring swell when the rainy season roars, they moisten the earth with the sweet juice.

original: pravatvatīyam pṛthivī marudbhyaḥ pravatvatī dyaur bhavati prayadbhyaḥ
analyzed: pravatvatī iyam pṛthivī marudbhyaḥ pravatvatī dyauḥ bhavati prayadbhyaḥ
translated: The earth is full of strength for the Maruts, the full of strength sky is for the striving ones.

original: pravatvatīḥ pathyṛ antarikṣyāḥ pravatvantaḥ parvatā jīradānavaḥ
analyzed: pravatvatīḥ pathyṛ antarikṣyāḥ pravatvantaḥ parvatāḥ jīra dānavaḥ
translated: The paths in the atmosphere are full of strength, the mountains full of strength, the swift-moving ones.

original: yan marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sūrya udite madathā divo naraḥ
analyzed: yat marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sūrye udite madatha divaḥ naraḥ
translated: When, O Maruts, you, the golden-hued ones, rejoice, O men, at the rising of the sun,

original: na vo 'śvāḥ śrathayantāha sisrataḥ sadyo asyādhvanaḥ pāram aśnutha
analyzed: na vaḥ śvās śrathayantā aha sisrataḥ sadyas asya adhvanaḥ pāram aśnutha
translated: Your horses do not break, as you rush forth, you quickly reach the end of this path.

original: aṃseṣu va ṛṣṭayaḥ patsu khādayo vakṣassu rukmā maruto rathe śubhaḥ
analyzed: aṃseṣu vaḥ ṛṣṭayaḥ patsu kha ādayaḥ vakṣassu rukmāḥ marutaḥ rathe śubhaḥ
translated: In your shoulders are spears, in your hands are knives, on your chests are golden ornaments, O Maruts, on your chariot is splendor.

original: agnibhrājaso vidyuto gabhastyoḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣasu vitatā hiraṇyayīḥ
analyzed: agni bhrājasaḥ vidyutaḥ gabhastyoḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣasu vitatāḥ hiraṇyayīḥ
translated: In your arms are fires, in your hands are lightning bolts, on your heads are golden extended crests.

original: taṃ nākam aryo agṛbhītaśociṣaṃ ruśat pippalam maruto vi dhūnutha
analyzed: tam nākam aryaḥ a gṛbhīta śociṣam ruśat pippalam marutaḥ vi dhūnutha
translated: That Ārya, whose radiance is not restrained, the ruddy Pippala, O Maruts, do ye shake.

original: sam acyanta vṛjanātitviṣanta yat svaranti ghoṣaṃ vitatam ṛtāyavaḥ🔽yuṣmādattasya maruto vicetaso rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ🔽na yo yuchati tiṣyo yathā divo 'sme rāranta marutaḥ sahasriṇam🔽yūyaṃ rayim maruta spārhavīraṃ yūyam ṛṣim avatha sāmavipram🔽yūyam arvantam bharatāya vājaṃ yūyaṃ dhattha rājānaṃ śruṣṭimantam🔽tad vo yāmi draviṇaṃ sadyaūtayo yenā svar ṇa tatanāma nṝṃr abhi🔽idaṃ su me maruto haryatā vaco yasya tarema tarasā śataṃ himāḥ
analyzed: sam acyanta vṛjanā atitviṣanta yat svaranti ghoṣam vitatam ṛtāyavaḥ  yuṣmādattasya marutaḥ vicetasaḥ rāyaḥ syāma rathyaḥ vayasvataḥ  na yaḥ yuchati tiṣyaḥ yathā divaḥ sme rāranta marutaḥ sahasriṇam  yūyam rayim marutaḥ spārha vīram yūyam ṛṣim avatha sāma vipram  yūyam arvantam bharatāya vājam yūyam dhattha rājānam śruṣṭimantam  tat vaḥ yāmi draviṇam sadyaūtayaḥ yena svar na tatanāma nṝn abhi  idam su me marutaḥ haryata vacaḥ yasya tarema tarasā śatam himāḥ
translated: They have come together, the people, shining greatly, when they utter the extended sound for the sake of truth.

original: prayajyavo maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayo bṛhad vayo dadhire rukmavakṣasaḥ🔽īyante aśvaiḥ suyamebhir āśubhiḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: prayajyavaḥ marutaḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ bṛhat vayaḥ dadhire rukma vakṣasaḥ 🔽īyante aśvaiḥ su yamebhiḥ āśubhiḥ śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: O Maruts, of you who are self-existent, whose thoughts are far-reaching, may we possess wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed, wealth that is to be enjoyed,

original: svayaṃ dadhidhve taviṣīṃ yathā vida bṛhan mahānta urviyā vi rājatha
analyzed: svayam dadhidhve taviṣīm yathā vida bṛhat mahāntaḥ urviyā vi rājatha
translated: Ye yourselves have grasped your own strength, as ye know it; ye are great, mighty, by your greatness ye shine.

original: utāntarikṣam mamire vy ojasā śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: uta antarikṣam mamire vi ojasā śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: And by your might ye have measured out the atmosphere. The bright ones have turned to their chariots and followed after.

original: sākaṃ jātāḥ subhvaḥ sākam ukṣitāḥ śriye cid ā prataraṃ vāvṛdhur naraḥ
analyzed: sākam jātāḥ su bhvaḥ sākam ukṣitāḥ śriye cit ā prataram vāvṛdhuḥ naraḥ
translated: Born together, mighty, sprinkled together, for glory the men have grown in strength.

original: virokiṇaḥ sūryasyeva raśmayaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: virokiṇaḥ sūryasya iva raśmayaḥ śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: Shining like the rays of the sun. The bright ones have turned to their chariots and followed after.

original: ābhūṣeṇyaṃ vo maruto mahitvanaṃ didṛkṣeṇyaṃ sūryasyeva cakṣaṇam
analyzed: ābhūṣeṇyam vaḥ marutaḥ mahitvanam didṛkṣeṇyam sūryasya iva cakṣaṇam
translated: O Maruts, your greatness is to be desired, your look is to be longed for, like that of the sun.

original: uto asmāṃ amṛtatve dadhātana śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: uta u asmām amṛta tve dadhātana śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: And ye have set us in immortality. The bright ones have turned to their chariots and followed after.

original: ud īrayathā marutaḥ samudrato yūyaṃ vṛṣṭiṃ varṣayathā purīṣiṇaḥ🔽na vo dasrā upa dasyanti dhenavaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: ud īrayatha marutaḥ samudrataḥ yūyam vṛṣṭim varṣayatha purīṣiṇaḥ  na vaḥ dasrāḥ upa dasyanti dhenavaḥ śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: Ye, O Maruts, have raised yourselves from the ocean; ye, the powerful, have caused the rain to fall.🔽Your wondrous milch-kine will not fail. The bright ones have turned to their chariots and followed after.

original: yad aśvān dhūrṣu pṛṣatīr ayugdhvaṃ hiraṇyayān praty atkāṃ amugdhvam
analyzed: yat aśvān dhūrṣu pṛṣatīḥ ayugdhvam hiraṇyayān prati atkām amugdhvam
translated: When ye have yoked your spotted horses to the poles, and have harnessed your golden (chariots),

original: viśvā it spṛdho maruto vy asyatha śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: viśvāḥ id spṛdhaḥ marutaḥ vi asyatha śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: Ye, O Maruts, have overcome all the enemies. The bright ones have turned to their chariots and followed after.

original: na parvatā na nadyo varanta vo yatrācidhvam maruto gachathed u tat
analyzed: na parvatāḥ na nadyaḥ varanta vaḥ yatra acidhvam marutaḥ gachatha id u tat
translated: The mountains and rivers do not obstruct you, O Maruts, wherever you go.

original: uta dyāvāpṛthivī yāthanā pari śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: uta dyāvāpṛthivī yāthana pari śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: And you, O Heaven and Earth, when you are pressed, the auspicious ones turn to follow your chariot wheels.

original: yat pūrvyam maruto yac ca nūtanaṃ yad udyate vasavo yac ca śasyate
analyzed: yat pūrvyam marutaḥ yat ca nūtanam yat udyate vasavaḥ yat ca śasyate
translated: Whatever is ancient, O Maruts, and whatever is new, O Vasus, whatever is rising and whatever is praised,

original: viśvasya tasya bhavathā navedasaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: viśvasya tasya bhavatha navedasaḥ śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: be the discoverers of all that. The auspicious ones turn to follow your chariot wheels.

original: mṛḷata no maruto mā vadhiṣṭanāsmabhyaṃ śarma bahulaṃ vi yantana
analyzed: mṛḍata naḥ marutaḥ mā vadhiṣṭana asmabhyam śarma bahulam vi yantana
translated: Be gracious to us, O Maruts, do not slay us. Spread out for us abundant protection.

original: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gātana śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
analyzed: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gātana śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: Sing in the abode of praise and friendship. The auspicious ones turn to follow your chariot wheels.

original: yūyam asmān nayata vasyo achā nir aṃhatibhyo maruto gṛṇānāḥ
analyzed: yūyam asmān nayata vasyaḥ achā niḥ aṃhatibhyaḥ marutaḥ gṛṇānāḥ
translated: You, O Maruts, praised by us, lead us to what is better, away from the afflictions.

original: juṣadhvaṃ no havyadātiṃ yajatrā vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām
analyzed: juṣadhvam naḥ havya dātim yajatrāḥ vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Accept our oblation, O you who are to be worshipped. May we be the lords of wealth.

original: agne śardhantam ā gaṇam piṣṭaṃ rukmebhir añjibhiḥ
analyzed: agne śardhantam ā gaṇam piṣṭam rukmebhiḥ añjibhiḥ
translated: O Agni, the pressing-stone, adorned with golden ornaments, has pressed the troop of Maruts.

original: viśo adya marutām ava hvaye divaś cid rocanād adhi
analyzed: viśaḥ adya marutām ava hvaye divaḥ cit rocanāt adhi
translated: I call today the clans of the Maruts from the luminous realm of the sky.

original: yathā cin manyase hṛdā tad in me jagmur āśasaḥ
analyzed: yathā cit manyase hṛdā tat id me jagmuḥ āśasaḥ
translated: Even as you think in your heart, so have my hopes come to me.

original: ye te nediṣṭhaṃ havanāny āgaman tān vardha bhīmasaṃdṛśaḥ
analyzed: ye te nediṣṭham havanāni āgaman tān vardha bhīma saṃdṛśaḥ
translated: Those who have come to your nearest invocations, increase them, O you whose appearance is terrible.

original: mīḷhuṣmatīva pṛthivī parāhatā madanty ety asmad ā
analyzed: mīḷhuṣmatī iva pṛthivī parāhatā madantī eti asmat ā
translated: The earth, as if trembling, struck, rejoices when they come to us.

original: ṛkṣo na vo marutaḥ śimīvāṃ amo dudhro gaur iva bhīmayuḥ
analyzed: ṛkṣaḥ na vaḥ marutaḥ śimīvān amaḥ dudhraḥ gauḥ iva bhīmayuḥ
translated: O Maruts, like a swift-moving bear, like a terrible bull, is your impetuous one.

original: ni ye riṇanty ojasā vṛthā gāvo na durdhuraḥ
analyzed: ni ye riṇanti ojasā vṛthā gāvaḥ na durdhuraḥ
translated: Those who break through with their strength, like cows through a weak fence,

original: aśmānaṃ cit svaryam parvataṃ girim pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ🔽ut tiṣṭha nūnam eṣāṃ stomaiḥ samukṣitānām
analyzed: aśmānam cit svaryam parvatam girim pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ  ud tiṣṭha nūnam eṣām stomaiḥ samukṣitānām
translated: Even the heavenly stone, the mountain, the rock, they cause to tremble with their paths.🔽Rise up now to the most ancient, the unprecedented,

original: marutām purutamam apūrvyaṃ gavāṃ sargam iva hvaye🔽yuṅgdhvaṃ hy aruṣī rathe yuṅgdhvaṃ ratheṣu rohitaḥ
analyzed: marutām purutamam apūrvyam gavām sargam iva hvaye  yuṅgdhvam hi aruṣī rathe yuṅgdhvam ratheṣu rohitaḥ
translated: the most numerous of the Maruts, who are anointed with praises, I call for the pouring forth of milk.🔽Yoke the red ones to the chariot, yoke the tawny ones to the chariots,

original: yuṅgdhvaṃ harī ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave
analyzed: yuṅgdhvam harī ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave
translated: yoke the two swift bay horses to the pole, the best to draw to the pole.

original: uta sya vājy aruṣas tuviṣvaṇir iha sma dhāyi darśataḥ
analyzed: uta sya vājī aruṣaḥ tuviṣvaṇiḥ iha sma dhāyi darśataḥ
translated: And let your red steed, strong and powerful, be here, the wonderful one.

original: mā vo yāmeṣu marutaś ciraṃ karat pra taṃ ratheṣu codata
analyzed: mā vaḥ yāmeṣu marutaḥ ciram karat pra tam ratheṣu codata
translated: Do not delay too long on your journeys, O Maruts, urge him on in the chariots.

original: rathaṃ nu mārutaṃ vayaṃ śravasyum ā huvāmahe
analyzed: ratham nu mārutam vayam śravasyum ā huvāmahe
translated: We invoke the Marut chariot, which is eager for glory,

original: ā yasmin tasthau suraṇāni bibhratī sacā marutsu rodasī
analyzed: ā yasmin tasthau suraṇāni bibhratī sacā marutsu rodasī
translated: in which the two worlds stand together, bearing the delights, with the Maruts.

original: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ ratheśubhaṃ tveṣam panasyum ā huve
analyzed: tam vaḥ śardham ratheśubham tveṣam panasyum ā huve
translated: I invoke that your troop, the splendid, the impetuous, the guest, which delights in the chariot,

original: yasmin sujātā subhagā mahīyate sacā marutsu mīḷhuṣī
analyzed: yasmin sujātā subhagā mahīyate sacā marutsu mīḍhuṣī
translated: In whom the well-born, the fortunate, the bountiful one is exalted, together with the Maruts who shower.

original: ā rudrāsa indravantaḥ sajoṣaso hiraṇyarathāḥ suvitāya gantana
analyzed: ā rudrāsaḥ indravantaḥ sajoṣasaḥ hiraṇya rathāḥ suvitāya gantana
translated: The Rudras, united with Indra, of one mind, with golden chariots, come for our welfare.

original: iyaṃ vo asmat prati haryate matis tṛṣṇaje na diva utsā udanyave
analyzed: iyam vaḥ asmat prati haryate matiḥ tṛṣṇaje na divaḥ utsāḥ udanyave
translated: This thought of yours delights in us, like a thirsty one in the rising sun, for the sake of water.

original: vāśīmanta ṛṣṭimanto manīṣiṇaḥ sudhanvāna iṣumanto niṣaṅgiṇaḥ
analyzed: vāśīmantaḥ ṛṣṭimantaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ su dhanvānaḥ iṣumantaḥ niṣaṅgiṇaḥ
translated: Possessing swords, possessing spears, wise, with good bows, with arrows, with quivers,

original: svaśvā stha surathāḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ svāyudhā maruto yāthanā śubham
analyzed: su aśvāḥ stha su rathāḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ su āyudhāḥ marutaḥ yāthana śubham
translated: You have good horses, good chariots, O you of dappled mothers, good weapons, O Maruts, you go for good fortune.

original: dhūnutha dyām parvatān dāśuṣe vasu ni vo vanā jihate yāmano bhiyā
analyzed: dhūnutha dyām parvatān dāśuṣe vasu ni vaḥ vanā jihate yāmanaḥ bhiyā
translated: You shake the sky and the mountains for the sake of wealth for the worshipper. Your forests tremble in fear of your coming.

original: kopayatha pṛthivīm pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhe yad ugrāḥ pṛṣatīr ayugdhvam
analyzed: kopayatha pṛthivīm pṛśni mātaraḥ śubhe yat ugrāḥ pṛṣatīḥ ayugdhvam
translated: You agitate the earth, O you of dappled mothers, when you yoke your spotted (cows), O you who are fierce in good fortune.

original: vātatviṣo maruto varṣanirṇijo yamā iva susadṛśaḥ supeśasaḥ
analyzed: vāta tviṣaḥ marutaḥ varṣa nirṇijaḥ yamāḥ iva su sadṛśaḥ supeśasaḥ
translated: The Maruts, with the splendor of the wind, with rain-garments, like the Yamas, very similar, very beautiful,

original: piśaṅgāśvā aruṇāśvā arepasaḥ pratvakṣaso mahinā dyaur ivoravaḥ
analyzed: piśaṅga aśvāḥ aruṇa aśvāḥ arepasaḥ pratvakṣasaḥ mahinā dyauḥ iva uravaḥ
translated: With yellow horses, red horses, unblemished, with great strength, with might like the sky, with roars.

original: purudrapsā añjimantaḥ sudānavas tveṣasaṃdṛśo anavabhrarādhasaḥ
analyzed: puru drapsāḥ añjimantaḥ sudānavaḥ tveṣa saṃdṛśaḥ anavabhra rādhasaḥ
translated: Of many drops, anointed, very generous, of splendid appearance, of unfailing bounty,

original: sujātāso januṣā rukmavakṣaso divo arkā amṛtaṃ nāma bhejire
analyzed: su jātāsaḥ januṣā rukma vakṣasaḥ divaḥ arkāḥ amṛtam nāma bhejire
translated: Well-born by birth, with golden breasts, the lights of heaven have attained the name of immortality.

original: ṛṣṭayo vo maruto aṃsayor adhi saha ojo bāhvor vo balaṃ hitam
analyzed: ṛṣṭayaḥ vaḥ marutaḥ aṃsayoḥ adhi sahaḥ ojaḥ bāhvoḥ vaḥ balam hitam
translated: Your spears, O Maruts, are on your shoulders, your strength is placed in your arms, O ye of mighty power.

original: nṛmṇā śīrṣasv āyudhā ratheṣu vo viśvā vaḥ śrīr adhi tanūṣu pipiśe
analyzed: nṛmṇā śīrṣasu āyudhā ratheṣu vaḥ viśvā vaḥ śrīḥ adhi tanūṣu pipiśe
translated: Manliness is in your heads, your weapons are in your chariots; all your glory is spread over your bodies.

original: gomad aśvāvad rathavat suvīraṃ candravad rādho maruto dadā naḥ
analyzed: gomat aśvāvat rathavat su vīram candravat rādhaḥ marutaḥ dada naḥ
translated: O Maruts, grant us wealth in cattle, horses, chariots, and brave men, and wealth in the moon.

original: praśastiṃ naḥ kṛṇuta rudriyāso bhakṣīya vo 'vaso daivyasya
analyzed: praśastim naḥ kṛṇuta rudriyāsaḥ bhakṣīya vaḥ vaso daivyasya
translated: Make our praise glorious, O ye sons of Rudra; may we enjoy your divine favour.

original: haye naro maruto mṛḷatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
analyzed: haye naraḥ marutaḥ mṛḍata naḥ tuvīmaghāsaḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: O men, O Maruts, be gracious to us, O ye of mighty bounty, immortal, knowing the truth.

original: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadgirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: satya śrutaḥ kavayaḥ yuvānaḥ bṛhat girayaḥ bṛhat ukṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Ye whose fame is true, ye wise, young, with lofty mountains, pouring forth abundantly.

original: tam u nūnaṃ taviṣīmantam eṣāṃ stuṣe gaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām
analyzed: tam u nūnam taviṣīmantam eṣām stuṣe gaṇam mārutam navyasīnām
translated: I praise that troop of them, the Maruts, of the newest, who are possessed of power.

original: ya āśvaśvā amavad vahanta uteśire amṛtasya svarājaḥ
analyzed: ye āśu aśvāḥ amavat vahante uta īśire amṛtasya svarājaḥ
translated: They who carry the swift horses, the impetuous, have become the immortal, self-ruling ones.

original: tveṣaṃ gaṇaṃ tavasaṃ khādihastaṃ dhunivratam māyinaṃ dātivāram
analyzed: tveṣam gaṇam tavasam khādi hastam dhuni vratam māyinam dāti vāram
translated: The impetuous troop, the mighty one, whose hands grasp food, the one with shaking vows, the magician, the giver of food.

original: mayobhuvo ye amitā mahitvā vandasva vipra tuvirādhaso nṝn
analyzed: mayobhuvaḥ ye amitāḥ mahitvā vandasva vipra tuvi rādhasaḥ nṝn
translated: The bountiful ones, whose greatness is immeasurable, O sage, praise those men of great power.

original: ā vo yantūdavāhāso adya vṛṣṭiṃ ye viśve maruto junanti
analyzed: ā vaḥ yantu uda vāhāsaḥ adya vṛṣṭim ye viśve marutaḥ junanti
translated: Let your messengers come today, O Maruts, who all send down rain and stir it up.

original: ayaṃ yo agnir marutaḥ samiddha etaṃ juṣadhvaṃ kavayo yuvānaḥ
analyzed: ayam yaḥ agniḥ marutaḥ samiddhaḥ etam juṣadhvam kavayaḥ yuvānaḥ
translated: This Agni, O Maruts, who is kindled, accept him, O wise young ones.

original: yūyaṃ rājānam iryaṃ janāya vibhvataṣṭaṃ janayathā yajatrāḥ
analyzed: yūyam rājānam iryam janāya vibhva taṣṭam janayatha yajatrāḥ
translated: You, O holy ones, who are the king of men, whom you have generated, fashioned by Vibhvan,

original: yuṣmad eti muṣṭihā bāhujūto yuṣmad sadaśvo marutaḥ suvīraḥ
analyzed: yuṣmat eti muṣṭi hā bāhu jūtaḥ yuṣmat sat aśvaḥ marutaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: From you comes the fist-fighter, the arm-strong one, from you, O Maruts, the good horse with good men.

original: arā ived acaramā aheva prapra jāyante akavā mahobhiḥ
analyzed: arāḥ iva id a caramāḥ aha iva pra pra jāyante akavāḥ mahobhiḥ
translated: They are born like wheels, like snakes, not the last, with great powers, not in order.

original: pṛśneḥ putrā upamāso rabhiṣṭhāḥ svayā matyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ
analyzed: pṛśneḥ putrāḥ upamāsaḥ rabhiṣṭhāḥ svayā matyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ
translated: The sons of Prsni, the most impetuous, the most excellent, the Maruts, have united through their own thought.

original: yat prāyāsiṣṭa pṛṣatībhir aśvair vīḷupavibhir maruto rathebhiḥ
analyzed: yat prāyāsiṣṭa pṛṣatībhiḥ aśvaiḥ vīḍu pavibhiḥ marutaḥ rathebhiḥ
translated: When you went forth with spotted horses, O Maruts, with your Vīlu-clad chariots,

original: kṣodanta āpo riṇate vanāny avosriyo vṛṣabhaḥ krandatu dyauḥ
analyzed: kṣodante āpaḥ riṇate vanāni ava usriyaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ krandatu dyauḥ
translated: The waters are agitated, the woods are shattered, let the rain-bearing bull roar, let the sky roar.

original: prathiṣṭa yāman pṛthivī cid eṣām bharteva garbhaṃ svam ic chavo dhuḥ
analyzed: prathiṣṭa yāman pṛthivī cit eṣām bhartā iva garbham svam id śavaḥ dhuḥ
translated: Even this earth was extended in their path, as if bearing her own embryo, they carried it through their might.

original: vātān hy aśvān dhury ṛyuyujre varṣaṃ svedaṃ cakrire rudriyāsaḥ
analyzed: vātān hi aśvān dhuri ṛyuyujre varṣam svedam cakrire rudriyāsaḥ
translated: They harnessed the wind-horses to the yoke, the Rudra-like ones made the rain their sweat.

original: haye naro maruto mṛḷatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
analyzed: haye naraḥ marutaḥ mṛḍata naḥ tuvīmaghāsaḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: O men, O Maruts, be gracious to us, O you who are rich in treasures, immortal, knowing the truth.

original: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadgirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: satya śrutaḥ kavayaḥ yuvānaḥ bṛhat girayaḥ bṛhat ukṣamāṇāḥ
translated: The truthful, learned, young, great-voiced, greatly-pouring ones

original: pra va spaḷ akran suvitāya dāvane 'rcā dive pra pṛthivyā ṛtam bhare🔽ukṣante aśvān taruṣanta ā rajo 'nu svam bhānuṃ śrathayante arṇavaiḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ spaḷ akran suvitāya dāvane rcā dive pra pṛthivyai ṛtam bhare  ukṣante aśvān ā rajaḥ nu svam bhānum śrathayante arṇavaiḥ
translated: Have come forth to give us bliss. I offer praise to heaven and earth, I uphold the truth.🔽They sprinkle the horses, they speed through the realm, they stretch out their own light with the waves.

original: amād eṣām bhiyasā bhūmir ejati naur na pūrṇā kṣarati vyathir yatī
analyzed: amāt eṣām bhiyasā bhūmiḥ ejati nauḥ na pūrṇā kṣarati vyathiḥ yatī
translated: The earth trembles with fear of them, like a full ship leaks as it goes on its way.

original: dūredṛśo ye citayanta emabhir antar mahe vidathe yetire naraḥ
analyzed: dūredṛśaḥ ye citayante emabhiḥ antar mahe vidathe yetire naraḥ
translated: Those who are seen from afar, who move with the rays, the men who have gone forth in the great assembly.

original: gavām iva śriyase śṛṅgam uttamaṃ sūryo na cakṣū rajaso visarjane
analyzed: gavām iva śriyase śṛṅgam uttamam sūryaḥ na cakṣuḥ rajasaḥ visarjane
translated: Like the highest peak for the glory of the cows, like the sun for the realm of the eye.

original: atyā iva subhvaś cārava sthana maryā iva śriyase cetathā naraḥ
analyzed: atyāḥ iva su bhvaḥ cāravaḥ sthana maryāḥ iva śriyase cetathā naraḥ
translated: You stand like swift bulls, you think like boundaries for glory, O men.

original: ko vo mahānti mahatām ud aśnavat kas kāvyā marutaḥ ko ha pauṃsyā
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ mahānti mahatām ud aśnavat kaḥ kāvyā marutaḥ kaḥ ha pauṃsyā
translated: Who of you has attained the great deeds of the great ones? Who of you, O Maruts, has the wisdom? Who has the manliness?

original: yūyaṃ ha bhūmiṃ kiraṇaṃ na rejatha pra yad bharadhve suvitāya dāvane
analyzed: yūyam ha bhūmim kiraṇam na rejatha pra yat bharadhve suvitāya dāvane
translated: You have shaken the earth like a net, when you carry it forth to give it for prosperity.

original: aśvā ived aruṣāsaḥ sabandhavaḥ śūrā iva prayudhaḥ prota yuyudhuḥ
analyzed: aśvāḥ iva id aruṣāsaḥ sabandhavaḥ śūrāḥ iva prayudhaḥ pra uta yuyudhuḥ
translated: Like red horses with the same bond, like heroes with weapons, they have fought.

original: maryā iva suvṛdho vāvṛdhur naraḥ sūryasya cakṣuḥ pra minanti vṛṣṭibhiḥ
analyzed: maryāḥ iva suvṛdhaḥ vāvṛdhuḥ naraḥ sūryasya cakṣuḥ pra minanti vṛṣṭibhiḥ
translated: The men have grown like boundaries, they have grown great, they open out the eye of Surya with showers.

original: te ajyeṣṭhā akaniṣṭhāsa udbhido 'madhyamāso mahasā vi vāvṛdhuḥ
analyzed: te a jyeṣṭhāḥ a kaniṣṭhāsaḥ udbhidaḥ madhyamāsaḥ mahasā vi vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: They, without eldest, without youngest, springing up, the middle ones have grown great in their might.

original: sujātāso januṣā pṛśnimātaro divo maryā ā no achā jigātana
analyzed: su jātāsaḥ januṣā pṛśni mātaraḥ divaḥ maryāḥ ā naḥ achā jigātana
translated: Well-born, born of a dappled mother, the Maruts, the boundaries of heaven, come hither to us.

original: vayo na ye śreṇīḥ paptur ojasāntān divo bṛhataḥ sānunas pari
analyzed: vayaḥ na ye śreṇīḥ paptuḥ ojasā antān divaḥ bṛhataḥ sānunaḥ pari
translated: They who have flown in rows like birds in their might from the heights of the lofty heaven.

original: aśvāsa eṣām ubhaye yathā viduḥ pra parvatasya nabhanūṃr acucyavuḥ
analyzed: aśvāsaḥ eṣām ubhaye yathā viduḥ pra parvatasya nabhanūn acucyavuḥ
translated: The horses of these all know as they should; they have shaken the clouds of the mountain.

original: mimātu dyaur aditir vītaye naḥ saṃ dānucitrā uṣaso yatantām
analyzed: mimātu dyauḥ aditiḥ vītaye naḥ sam dānu citrāḥ uṣasaḥ yatantām
translated: May Dyaus and Aditi be measured for our worship; may the dawns, adorned with rain, strive (to help us).

original: ācucyavur divyaṃ kośam eta ṛṣe rudrasya maruto gṛṇānāḥ
analyzed: ācucyavuḥ divyam kośam ete ṛṣe rudrasya marutaḥ gṛṇānāḥ
translated: The R̥ishis, the Maruts, the sons of Rudra, have shaken this heavenly vessel, singing (his praise).

original: īḷe agniṃ svavasaṃ namobhir iha prasatto vi cayat kṛtaṃ naḥ
analyzed: īḍe agnim su avasam namobhiḥ iha prasattaḥ vi cayat kṛtam naḥ
translated: With adorations I worship Agni, the self-dependent One; may he, delighted here, remove whatever is amiss with us.

original: rathair iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇin marutāṃ stomam ṛdhyām
analyzed: rathaiḥ iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇit marutām stomam ṛdhyām
translated: As if with chariots I urge on the impetuous ones; may I prosper the praise of the Maruts, going round (to their honour).

original: ā ye tasthuḥ pṛṣatīṣu śrutāsu sukheṣu rudrā maruto ratheṣu
analyzed: ā ye tasthuḥ pṛṣatīṣu śrutāsu sukheṣu rudrāḥ marutaḥ ratheṣu
translated: Those who have stood on the well-known spotted (cows), the pleasant ones, the Rudras, the Maruts, on the chariots.

original: vanā cid ugrā jihate ni vo bhiyā pṛthivī cid rejate parvataś cit
analyzed: vanā cit ugrā jihate ni vaḥ bhiyā pṛthivī cit rejate parvataḥ cit
translated: Even the woods tremble through your fear, the earth itself is agitated, even the mountain quakes.

original: parvataś cin mahi vṛddho bibhāya divaś cit sānu rejata svane vaḥ
analyzed: parvataḥ cit mahi vṛddhaḥ bibhāya divaḥ cit sānu rejata svane vaḥ
translated: Even the great and mighty mountain trembled, even the ridge of heaven shook at your roar.

original: yat krīḷatha maruta ṛṣṭimanta āpa iva sadhryañco dhavadhve
analyzed: yat krīḍatha marutaḥ ṛṣṭimantaḥ āpaḥ iva sadhryañcaḥ dhavadhve
translated: When ye, O Maruts, armed with knives, sport, ye rush together like waters.

original: varā ived raivatāso hiraṇyair abhi svadhābhis tanvaḥ pipiśre
analyzed: varāḥ iva id raivatāsaḥ hiraṇyaiḥ abhi svadhābhiḥ tanvaḥ pipiśre
translated: Like suitors, with their own powers, with gold, they have anointed their bodies, with their own powers.

original: śriye śreyāṃsas tavaso ratheṣu satrā mahāṃsi cakrire tanūṣu
analyzed: śriye śreyāṃsaḥ tavasaḥ ratheṣu satrā mahāṃsi cakrire tanūṣu
translated: For glory, for pre-eminence, for their own sake, they have ever wrought great deeds on their cars.

original: ajyeṣṭhāso akaniṣṭhāsa ete sam bhrātaro vāvṛdhuḥ saubhagāya
analyzed: a jyeṣṭhāsaḥ a kaniṣṭhāsaḥ ete sam bhrātaraḥ vāvṛdhuḥ saubhagāya
translated: These brothers, not the eldest, not the youngest, have grown up together for good fortune.

original: yuvā pitā svapā rudra eṣāṃ sudughā pṛśniḥ sudinā marudbhyaḥ
analyzed: yuvā pitā su apāḥ rudraḥ eṣām su dughā pṛśniḥ su dinā marudbhyaḥ
translated: The young father, the self-ruler, is their Rudra; the milch-cow, the dappled one, the good day is for the Maruts.

original: yad uttame maruto madhyame vā yad vāvame subhagāso divi ṣṭha
analyzed: yat uttame marutaḥ madhyame vā yat vā avame subhagāsaḥ divi ṣṭha
translated: Whether ye be, O Maruts, in the highest heaven, or in the middle one, or in the lowest, O ye prosperous ones,

original: ato no rudrā uta vā nv asyāgne vittād dhaviṣo yad yajāma
analyzed: atas naḥ rudrāḥ uta vā nu asya agne vittāt haviṣaḥ yat yajāma
translated: From that place, O Rudras, or from this, O Agni, know the oblation which we offer.

original: agniś ca yan maruto viśvavedaso divo vahadhva uttarād adhi ṣṇubhiḥ
analyzed: agniḥ ca yat marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ divaḥ vahadhve uttarāt adhi snubhiḥ
translated: And, O ye all-knowing Maruts, bring Agni from the highest heaven, with the swift ones.

original: te mandasānā dhunayo riśādaso vāmaṃ dhatta yajamānāya sunvate
analyzed: te mandasānāḥ dhunayaḥ riśādasaḥ vāmam dhatta yajamānāya sunvate
translated: Being gladdened, shaking, destroying the foe, bestow good things on the sacrificer who presses (the Soma).

original: agne marudbhiḥ śubhayadbhir ṛkvabhiḥ somam piba mandasāno gaṇaśribhiḥ
analyzed: agne marudbhiḥ śubhayadbhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ somam piba mandasānaḥ gaṇa śribhiḥ
translated: O Agni, with the Maruts, the prosperous, the singers, rejoice, and drink the Soma, delighted, with the bands of nobles.

original: pāvakebhir viśvaminvebhir āyubhir vaiśvānara pradivā ketunā sajūḥ
analyzed: pāvakebhiḥ viśvaminvebhiḥ āyubhiḥ vaiśvānara pradivā ketunā sajūs
translated: With purifying, all-impelling, life-giving fires, O Vaiśvānara, with the banner of the day, in unison

original: ke ṣṭhā naraḥ śreṣṭhatamā ya ekaeka āyaya
