analyzed: ke stha naraḥ śreṣṭhatamāḥ ye eka ekaḥ āyaya
translated: Where are those men, the best of the best, who have come one by one?

original: paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ
analyzed: paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ
translated: From the farthest distance

original: kva vo 'śvāḥ kvṛbhīśavaḥ kathaṃ śeka kathā yaya
analyzed: kva vaḥ śvās kva ṛbhīśavaḥ katham śeka kathā yaya
translated: Where are your horses, your swift bulls? How did you manage, how did you go?

original: pṛṣṭhe sado nasor yamaḥ🔽jaghane coda eṣāṃ vi sakthāni naro yamuḥ🔽putrakṛthe na janayaḥ
analyzed: pṛṣṭhe sadaḥ nasoḥ yamaḥ  jaghane codaḥ eṣām vi sakthāni naraḥ yamuḥ  putrakṛthe na janayaḥ
translated: The seat is on the back, Yama on the nose.🔽The men have stretched out their legs on the sides and thighs of these.🔽In the place of the son's birth, O young women.

original: parā vīrāsa etana maryāso bhadrajānayaḥ
analyzed: parā vīrāsaḥ etana maryāsaḥ bhadra jānayaḥ
translated: Go away, O heroes, O men, O sons of good birth.

original: agnitapo yathāsatha🔽sanat sāśvyam paśum uta gavyaṃ śatāvayam
analyzed: agni tapaḥ yathā asatha  sanat sā aśvyam paśum uta gavyam śatāvayam
translated: As you sit in the heat of Agni.🔽The one with a hundred possessions, the one with horses and cattle,

original: śyāvāśvastutāya yā dor vīrāyopabarbṛhat
analyzed: śyāvāśva stutāya yā doḥ vīrāya upabarbṛhat
translated: Which you have spread out for the hero praised by Śyāvāśva.

original: uta tvā strī śaśīyasī puṃso bhavati vasyasī
analyzed: uta tvā strī śaśīyasī puṃsaḥ bhavati vasyasī
translated: And a woman may be better, more prosperous, than a man

original: adevatrād arādhasaḥ
analyzed: adevatrāt arādhasaḥ
translated: Who is not devoted to the gods, who is not generous.

original: vi yā jānāti jasuriṃ vi tṛṣyantaṃ vi kāminam
analyzed: vi yā jānāti jasurim vi tṛṣyantam vi kāminam
translated: He who knows the one who is sick, the one who is thirsty, the one who is passionate,

original: devatrā kṛṇute manaḥ
analyzed: devatrā kṛṇute manaḥ
translated: Turns his mind toward the gods.

original: uta ghā nemo astutaḥ pumāṃ iti bruve paṇiḥ
analyzed: uta ghā nemaḥ a stutaḥ pumān iti bruve paṇiḥ
translated: And I say this to the poor, unpraised man, the miser:

original: sa vairadeya it samaḥ
analyzed: sa vaira deye id samaḥ
translated: He is indeed the one who gives grudgingly.

original: uta me 'rapad yuvatir mamanduṣī prati śyāvāya vartanim
analyzed: uta me rapat yuvatiḥ mamanduṣī prati śyāvāya vartanim
translated: And the young woman who delights in me has turned to the dark one for a path.

original: vi rohitā purumīḷhāya yematur viprāya dīrghayaśase🔽yo me dhenūnāṃ śataṃ vaidadaśvir yathā dadat
analyzed: vi rohitā purumīḷhāya yematuḥ viprāya dīrgha yaśase  yaḥ me dhenūnām śatam vaidadaśviḥ yathā dadat
translated: The red ones have been set in motion by Purumīḷha for the priest of far-reaching fame,🔽Just as the son of Vīda gave me a hundred milch cows,

original: taranta iva maṃhanā
analyzed: tarantaḥ iva maṃhanā
translated: Like those who cross (the flood) with their might,

original: ya īṃ vahanta āśubhiḥ pibanto madiram madhu
analyzed: ye īm vahante āśubhiḥ pibantaḥ madiram madhu
translated: Those who carry him with swift (steeds), drinking intoxicating honey,

original: atra śravāṃsi dadhire
analyzed: atra śravāṃsi dadhire
translated: Here they have won the glories,

original: yeṣāṃ śriyādhi rodasī vibhrājante ratheṣv ā
analyzed: yeṣām śriyā adhi rodasī vibhrājante ratheṣu ā
translated: Whose glory is in the two worlds, shining on their chariots,

original: divi rukma ivopari
analyzed: divi rukmaḥ iva upari
translated: Like a gem in the sky above.

original: yuvā sa māruto gaṇas tveṣaratho anedyaḥ
analyzed: yuvā sa mārutaḥ gaṇaḥ tveṣa rathaḥ anedyaḥ
translated: That youthful host of Maruts, with their glittering chariot, is irreproachable,

original: śubhaṃyāvāpratiṣkutaḥ
analyzed: śubhaṃyāvā apratiṣkutaḥ
translated: Of auspicious course, irresistible.

original: ko veda nūnam eṣāṃ yatrā madanti dhūtayaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ veda nūnam eṣām yatrā madanti dhūtayaḥ
translated: Who knows for certain where they rejoice, those purified ones,

original: ṛtajātā arepasaḥ
analyzed: ṛta jātāḥ arepasaḥ
translated: Born of order, unblemished?

original: yūyam martaṃ vipanyavaḥ praṇetāra itthā dhiyā
analyzed: yūyam martam vipanyavaḥ praṇetāraḥ itthā dhiyā
translated: You, O you who turn away the mortal, are the leaders of this man by thought,

original: śrotāro yāmahūtiṣu🔽te no vasūni kāmyā puruścandrā riśādasaḥ
analyzed: śrotāraḥ yāma hūtiṣu  te naḥ vasūni kāmyā puru ścandrā riśādasaḥ
translated: The hearers at the calls for help.🔽Those who are worthy of sacrifice, the Vṛtraslayers, the destroyers of enemies,

original: ā yajñiyāso vavṛttana
analyzed: ā yajñiyāsaḥ vavṛttana
translated: Have turned to us for the desirable goods, O you of various lights.

original: etam me stomam ūrmye dārbhyāya parā vaha
analyzed: etam me stomam ūrmye dārbhyāya parā vaha
translated: O Ūrmyā, bring this praise of mine to Dārbhī,

original: giro devi rathīr iva
analyzed: giraḥ devi rathīḥ iva
translated: O goddess, like a charioteer,

original: uta me vocatād iti sutasome rathavītau
analyzed: uta me vocatāt iti suta some rathavītau
translated: And let him speak to me, to Sutasoma, to Rathvīti,

original: na kāmo apa veti me
analyzed: na kāmaḥ apa veti me
translated: My desire does not turn away from him.

original: eṣa kṣeti rathavītir maghavā gomatīr anu
analyzed: eṣa kṣeti rathavītiḥ maghavā gomatīḥ anu
translated: This Maghavan, the charioteer, moves among the cow-rich (tribes),

original: parvateṣv apaśritaḥ
analyzed: parvateṣu apaśritaḥ
translated: Resorting to the mountains.

original: ṛtena ṛtam apihitaṃ dhruvaṃ vāṃ sūryasya yatra vimucanty aśvān
analyzed: ṛtena ṛtam apihitam dhruvam vām sūryasya yatra vimucanti aśvān
translated: By truth your firm and hidden truth is guarded, where they unyoke the steeds of the sun.

original: daśa śatā saha tasthus tad ekaṃ devānāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ vapuṣām apaśyam
analyzed: daśa śatā saha tasthuḥ tat ekam devānām śreṣṭham vapuṣām apaśyam
translated: I have seen that one, the best of the gods' forms, which ten hundred have supported.

original: tat su vām mitrāvaruṇā mahitvam īrmā tasthuṣīr ahabhir duduhre
analyzed: tat su vām mitrāvaruṇāḥ mahitvam īrmā tasthuṣīḥ ahabhiḥ duduhre
translated: That greatness of yours, O Mitra and Varuna, the slow ones have milked with the days.

original: viśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svasarasya dhenā anu vām ekaḥ pavir ā vavarta
analyzed: viśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svasarasya dhenāḥ anu vām ekaḥ paviḥ ā vavarta
translated: You fill all the lowing cows of the self-existent one; one of you has turned to the sieve.

original: adhārayatam pṛthivīm uta dyām mitrarājānā varuṇā mahobhiḥ
analyzed: adhārayatam pṛthivīm uta dyām mitra rājānā varuṇā mahobhiḥ
translated: You, O Mitra and Varuna, kings, have supported the earth and the sky with your powers.

original: vardhayatam oṣadhīḥ pinvataṃ gā ava vṛṣṭiṃ sṛjataṃ jīradānū🔽ā vām aśvāsaḥ suyujo vahantu yataraśmaya upa yantv arvāk
analyzed: vardhayatam oṣadhīḥ pinvatam gāḥ ava vṛṣṭim sṛjatam jīra dānū  ā vām aśvāsaḥ su yujaḥ vahantu yata raśmayaḥ upa yantu arvāk
translated: You have increased the plants, you have filled the cows, you have sent down the rain, O you who give quickly.🔽Let your well-yoked horses bring you hitherward, let the rays come to you from every side.

original: ghṛtasya nirṇig anu vartate vām upa sindhavaḥ pradivi kṣaranti
analyzed: ghṛtasya nirṇij anu vartate vām upa sindhavaḥ pradivi kṣaranti
translated: The stream of ghee flows after you; the rivers pour forth on the surface of the earth.

original: anu śrutām amatiṃ vardhad urvīm barhir iva yajuṣā rakṣamāṇā🔽namasvantā dhṛtadakṣādhi garte mitrāsāthe varuṇeḷāsv antaḥ
analyzed: anu śrutām amatim vardhat urvīm barhiḥ iva yajuṣā rakṣamāṇā  namasvantā dhṛtadakṣā adhi garte mitrā āsāthe varuṇā iḷāsu antar
translated: Increasing the wide-spread fame that is heard, guarding it like a sacrificial grass with a Yajus formula,🔽Bowing, with firm powers in the pit, O Mitra and Varuna, you sit in the bowls.

original: akravihastā sukṛte paraspā yaṃ trāsāthe varuṇeḷāsv antaḥ
analyzed: a kravi hastā su kṛte paraspā yam trāsāthe varuṇā iḷāsu antar
translated: With unblemished hands, O you who protect the well-made one, whom you sit in the bowls, O Mitra and Varuna.

original: rājānā kṣatram ahṛṇīyamānā sahasrasthūṇam bibhṛthaḥ saha dvau
analyzed: rājānā kṣatram a hṛṇīyamānā sahasra sthūṇam bibhṛthaḥ saha dvau
translated: O Kings, not disdaining the Kshatriya, ye support the thousand-pillared (heaven) and the two (earth).

original: hiraṇyanirṇig ayo asya sthūṇā vi bhrājate divy aśvājanīva
analyzed: hiraṇya nirṇij ayaḥ asya sthūṇā vi bhrājate divi aśvājanī iva
translated: Its pillar is of iron, its top is of gold; it shines in the sky like a horse-winning (chariot).

original: bhadre kṣetre nimitā tilvile vā sanema madhvo adhigartyasya
analyzed: bhadre kṣetre nimitā tilvile vā sanema madhvaḥ adhigartyasya
translated: In a good field or in a tilvilā (plant) we would enjoy the honey of the Adhigartya (plant).

original: hiraṇyarūpam uṣaso vyuṣṭāv ayasthūṇam uditā sūryasya
analyzed: hiraṇya rūpam uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau aya sthūṇam uditā sūryasya
translated: At the rising of the dawns it is of the form of gold, at the rising of the sun its pillar is of iron.

original: ā rohatho varuṇa mitra gartam ataś cakṣāthe aditiṃ ditiṃ ca
analyzed: ā rohathaḥ varuṇa mitra gartam atas cakṣāthe aditim ditim ca
translated: O Varuṇa and Mitra, ye ascend the pit; thence ye look on Aditi and Diti.

original: yad baṃhiṣṭhaṃ nātividhe sudānū achidraṃ śarma bhuvanasya gopā
analyzed: yat baṃhiṣṭham na atividhe sudānū achidram śarma bhuvanasya gopā
translated: With that which is most bountiful, O ye bountiful ones, which is not to be surpassed, the flawless shelter, guardians of the world,

original: tena no mitrāvaruṇāv aviṣṭaṃ siṣāsanto jigīvāṃsaḥ syāma
analyzed: tena naḥ mitrāvaruṇau aviṣṭam siṣāsantaḥ jigīvāṃsaḥ syāma
translated: with that, O Mitra and Varuṇa, do ye favour us; longing for it, may we be victorious.

original: ṛtasya gopāv adhi tiṣṭhatho rathaṃ satyadharmāṇā parame vyomani
analyzed: ṛtasya gopau adhi tiṣṭhathaḥ ratham satya dharmāṇā parame vyomani
translated: Ye are the two guardians of holy order; on your chariot ye stand in the highest heaven, O ye of true law.

original: yam atra mitrāvaruṇāvatho yuvaṃ tasmai vṛṣṭir madhumat pinvate divaḥ
analyzed: yam atra mitrāvaruṇau avathaḥ yuvam tasmai vṛṣṭiḥ madhumat pinvate divaḥ
translated: That which ye, O Mitra and Varuṇa, bestow here, for him the rain of heaven swells with honey.

original: samrājāv asya bhuvanasya rājatho mitrāvaruṇā vidathe svardṛśā
analyzed: samrājau asya bhuvanasya rājathaḥ mitrāvaruṇā vidathe svar dṛśā
translated: Ye are the two Emperors, ye rule over this world, O Mitra and Varuṇa, in the holy place, ye who behold the light.

original: vṛṣṭiṃ vāṃ rādho amṛtatvam īmahe dyāvāpṛthivī vi caranti tanyavaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣṭim vām rādhaḥ amṛta tvam īmahe dyāvāpṛthivī vi caranti tanyavaḥ
translated: We implore from you, O heaven and earth, rain and bounty, and immortality; the thunders move between you.

original: samrājā ugrā vṛṣabhā divas patī pṛthivyā mitrāvaruṇā vicarṣaṇī🔽citrebhir abhrair upa tiṣṭhatho ravaṃ dyāṃ varṣayatho asurasya māyayā
analyzed: samrājau ugrā vṛṣabhā divaḥ patī pṛthivyāḥ mitrāvaruṇā vicarṣaṇī  citrebhiḥ abhraiḥ upa tiṣṭhathaḥ ravam dyām varṣayathaḥ asurasya māyayā
translated: The two mighty, fierce, bull-like lords of heaven, Mitra and Varuna, swift in action, on earth,🔽You two support the cloud with your wondrous works, and make the sky rain by the magic power of the Asura.

original: māyā vām mitrāvaruṇā divi śritā sūryo jyotiś carati citram āyudham
analyzed: māyā vām mitrāvaruṇāḥ divi śritā sūryaḥ jyotiḥ carati citram āyudham
translated: Your magic, O Mitra and Varuna, is established in the sky; the sun moves with wondrous weapons as its light.

original: tam abhreṇa vṛṣṭyā gūhatho divi parjanya drapsā madhumanta īrate
analyzed: tam abhreṇa vṛṣṭyā gūhathaḥ divi parjanya drapsāḥ madhumantaḥ īrate
translated: You two cover it with the cloud and rain in the sky; the drops of Parjanya flow with sweetness.

original: rathaṃ yuñjate marutaḥ śubhe sukhaṃ śūro na mitrāvaruṇā gaviṣṭiṣu
analyzed: ratham yuñjate marutaḥ śubhe sukham śūraḥ na mitrāvaruṇā gaviṣṭiṣu
translated: The Maruts yoke the beautiful, pleasant chariot; the hero, like Mitra and Varuna, in the contests for the cow.

original: rajāṃsi citrā vi caranti tanyavo divaḥ samrājā payasā na ukṣatam
analyzed: rajāṃsi citrāḥ vi caranti tanyavaḥ divaḥ samrājā payasā naḥ ukṣatam
translated: The wondrous clouds move through the variegated realms; O two lords of the sky, rain down the milk.

original: vācaṃ su mitrāvaruṇāv irāvatīm parjanyaś citrāṃ vadati tviṣīmatīm
analyzed: vācam su mitrāvaruṇau irāvatīm parjanyaḥ citrām vadati tviṣīmatīm
translated: Parjanya speaks the wondrous, shining, powerful speech, full of food, O Mitra and Varuna.

original: abhrā vasata marutaḥ su māyayā dyāṃ varṣayatam aruṇām arepasam
analyzed: abhrā vasata marutaḥ su māyayā dyām varṣayatam aruṇām arepasam
translated: The Maruts dwell in the cloud with their wondrous power; rain down the sky, red, spotless.

original: dharmaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā rakṣethe asurasya māyayā
analyzed: dharmaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā rakṣethe asurasya māyayā
translated: By the wise law, O Mitra and Varuna, you two protect the vows by the magic power of the Asura.

original: ṛtena viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājathaḥ sūryam ā dhattho divi citryaṃ ratham
analyzed: ṛtena viśvam bhuvanam vi rājathaḥ sūryam ā dhatthaḥ divi citryam ratham
translated: By the holy power you two rule over the whole world; you two have placed the sun, the wondrous chariot, in the sky.

original: varuṇaṃ vo riśādasam ṛcā mitraṃ havāmahe
analyzed: varuṇam vaḥ riśādasam ṛcā mitram havāmahe
translated: With a verse we invoke Varuna, the destroyer of enemies, and Mitra,

original: pari vrajeva bāhvor jaganvāṃsā svarṇaram
analyzed: pari vrajā iva bāhvoḥ jaganvāṃsā svarṇaram
translated: Like two arms, O ye two, ye have encompassed the golden one.

original: tā bāhavā sucetunā pra yantam asmā arcate
analyzed: tā bāhavā sucetunā pra yantam asmai arcate
translated: Those two arms, with good thought, have gone forth to him who sings praises.

original: śevaṃ hi jāryaṃ vāṃ viśvāsu kṣāsu joguve
analyzed: śevam hi jāryam vām viśvāsu kṣāsu joguve
translated: For you two are to be served, to be honoured, in all the families.

original: yan nūnam aśyāṃ gatim mitrasya yāyām pathā
analyzed: yat nūnam aśyām gatim mitrasya yāyām pathā
translated: What course shall I now take? By what path shall I go to Mitra?

original: asya priyasya śarmaṇy ahiṃsānasya saścire
analyzed: asya priyasya śarmaṇi a hiṃsānasya saścire
translated: To the protection of this dear one, to the observance of this harmless one.

original: yuvābhyām mitrāvaruṇopamaṃ dheyām ṛcā
analyzed: yuvābhyām mitrāvaruṇā upamam dheyām ṛcā
translated: To you two, O Mitra and Varuna, I will offer the most excellent praise with a verse,

original: yad dha kṣaye maghonāṃ stotṇāṃ ca spūrdhase
analyzed: yat ha kṣaye maghonām stotṇām ca spūrdhase
translated: Since you two, in the abode of the generous ones and the praisers, compete.

original: ā no mitra sudītibhir varuṇaś ca sadhastha ā
analyzed: ā naḥ mitra su dītibhiḥ varuṇaḥ ca sadhasthe ā
translated: Come to us, O Mitra with your fair lights, and Varuna, to the assembly,

original: sve kṣaye maghonāṃ sakhīnāṃ ca vṛdhase🔽yuvaṃ no yeṣu varuṇa kṣatram bṛhac ca bibhṛthaḥ
analyzed: sve kṣaye maghonām sakhīnām ca vṛdhase  yuvam naḥ yeṣu varuṇa kṣatram bṛhat ca bibhṛthaḥ
translated: To your own abode, to increase the generosity of the generous ones and the friends.🔽In those (sacrifices), O Varuna, in which you two uphold the great lordship,

original: uru ṇo vājasātaye kṛtaṃ rāye svastaye
analyzed: uru naḥ vājasātaye kṛtam rāye svastaye
translated: Make it wide for us to gain strength, for the sake of wealth and well-being.

original: uchantyām me yajatā devakṣatre ruśadgavi
analyzed: uchantyām me yajatā devakṣatre ruśadgavi
translated: In the rising, in my sacrifice, in the divine realm, in the ruddy cow,

original: sutaṃ somaṃ na hastibhir ā paḍbhir dhāvataṃ narā bibhratāv arcanānasam
analyzed: sutam somam na hastibhiḥ ā paḍbhiḥ dhāvatam narā bibhratau arcanānasam
translated: Bring the pressed Soma with your hands, O heroes, with your feet, carrying the oblation.

original: yaś ciketa sa sukratur devatrā sa bravītu naḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ciketa sa su kratuḥ devatrā sa bravītu naḥ
translated: He who knows this, he is the wise one. Let him speak to us about the gods.

original: varuṇo yasya darśato mitro vā vanate giraḥ
analyzed: varuṇaḥ yasya darśataḥ mitraḥ vā vanate giraḥ
translated: The wonderful Varuna, or Mitra, whose praises are sung,

original: tā hi śreṣṭhavarcasā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā
analyzed: tā hi śreṣṭha varcasā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā
translated: For you, O Kings, are most glorious, most renowned of all.

original: tā satpatī ṛtāvṛdha ṛtāvānā janejane
analyzed: tā sat patī ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ṛtāvānā janejane
translated: You, whose lords are good, who strengthen the pious, who are righteous, in every race of men.

original: tā vām iyāno 'vase pūrvā upa bruve sacā🔽svaśvāsaḥ su cetunā vājāṃ abhi pra dāvane
analyzed: tā vām iyānaḥ vase pūrvau upa bruve sacā  su aśvāsaḥ su cetunā vājām abhi pra dāvane
translated: To you two, thus, I call for help, to you two first, to you two together.🔽With good horses, with good choice, for the bestowing of strength, to Mitra, the bountiful.

original: mitro aṃhoś cid ād uru kṣayāya gātuṃ vanate
analyzed: mitraḥ aṃhoḥ cit āt uru kṣayāya gātum vanate
translated: Even from distress he wins a wide path for his dwelling.

original: mitrasya hi pratūrvataḥ sumatir asti vidhataḥ
analyzed: mitrasya hi pratūrvataḥ sumatiḥ asti vidhataḥ
translated: For Mitra, the impetuous, the all-ordering, has a good will.

original: vayam mitrasyāvasi syāma saprathastame
analyzed: vayam mitrasya avasi syāma saprathastame
translated: May we be in the most widely extended help of Mitra.

original: anehasas tvotayaḥ satrā varuṇaśeṣasaḥ
analyzed: anehasaḥ tvotayaḥ satrā varuṇa śeṣasaḥ
translated: The unoffending, the well-ordered, the ever-present, the followers of Varuṇa.

original: yuvam mitremaṃ janaṃ yatathaḥ saṃ ca nayathaḥ
analyzed: yuvam mitrā imam janam yatathaḥ sam ca nayathaḥ
translated: You two, O Mitra and Varuṇa, protect this people, and lead it on.

original: mā maghonaḥ pari khyatam mo asmākam ṛṣīṇāṃ gopīthe na uruṣyatam
analyzed: mā maghonaḥ pari khyatam mā u asmākam ṛṣīṇām gopīthe naḥ uruṣyatam
translated: Do not forsake the wealthy, do not forsake us Rṣis. Be our protectors in the drinking of the cows.

original: ā cikitāna sukratū devau marta riśādasā
analyzed: ā cikitāna su kratū devau marta riśādasā
translated: The two wise, the all-seeing, the two Gods, the slayers of the foe.

original: varuṇāya ṛtapeśase dadhīta prayase mahe
analyzed: varuṇāya ṛta peśase dadhīta prayase mahe
translated: To Varuṇa, whose form is truth, one should offer in the great service.

original: tā hi kṣatram avihrutaṃ samyag asuryam āśāte
analyzed: tā hi kṣatram a vihrutam samyak asuryam āśāte
translated: For they have gained the unshaken kingship, the true lordship of the Asuras.

original: adha vrateva mānuṣaṃ svar ṇa dhāyi darśatam🔽tā vām eṣe rathānām urvīṃ gavyūtim eṣām
analyzed: adha vratā iva mānuṣam svar na dhāyi darśatam  tā vām rathānām urvīm gavyūtim eṣām
translated: And then the beautiful heavenly light was placed among men, as if in a vow.🔽To you two I go for the wide paths of these chariots, for the great pasture of these.

original: rātahavyasya suṣṭutiṃ dadhṛk stomair manāmahe
analyzed: rāta havyasya suṣṭutim dadhṛṣ stomaiḥ manāmahe
translated: We will support the praise of Rātahavya with our strong hymns.

original: adhā hi kāvyā yuvaṃ dakṣasya pūrbhir adbhutā
analyzed: adhā hi kāvyā yuvam dakṣasya pūrbhiḥ adbhutā
translated: For you two are the most excellent of the wise, with the forts of skill, wondrous

original: ni ketunā janānāṃ cikethe pūtadakṣasā
analyzed: ni ketunā janānām cikethe pūta dakṣasā
translated: With your sign you have shone forth over the people, with your purified skill

original: tad ṛtam pṛthivi bṛhac chravaeṣa ṛṣīṇām
analyzed: tat ṛtam pṛthivi bṛhat śravaḥ eṣaḥ ṛṣīṇām
translated: That is the great truth, O Earth, of the Rishis

original: jrayasānāv aram pṛthv ati kṣaranti yāmabhiḥ🔽ā yad vām īyacakṣasā mitra vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ
analyzed: jrayasānau aram pṛthu ati kṣaranti yāmabhiḥ  ā yat vām mitra vayam ca sūrayaḥ
translated: The two of you, with your strength, flow over the wide earth with your streams🔽When we, O Mitra, and the princes, with our far-seeing eye

original: vyaciṣṭhe bahupāyye yatemahi svarājye
analyzed: vyaciṣṭhe bahu pāyye yatemahi sva rājye
translated: Would strive to reach you in your most spacious abode, in your own realm

original: baḷ itthā deva niṣkṛtam ādityā yajatam bṛhat🔽varuṇa mitrāryaman varṣiṣṭhaṃ kṣatram āśāthe
analyzed: baḷ itthā deva niṣkṛtam ādityā yajatam bṛhat  varuṇa mitra aryaman varṣiṣṭham kṣatram āśāthe
translated: Here, O God, is the great sacrifice of the Adityas, to be performed🔽O Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, you have attained the highest lordship

original: ā yad yoniṃ hiraṇyayaṃ varuṇa mitra sadathaḥ
analyzed: ā yat yonim hiraṇyayam varuṇa mitra sadathaḥ
translated: When you two, O Varuna, Mitra, sit in your golden abode

original: dhartārā carṣaṇīnāṃ yantaṃ sumnaṃ riśādasā
analyzed: dhartārā carṣaṇīnām yantam sumnam riśādasā
translated: As the supporters of men, destroying evil, you lead to bliss

original: viśve hi viśvavedaso varuṇo mitro aryamā
analyzed: viśve hi viśva vedasaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: For all of you, O all-knowing ones, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman

original: vratā padeva saścire pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ
analyzed: vratā padā iva saścire pānti martyam riṣaḥ
translated: Protect the mortal from harm, as if guarding a place of vows

original: te hi satyā ṛtaspṛśa ṛtāvāno janejane
analyzed: te hi satyāḥ ṛta spṛśaḥ ṛtāvānaḥ janejane
translated: For you are true, touching the truth, full of truth, among each people

original: sunīthāsaḥ sudānavo 'ṃhoś cid urucakrayaḥ
analyzed: su nīthāsaḥ sudānavaḥ ṃhoḥ cit uru cakrayaḥ
translated: With good thoughts, bestowing good gifts, you have made a wide path even through distress

original: ko nu vām mitrāstuto varuṇo vā tanūnām
analyzed: kaḥ nu vām mitrāstutaḥ varuṇaḥ vā tanūnām
translated: Who then, praised by Mitra, or by Varuna, O you two whose bodies are

original: tat su vām eṣate matir atribhya eṣate matiḥ
analyzed: tat su vām eṣate matiḥ atribhyaḥ eṣate matiḥ
translated: That thought of yours is well-directed, the thought is well-directed to the Atri-s

original: pra vo mitrāya gāyata varuṇāya vipā girā
analyzed: pra vaḥ mitrāya gāyata varuṇāya vipā girā
translated: Sing forth to Mitra, to Varuna, to the wise one with a song of praise,

original: mahikṣatrāv ṛtam bṛhat
analyzed: mahi kṣatrau ṛtam bṛhat
translated: To the great kings, to the lofty law.

original: samrājā yā ghṛtayonī mitraś cobhā varuṇaś ca
analyzed: samrājā yā ghṛta yonī mitraḥ ca ubhā varuṇaḥ ca
translated: The two great kings, Mitra and Varuna, whose home is in the ghee,

original: devā deveṣu praśastā
analyzed: devā deveṣu praśastā
translated: The gods praised by the gods,

original: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya maho rāyo divyasya
analyzed: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya mahaḥ rāyaḥ divyasya
translated: Grant us the power of earthly and heavenly wealth,

original: mahi vāṃ kṣatraṃ deveṣu
analyzed: mahi vām kṣatram deveṣu
translated: Great is your lordship among the gods.

original: ṛtam ṛtena sapanteṣiraṃ dakṣam āśāte
analyzed: ṛtam ṛtena sapantā iṣiram dakṣam āśāte
translated: They who join the law with the law, who desire the strong and mighty power,

original: adruhā devau vardhete
analyzed: adruhā devau vardhete
translated: The two gods who increase without doing harm,

original: vṛṣṭidyāvā rītyṛpeṣas patī dānumatyāḥ
analyzed: vṛṣṭi dyāvā rīti ṛpā iṣaḥ patī dānumatyāḥ
translated: The two who rain down, the lords of the sky and earth, of the Dânu-fraught (heaven),

original: bṛhantaṃ gartam āśāte
analyzed: bṛhantam gartam āśāte
translated: Have attained the great deep place.🔽Three lights, O Varuna, and three heavens, three realms of air, O Mitra, ye uphold.

original: trī rocanā varuṇa trīṃr uta dyūn trīṇi mitra dhārayatho rajāṃsi🔽vāvṛdhānāv amatiṃ kṣatriyasyānu vrataṃ rakṣamāṇāv ajuryam
analyzed: trī rocanā varuṇa trīn uta dyūn trīṇi mitra dhārayathaḥ rajāṃsi  vāvṛdhānau amatim kṣatriyasya anu vratam rakṣamāṇau ajuryam
translated: Increasing the strength of the prince, guarding his eternal vow,

original: irāvatīr varuṇa dhenavo vām madhumad vāṃ sindhavo mitra duhre🔽trayas tasthur vṛṣabhāsas tisṛṇāṃ dhiṣaṇānāṃ retodhā vi dyumantaḥ🔽prātar devīm aditiṃ johavīmi madhyaṃdina uditā sūryasya
analyzed: irāvatīḥ varuṇa dhenavaḥ vām madhumat vām sindhavaḥ mitra duhre  trayaḥ tasthuḥ vṛṣabhāsaḥ tisṛṇām dhiṣaṇānām retaḥ dhāḥ vi dyumantaḥ  prātar devīm aditim johavīmi madhyaṃdine uditā sūryasya
translated: The milch-kine, O Varuna, and the honey-yielding streams, O Mitra, yield to you.

original: rāye mitrāvaruṇā sarvatāteḷe tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ
analyzed: rāye mitrāvaruṇā sarvatātā īḍe tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
translated: The three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three, the three,

original: yā dhartārā rajaso rocanasyotādityā divyā pārthivasya
analyzed: yā dhartārā rajasaḥ rocanasya uta ādityā divyā pārthivasya
translated: You who are the supporters of the realm of light, and of the heavenly and earthly,

original: na vāṃ devā amṛtā ā minanti vratāni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvāṇi
analyzed: na vām devāḥ amṛtāḥ ā minanti vratāni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvāṇi
translated: The gods do not transgress your firm ordinances, O Mitra-Varuṇa, O immortal ones.

original: purūruṇā cid dhy asty avo nūnaṃ vāṃ varuṇa
analyzed: purūruṇā cit hi asti avaḥ nūnam vām varuṇa
translated: Even to one of great glory is there help from you, O Varuṇa,

original: mitra vaṃsi vāṃ sumatim
analyzed: mitra vaṃsi vām sumatim
translated: I seek your favour, O Mitra.

original: tā vāṃ samyag adruhvāṇeṣam aśyāma dhāyase
analyzed: tā vām samyak adruhvāṇā iṣam aśyāma dhāyase
translated: May we, O you who do no wrong, obtain you for our support.

original: vayaṃ te rudrā syāma
analyzed: vayam te rudrā syāma
translated: May we be yours, O Rudras.

original: pātaṃ no rudrā pāyubhir uta trāyethāṃ sutrātrā
analyzed: pātam naḥ rudrā pāyubhiḥ uta trāyethām su trātrā
translated: Protect us, O Rudras, with your protections, and deliver us, O good protectors,

original: turyāma dasyūn tanūbhiḥ
analyzed: turyāma dasyūn tanūbhiḥ
translated: Destroy the Dasyus with your bodies.

original: mā kasyādbhutakratū yakṣam bhujemā tanūbhiḥ
analyzed: mā kasya adbhuta kratū yakṣam bhujema tanūbhiḥ
translated: Let us not, through our bodies, offend against the wondrously wise one of you.

original: mā śeṣasā mā tanasā
analyzed: mā śeṣasā mā tanasā
translated: Not with our remnant, not with our body.

original: ā no gantaṃ riśādasā varuṇa mitra barhaṇā
analyzed: ā naḥ gantam riśādasā varuṇa mitra barhaṇā
translated: Come to us, O you who destroy the enemy, O Varuṇa and Mitra, with your greatness,

original: upemaṃ cārum adhvaram
analyzed: upa imam cārum adhvaram
translated: To this fair sacrifice.

original: viśvasya hi pracetasā varuṇa mitra rājathaḥ
analyzed: viśvasya hi pracetasā varuṇa mitra rājathaḥ
translated: For you, O Varuṇa and Mitra, rule over all that is wise,

original: īśānā pipyataṃ dhiyaḥ
analyzed: īśānā pipyatam dhiyaḥ
translated: As lords, make our thoughts to swell.

original: upa naḥ sutam ā gataṃ varuṇa mitra dāśuṣaḥ
analyzed: upa naḥ sutam ā gatam varuṇa mitra dāśuṣaḥ
translated: Come to the offered juice of him who offers, O Varuṇa and Mitra,

original: asya somasya pītaye
analyzed: asya somasya pītaye
translated: To drink of this Soma.

original: ā mitre varuṇe vayaṃ gīrbhir juhumo atrivat
analyzed: ā mitre varuṇe vayam gīrbhiḥ juhumaḥ atri vat
translated: To Mitra and Varuṇa we call with our songs, even as Atri,

original: ni barhiṣi sadataṃ somapītaye
analyzed: ni barhiṣi sadatam soma pītaye
translated: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma.

original: vratena stho dhruvakṣemā dharmaṇā yātayajjanā
analyzed: vratena sthaḥ dhruva kṣemā dharmaṇā yātayat janā
translated: Ye are established by the vow, of firm prosperity, by the law, ye whose people are to be worshipped,

original: ni barhiṣi sadataṃ somapītaye
analyzed: ni barhiṣi sadatam soma pītaye
translated: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma.

original: mitraś ca no varuṇaś ca juṣetāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye
analyzed: mitraḥ ca naḥ varuṇaḥ ca juṣetām yajñam iṣṭaye
translated: May Mitra and Varuna accept our sacrifice for prosperity.

original: ni barhiṣi sadatāṃ somapītaye🔽yad adya sthaḥ parāvati yad arvāvaty aśvinā
analyzed: ni barhiṣi sadatām soma pītaye  yat adya sthaḥ parāvati yat arvāvati aśvinā
translated: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma.🔽If today you are far away or near, O Asvins,

original: yad vā purū purubhujā yad antarikṣa ā gatam
analyzed: yat vā purū puru bhujā yat antarikṣe ā gatam
translated: Or if you are in many places, O you who have much to enjoy, or in the atmosphere, come!

original: iha tyā purubhūtamā purū daṃsāṃsi bibhratā
analyzed: iha tyā puru bhūtamā purū daṃsāṃsi bibhratā
translated: Here, O you who have many attendants, O you who bear many gifts,

original: varasyā yāmy adhrigū huve tuviṣṭamā bhuje
analyzed: varasyā yāmi adhrigū huve tuviṣṭamā bhuje
translated: I call you, O you who are swift to hear, to the best, to the most powerful to enjoy.

original: īrmānyad vapuṣe vapuś cakraṃ rathasya yemathuḥ
analyzed: īrmānyat vapuṣe vapuḥ cakram rathasya yemathuḥ
translated: The form which you have made for the body, you have fashioned the wheel of the chariot.

original: pary anyā nāhuṣā yugā mahnā rajāṃsi dīyathaḥ
analyzed: pari anyā nāhuṣā yugā mahnā rajāṃsi dīyathaḥ
translated: You two, O Nahuṣas, with your greatness, traverse the realms.

original: tad ū ṣu vām enā kṛtaṃ viśvā yad vām anu ṣṭave
analyzed: tat u su vām enā kṛtam viśvā yat vām anu stave
translated: That deed of yours, indeed, all that I shall praise,

original: nānā jātāv arepasā sam asme bandhum eyathuḥ
analyzed: nānā jātau arepasā sam asme bandhum eyathuḥ
translated: Though born separately, O you who are free from blemish, you have come to us as kinsmen.

original: ā yad vāṃ sūryā rathaṃ tiṣṭhad raghuṣyadaṃ sadā
analyzed: ā yat vām sūryā ratham tiṣṭhat raghuṣyadam sadā
translated: When the sun always rises, it stands on your chariot, which moves swiftly.

original: pari vām aruṣā vayo ghṛṇā varanta ātapaḥ
analyzed: pari vām aruṣāḥ vayaḥ ghṛṇāḥ varante ātapaḥ
translated: Your ruddy wings are surrounded by the heat of Gharma.

original: yuvor atriś ciketati narā sumnena cetasā
analyzed: yuvoḥ atriḥ ciketati narā sumnena cetasā
translated: Atri thinks of you, O heroes, with a mind full of bliss,

original: gharmaṃ yad vām arepasaṃ nāsatyāsnā bhuraṇyati
analyzed: gharmam yat vām arepasam nāsatya asnā bhuraṇyati
translated: When he quickly moves the Gharma which is free from blemish for you, O Nāsatyas.

original: ugro vāṃ kakuho yayiḥ śṛṇve yāmeṣu saṃtaniḥ
analyzed: ugraḥ vām kakuhaḥ yayiḥ śṛṇve yāmeṣu saṃtaniḥ
translated: Your strong, swift, moving Kakubha is heard in the races.

original: yad vāṃ daṃsobhir aśvinātrir narāvavartati
analyzed: yat vām daṃsobhiḥ aśvinā atriḥ narā avavartati
translated: When Atri, O ye Aṣvins, turns to you with his adorations,

original: madhva ū ṣu madhūyuvā rudrā siṣakti pipyuṣī
analyzed: madhvaḥ u su madhūyuvā rudrā siṣakti pipyuṣī
translated: The sweet juice, rich in meath, O ye Rudras, flows to you who are to be gladdened.

original: yat samudrāti parṣathaḥ pakvāḥ pṛkṣo bharanta vām
analyzed: yat samudra ati parṣathaḥ pakvāḥ pṛkṣaḥ bharanta vām
translated: When ye pass over the cooked viands of the sea, they bring you food.

original: satyam id vā u aśvinā yuvām āhur mayobhuvā
analyzed: satyam id vai u aśvinā yuvām āhuḥ mayobhuvā
translated: Verily, O ye Aṣvins, they call you givers of bliss.

original: tā yāman yāmahūtamā yāmann ā mṛḷayattamā🔽imā brahmāṇi vardhanāśvibhyāṃ santu śaṃtamā
analyzed: tā yāman yāmahūtamā yāman ā mṛḍayattamā  imā brahmāṇi vardhana aśvibhyām santu śaṃtamā
translated: Come to us, invoked, most quickly to be invoked, most readily to be propitiated.🔽May these prayers of ours be most auspicious to the Aṣvins.

original: yā takṣāma rathāṃ ivāvocāma bṛhan namaḥ
analyzed: yā takṣāma rathān iva avocāma bṛhat namaḥ
translated: We have uttered this great adoration to you, as to two skilful workmen.

original: kūṣṭho devāv aśvinādyā divo manāvasū
analyzed: devau aśvinā adyā divaḥ manāvasū
translated: O ye Aṣvins, ye Gods, Kūṣṭha, the son of Dyaus, the son of Manu,

original: tac chravatho vṛṣaṇvasū atrir vām ā vivāsati
analyzed: tat śravathaḥ vṛṣaṇvasū atriḥ vām ā vivāsati
translated: That, O ye rich in wealth, ye may hear it: Atri invites you.

original: kuha tyā kuha nu śrutā divi devā nāsatyā
analyzed: kuha tyā kuha nu śrutā divi devā nāsatyā
translated: Where, indeed, are the renowned Nāsatyas of the sky, O ye Gods?

original: kasminn ā yatatho jane ko vāṃ nadīnāṃ sacā
analyzed: kasmin ā yatathaḥ jane kaḥ vām nadīnām sacā
translated: With what people do ye take pleasure? Who invites you to the rivers?

original: kaṃ yāthaḥ kaṃ ha gachathaḥ kam achā yuñjāthe ratham
analyzed: kam yāthaḥ kam ha gacchathaḥ kam achā yuñjāthe ratham
translated: Whom do ye visit? Whom do ye approach? Whom do ye yoke your chariot?

original: kasya brahmāṇi raṇyatho vayaṃ vām uśmasīṣṭaye
analyzed: kasya brahmāṇi raṇyathaḥ vayam vām uśmasi iṣṭaye
translated: With whom do ye delight in prayers? Or with us, that we may be prosperous?

original: pauraṃ cid dhy udaprutam paura paurāya jinvathaḥ
analyzed: pauram cit hi uda prutam paura paurāya jinvathaḥ
translated: Ye quicken the son of Pūra, the son of Udpruta, the son of Pūra.

original: yad īṃ gṛbhītatātaye siṃham iva druhas pade
analyzed: yat īm gṛbhītatātaye siṃham iva druhaḥ pade
translated: When ye seize him for your embrace, like a lion in the lair of the wicked,

original: pra cyavānāj jujuruṣo vavrim atkaṃ na muñcathaḥ
analyzed: pra cyavānāt jujuruṣaḥ vavrim atkam na muñcathaḥ
translated: Do ye not loosen the bond of the trembling one, as of a calf?

original: yuvā yadī kṛthaḥ punar ā kāmam ṛṇve vadhvaḥ
analyzed: yuvā yadī kṛthaḥ punar ā kāmam ṛṇve vadhvaḥ
translated: When ye have made the young man, I turn again to the bride's desire.

original: asti hi vām iha stotā smasi vāṃ saṃdṛśi śriye
analyzed: asti hi vām iha stotā smasi vām saṃdṛśi śriye
translated: For here is your praiser; we are in your sight for glory.

original: nū śrutam ma ā gatam avobhir vājinīvasū
analyzed: nu śrutam me ā gatam avobhiḥ vājinīvasū
translated: Now come, O ye who hear, with your aids, O ye who are rich in wealth.

original: ko vām adya purūṇām ā vavne martyānām
analyzed: kaḥ vām adya purūṇām ā vavne martyānām
translated: Who of many men hath to-day chosen you?

original: ko vipro vipravāhasā ko yajñair vājinīvasū
analyzed: kaḥ vipraḥ vipra vāhasā kaḥ yajñaiḥ vājinīvasū
translated: Who is the sage, O ye who are borne by sages? Who with sacrifices, O ye who are rich in wealth?

original: ā vāṃ ratho rathānāṃ yeṣṭho yātv aśvinā🔽purū cid asmayus tira āṅgūṣo martyeṣv ā
analyzed: ā vām rathaḥ rathānām yeṣṭhaḥ yātu aśvinā  purū cit asmayuḥ tiras āṅgūṣaḥ martyeṣu ā
translated: Let your chariot, O ye Aṣvins, best of chariots, come hither.🔽Even to many of us, O ye who are ready to help, is the hymn come among mortals.

original: śam ū ṣu vām madhūyuvāsmākam astu carkṛtiḥ🔽arvācīnā vicetasā vibhiḥ śyeneva dīyatam
analyzed: śam u su vām madhūyuvā asmākam astu carkṛtiḥ  arvācīnā vicetasā vibhiḥ śyenā iva dīyatam
translated: May our praise, rich in honey, be acceptable to you.🔽Come hither with your thoughts directed hither, come like a bird on the wings.

original: aśvinā yad dha karhi cic chuśrūyātam imaṃ havam
analyzed: aśvinā yat ha karhi cit śuśrūyātam imam havam
translated: O Aṣvins, when ye hear at any time this invocation of mine,

original: vasvīr ū ṣu vām bhujaḥ pṛñcanti su vām pṛcaḥ
analyzed: vasvīḥ u su vām bhujaḥ pṛñcanti su vām pṛcaḥ
translated: The sweet juices of yours are drunk; your gifts are good.

original: prati priyatamaṃ rathaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vasuvāhanam
analyzed: prati priyatamam ratham vṛṣaṇam vasu vāhanam
translated: To the most dear chariot, the strong, bearing wealth,

original: stotā vām aśvināv ṛṣi stomena prati bhūṣati mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: stotā vām aśvinau ṛṣiḥ stomena prati bhūṣati mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: The sage, O ye Aṣvins, praises you with a hymn; accept the sweet one's call.

original: atyāyātam aśvinā tiro viśvā ahaṃ sanā
analyzed: atyāyātam aśvinā tiras viśvāḥ aham
translated: Come, O ye Aṣvins, over all the days of life.

original: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī suṣumnā sindhuvāhasā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: dasrā hiraṇya vartanī suṣumnā sindhu vāhasā mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: O wondrous, golden-coloured, very bountiful, river-bearing (Aśvins), you who delight in honey, hear my call.

original: ā no ratnāni bibhratāv aśvinā gachataṃ yuvam
analyzed: ā naḥ ratnāni bibhratau aśvinā gacchatam yuvam
translated: Bearing treasures, O Aśvins, come to us, you two.

original: rudrā hiraṇyavartanī juṣāṇā vājinīvasū mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: rudrā hiraṇya vartanī juṣāṇā vājinīvasū mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: O Rudras, golden-coloured, you who delight in honey, rich in treasure, hear my call.

original: suṣṭubho vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū rathe vāṇīcy āhitā
analyzed: suṣṭubhaḥ vām vṛṣaṇvasū rathe vāṇīcī āhitā
translated: Your two strong-backed, treasure-rich horses are yoked to your chariot, O you who are well praised.

original: uta vāṃ kakuho mṛgaḥ pṛkṣaḥ kṛṇoti vāpuṣo mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: uta vām kakuhaḥ mṛgaḥ pṛkṣaḥ kṛṇoti vāpuṣaḥ mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: And your deer Kakuhā makes you, O you who delight in honey, rich in food, hear my call.

original: bodhinmanasā rathyeṣirā havanaśrutā
analyzed: bodhinmanasā rathyā iṣirā havana śrutā
translated: You who are to be invoked with the mind, you who travel in chariots, you who hear the invocation,

original: vibhiś cyavānam aśvinā ni yātho advayāvinam mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: vibhiḥ cyavānam aśvinā ni yāthaḥ a dvayāvinam mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: O Aśvins, you two go to the trembling Chyavāna, who has no companion, you who delight in honey, hear my call.

original: ā vāṃ narā manoyujo 'śvāsaḥ pruṣitapsavaḥ
analyzed: ā vām narā manaḥ yujaḥ śvāsaḥ pruṣitapsavaḥ
translated: O heroes, let your mind-yoked horses, with their flowing seed,

original: vayo vahantu pītaye saha sumnebhir aśvinā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: vayaḥ vahantu pītaye saha sumnebhiḥ aśvinā mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: carry you on your way to the drink, together with the Aśvins, O you who delight in honey, hear my call.

original: aśvināv eha gachataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam
analyzed: aśvinau ā iha gacchatam nāsatyā mā vi venatam
translated: O Aśvins, come hither, O Nāsatyas, do not be negligent.

original: tiraś cid aryayā pari vartir yātam adābhyā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: tiras cit aryayā pari vartiḥ yātam adābhyā mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: Go around even the distant obstacle, O you who are infallible, O you who delight in honey, hear my call.

original: asmin yajñe adābhyā jaritāraṃ śubhas patī
analyzed: asmin yajñe adābhyā jaritāram śubhaḥ patī
translated: O you who are infallible, O lords of splendour, to the praiser at this sacrifice

original: avasyum aśvinā yuvaṃ gṛṇantam upa bhūṣatho mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: avasyum aśvinā yuvam gṛṇantam upa bhūṣathaḥ mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: O Aśvins, you attend upon the worshipper who sings your praise, you lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

original: abhūd uṣā ruśatpaśur āgnir adhāyy ṛtviyaḥ
analyzed: abhūt uṣāḥ ruśat paśuḥ ā agniḥ adhāyi ṛtviyaḥ
translated: Dawn has appeared, with ruddy cattle, the proper fire has been set up.

original: ayoji vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū ratho dasrāv amartyo mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
analyzed: ayoji vām vṛṣaṇvasū rathaḥ dasrau amartyaḥ mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: Your chariot, O you rich in treasure, has been yoked, O immortal Aśvins, you lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

original: ā bhāty agnir uṣasām anīkam ud viprāṇāṃ devayā vāco asthuḥ
analyzed: ā bhāti agniḥ uṣasām anīkam ud viprāṇām deva yāḥ vācaḥ asthuḥ
translated: The face of the dawns shines, the songs of the seers have arisen in the manner of the gods.

original: arvāñcā nūnaṃ rathyeha yātam pīpivāṃsam aśvinā gharmam acha
analyzed: arvāñcā nūnam rathyā iha yātam pīpivāṃsam aśvinā gharmam acha
translated: Now come hither, O you who are to be invoked by the chariot, O Aśvins, to the steaming hot drink.

original: na saṃskṛtam pra mimīto gamiṣṭhānti nūnam aśvinopastuteha🔽divābhipitve 'vasāgamiṣṭhā praty avartiṃ dāśuṣe śambhaviṣṭhā
analyzed: na saṃskṛtam pra mimītaḥ gamiṣṭhā anti nūnam aśvinā upastutā iha  divā abhipitve vasa āgamiṣṭhā prati avartim dāśuṣe śambhaviṣṭhā
translated: Do not pass by, O most distant ones, now come to the praise of the Aśvins here.🔽In the time of the day, O most distant ones, come with help, most auspicious, turn away misfortune for the worshipper.

original: utā yātaṃ saṃgave prātar ahno madhyaṃdina uditā sūryasya
analyzed: uta ā yātam saṃgave prātar ahnaḥ madhyaṃdine uditā sūryasya
translated: And come at the time of the evening prayer, in the morning, at midday, when the sun has risen.

original: divā naktam avasā śaṃtamena nedānīm pītir aśvinā tatāna
analyzed: divā naktam avasā śaṃtamena nā idānīm pītiḥ aśvinā tatāna
translated: By day and night, with most auspicious help, O Aśvins, now extend the drink.

original: idaṃ hi vām pradivi sthānam oka ime gṛhā aśvinedaṃ duroṇam
analyzed: idam hi vām pradivi sthānam okaḥ ime gṛhāḥ aśvinā idam duroṇam
translated: For this is your place in the sky, O Aśvins, these are your houses, this is your dwelling.

original: ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ādbhyo yātam iṣam ūrjaṃ vahantā
analyzed: ā naḥ divaḥ bṛhataḥ parvatāt ā adbhyaḥ yātam iṣam ūrjam vahantā
translated: Come from the sky, from the lofty mountain, from the waters, bringing food and strength.

original: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema
analyzed: sam aśvinoḥ avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā su praṇītī gamema
translated: With the new help of the Aśvins, bringing bliss, may we go by the good guidance

original: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni🔽prātaryāvāṇā prathamā yajadhvam purā gṛdhrād araruṣaḥ pibātaḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim vahatam ā uta vīrān ā viśvāni amṛtā saubhagāni  prātaryāvāṇā prathamā yajadhvam purā gṛdhrāt a raruṣaḥ pibātaḥ
translated: Bring to us wealth and heroes, and all good things, O immortal ones, that bring happiness.🔽Perform the morning rite first, O you who come in the morning; drink before the red-backed [vulture].

original: prātar hi yajñam aśvinā dadhāte pra śaṃsanti kavayaḥ pūrvabhājaḥ
analyzed: prātar hi yajñam aśvinā dadhāte pra śaṃsanti kavayaḥ pūrvabhājaḥ
translated: For in the morning the two Asvins establish the sacrifice; the sages praise them, the first to obtain [favours].

original: prātar yajadhvam aśvinā hinota na sāyam asti devayā ajuṣṭam
analyzed: prātar yajadhvam aśvinā hinota na sāyam asti deva yāḥ a juṣṭam
translated: Perform the morning rite, O Asvins; hasten; there is nothing in the evening disagreeable to the gods.

original: utānyo asmad yajate vi cāvaḥ pūrvaḥpūrvo yajamāno vanīyān🔽hiraṇyatvaṅ madhuvarṇo ghṛtasnuḥ pṛkṣo vahann ā ratho vartate vām
analyzed: uta anyaḥ asmat yajate vi ca avaḥ pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ yajamānaḥ vanīyān  hiraṇya tvac madhu varṇaḥ ghṛta snuḥ pṛkṣaḥ vahan ā rathaḥ vartate vām
translated: Or another worships, and turns away from us; each former sacrificer is better than the next.🔽Your chariot, O Asvins, comes, covered with gold, honey-coloured, with oil-anointed wheels,

original: manojavā aśvinā vātaraṃhā yenātiyātho duritāni viśvā🔽yo bhūyiṣṭhaṃ nāsatyābhyāṃ viveṣa caniṣṭham pitvo rarate vibhāge
analyzed: manaḥ javāḥ aśvinā vāta raṃhāḥ yena atiyāthaḥ duritāni viśvā  yaḥ bhūyiṣṭham nāsatyābhyām viveṣa caniṣṭham pitvaḥ rarate vibhāge
translated: swift as thought, O Asvins, swifter than the wind, with which ye pass over all difficulties.🔽He who has most frequently resorted to the Nâsatyas, the best drinker, rejoices in the distribution.

original: sa tokam asya pīparac chamībhir anūrdhvabhāsaḥ sadam it tuturyāt🔽sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema
analyzed: sa tokam asya pīparat śamībhiḥ an ūrdhva bhāsaḥ sadam id tuturyāt  sam aśvinoḥ avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā su praṇītī gamema
translated: May he protect his offspring with his favours; may he, whose light is not turned upward, always be victorious.🔽With the new favour of the Asvins, bringing bliss, may we go with good guidance.

original: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim vahatam ā uta vīrān ā viśvāni amṛtā saubhagāni
translated: Bring to us wealth and heroes, and all good things, O immortal ones, that bring happiness.

original: aśvināv eha gachataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam
analyzed: aśvinau ā iha gacchatam nāsatyā mā vi venatam
translated: O Aśvins, come hither, O Nāsatyas, do not be negligent,

original: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa
analyzed: haṃsau iva patatam ā sutām upa
translated: Fly like swans to the Soma juice.

original: aśvinā hariṇāv iva gaurāv ivānu yavasam
analyzed: aśvinā hariṇau iva gaurau iva anu yavasam
translated: O Aśvins, like two tawny antelopes following the grass,

original: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa
analyzed: haṃsau iva patatam ā sutām upa
translated: Fly like swans to the Soma juice.

original: aśvinā vājinīvasū juṣethāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye
analyzed: aśvinā vājinīvasū juṣethām yajñam iṣṭaye
translated: O Aśvins, rich in treasures, accept the sacrifice for prosperity,

original: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa🔽atrir yad vām avarohann ṛbīsam ajohavīn nādhamāneva yoṣā
analyzed: haṃsau iva patatam ā sutām upa  atriḥ yat vām avarohan ṛbīsam ajohavīt nādhamānā iva yoṣā
translated: Fly like swans to the Soma juice.🔽When Atri, descending to your lap, called out like a woman in labor,

original: śyenasya cij javasā nūtanenāgachatam aśvinā śaṃtamena
analyzed: śyenasya cit javasā nūtanena agacchatam aśvinā śaṃtamena
translated: Come with the swift new speed of a hawk, O Aśvins, with the most healing (speed).

original: vi jihīṣva vanaspate yoniḥ sūṣyantyā iva
analyzed: vi jihīṣva vanaspate yoniḥ sūṣyantyāḥ iva
translated: O tree, spread out, like the womb of a woman who is about to give birth.

original: śrutam me aśvinā havaṃ saptavadhriṃ ca muñcatam
analyzed: śrutam me aśvinā havam saptavadhrim ca muñcatam
translated: O Aśvins, listen to my call and set free the one with seven ribs.

original: bhītāya nādhamānāya ṛṣaye saptavadhraye
analyzed: bhītāya nādhamānāya ṛṣaye saptavadhraye
translated: To the frightened one, to the one who is about to give birth, to the seer with seven ribs,

original: māyābhir aśvinā yuvaṃ vṛkṣaṃ saṃ ca vi cācathaḥ
analyzed: māyābhiḥ aśvinā yuvam vṛkṣam sam ca vi ca acathaḥ
translated: O Aśvins, with your magic powers you shake the tree and make it grow.

original: yathā vātaḥ puṣkariṇīṃ samiṅgayati sarvataḥ
analyzed: yathā vātaḥ puṣkariṇīm samiṅgayati sarvatas
translated: Just as the wind blows over a pond from all sides,

original: evā te garbha ejatu niraitu daśamāsyaḥ
analyzed: eva te garbhaḥ ejatu niraitu daśamāsyaḥ
translated: So let your embryo move, let the ten-month-old one come forth.

original: yathā vāto yathā vanaṃ yathā samudra ejati
analyzed: yathā vātaḥ yathā vanam yathā samudraḥ ejati
translated: Just as the wind, just as the forest, just as the ocean moves,

original: evā tvaṃ daśamāsya sahāvehi jarāyuṇā
analyzed: eva tvam daśamāsya saha avehi jarāyuṇā
translated: So, O ten-month-old one, come forth with the afterbirth.

original: daśa māsāñ chaśayānaḥ kumāro adhi mātari
analyzed: daśa māsām śaśayānaḥ kumāraḥ adhi mātari
translated: The child, lying ten months on the mother,

original: niraitu jīvo akṣato jīvo jīvantyā adhi
analyzed: niraitu jīvaḥ a kṣataḥ jīvaḥ jīvantyāḥ adhi
translated: let the living one come forth uninjured, the living one from the living one.

original: mahe no adya bodhayoṣo rāye divitmatī
analyzed: mahe naḥ adya bodhaya uṣaḥ rāye divitmatī
translated: O Dawn, this day awaken us to great riches, O thou of heavenly nature,

original: yathā cin no abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte🔽yā sunīthe śaucadrathe vy aucho duhitar divaḥ
analyzed: yathā cit naḥ abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye su jāte aśva sūnṛte  yā sunīthe śaucadrathe vi auchaḥ duhitar divaḥ
translated: As thou hast awakened us for the truthful Vya, O nobly-born one, O thou who hast beautiful horses and pleasant speech.🔽O thou who hast good gifts, O daughter of heaven, who hast risen over

original: sā vy ucha sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: sā vi ucha sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Sunītha and Śaucadra, rise thou up for the sake of great power, for the sake of the truthful Vya, O nobly-born one, O thou who hast beautiful horses and pleasant speech.

original: sā no adyābharadvasur vy uchā duhitar divaḥ
analyzed: sā naḥ adyā ābharat vasuḥ vi ucha duhitar divaḥ
translated: Rise up for us this day, O Abharadvāsu, O daughter of heaven,

original: yo vy auchaḥ sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: yaḥ vi auchaḥ sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Who hast risen for the sake of great power, for the sake of the truthful Vya, O nobly-born one, O thou who hast beautiful horses and pleasant speech.

original: abhi ye tvā vibhāvari stomair gṛṇanti vahnayaḥ
analyzed: abhi ye tvā vibhāvari stomaiḥ gṛṇanti vahnayaḥ
translated: Those who praise thee with lauds, O thou of shining light,

original: maghair maghoni suśriyo dāmanvantaḥ surātayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: maghaiḥ maghoni su śriyaḥ dāmanvantaḥ su rātayaḥ su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: With gifts, O bountiful one, O thou of good gifts, O thou who hast beautiful horses and pleasant speech.

original: yac cid dhi te gaṇā ime chadayanti maghattaye
analyzed: yat cit hi te gaṇāḥ ime chadayanti maghattaye
translated: Even if these thy bands of men delight thee for the sake of wealth,

original: pari cid vaṣṭayo dadhur dadato rādho ahrayaṃ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: pari cit vaṣṭayaḥ dadataḥ rādhaḥ ahrayam su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: The Vṛṣṭis have placed thee around, O thou who givest good gifts, O thou who hast beautiful horses and pleasant speech.

original: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśa uṣo maghoni sūriṣu
analyzed: ā eṣu dhāḥ vīravat yaśaḥ uṣaḥ maghoni sūriṣu
translated: Bestow upon these princes, O Dawn, O bountiful one,

original: ye no rādhāṃsy ahrayā maghavāno arāsata sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: ye naḥ rādhāṃsi ahrayā maghavānaḥ arāsata su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Those bountiful ones who have sent us gifts, O well-born one, with good horses and good songs,

original: tebhyo dyumnam bṛhad yaśa uṣo maghony ā vaha
analyzed: tebhyaḥ dyumnam bṛhat yaśaḥ uṣaḥ maghoni ā vaha
translated: To them bring splendour, great glory, O Dawn, O bountiful one.

original: ye no rādhāṃsy aśvyā gavyā bhajanta sūrayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: ye naḥ rādhāṃsi aśvyā gavyā bhajanta sūrayaḥ su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Those princes who allot to us gifts of horses and cattle, O well-born one, with good horses and good songs,

original: uta no gomatīr iṣa ā vahā duhitar divaḥ
analyzed: uta naḥ gomatīḥ iṣaḥ ā vaha duhitar divaḥ
translated: And bring us food rich in cows, O daughter of heaven,

original: sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ śukraiḥ śocadbhir arcibhiḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: sākam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ śukraiḥ śocadbhiḥ arcibhiḥ su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Together with the rays of the sun, with the bright, shining flames, O well-born one, with good horses and good songs.

original: vy uchā duhitar divo mā ciraṃ tanuthā apaḥ
analyzed: vi ucha duhitar divaḥ mā ciram tanuthāḥ apaḥ
translated: Rise up, O daughter of heaven, do not delay in spreading out the waters,

original: net tvā stenaṃ yathā ripuṃ tapāti sūro arciṣā sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: na id tvā stenam yathā ripum tapāti sūraḥ arciṣā su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Lest the sun scorch thee as an enemy, as a thief, with his rays, O well-born one, with good horses and good songs.

original: etāvad ved uṣas tvam bhūyo vā dātum arhasi🔽yā stotṛbhyo vibhāvary uchantī na pramīyase sujāte aśvasūnṛte
analyzed: etāvat vā id uṣaḥ tvam bhūyas vā dātum arhasi  yā stotṛbhyaḥ vibhāvarī uchantī na pramīyase su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: This much, O Dawn, thou knowest, or more than that thou art able to give,🔽Thou who, as the dawn breaks, art not deceived by the praisers, O well-born one, with good horses and good songs.

original: dyutadyāmānam bṛhatīm ṛtena ṛtāvarīm aruṇapsuṃ vibhātīm
analyzed: dyutat yāmānam bṛhatīm ṛtena ṛtāvarīm aruṇapsum vibhātīm
translated: The shining one, the great one, by truth, the truthful one, the ruddy-hued one, the radiant one,

original: devīm uṣasaṃ svar āvahantīm prati viprāso matibhir jarante
analyzed: devīm uṣasam svar āvahantīm prati viprāsaḥ matibhiḥ jarante
translated: The divine Dawn, who brings heaven, the bards attend with their thoughts.

original: eṣā janaṃ darśatā bodhayantī sugān pathaḥ kṛṇvatī yāty agre
analyzed: eṣā janam darśatā bodhayantī su gān pathaḥ kṛṇvatī yāti agre
translated: She, who awakens the people with her light, making the paths easy, goes in front,

original: bṛhadrathā bṛhatī viśvaminvoṣā jyotir yachaty agre ahnām🔽eṣā gobhir aruṇebhir yujānāsredhantī rayim aprāyu cakre
analyzed: bṛhat rathā bṛhatī viśvaminvā uṣāḥ jyotiḥ yacchati agre ahnām  eṣā gobhiḥ aruṇebhiḥ yujānā a sredhantī rayim aprāyu cakre
translated: The great chariot, the great one who extends over all, the dawn gives light in the forefront of the days.🔽She, yoked with the ruddy cows, increasing, has made wealth come near.

original: patho radantī suvitāya devī puruṣṭutā viśvavārā vi bhāti
analyzed: pathaḥ radantī suvitāya devī puruṣṭutā viśva vārā vi bhāti
translated: The goddess, clearing the paths for prosperity, praised by many, bestowing all boons, shines forth.

original: eṣā vyenī bhavati dvibarhā āviṣkṛṇvānā tanvam purastāt
analyzed: eṣā vyenī bhavati dvibarhāḥ āviṣkṛṇvānā tanvam purastāt
translated: She, to be desired, with twofold strength, revealing her body in front,

original: ṛtasya panthām anv eti sādhu prajānatīva na diśo mināti
analyzed: ṛtasya panthām anu eti sādhu prajānatī iva na diśaḥ mināti
translated: follows the path of truth, as if knowing well, she does not err in the directions.

original: eṣā śubhrā na tanvo vidānordhveva snātī dṛśaye no asthāt
analyzed: eṣā śubhrā na tanvaḥ vidānā ūrdhvā iva snātī dṛśaye naḥ asthāt
translated: She, the bright one, having clothed her limbs, stands as if bathing, high up, for our sight.

original: apa dveṣo bādhamānā tamāṃsy uṣā divo duhitā jyotiṣāgāt🔽eṣā pratīcī duhitā divo nṝn yoṣeva bhadrā ni riṇīte apsaḥ
analyzed: apa dveṣaḥ bādhamānā tamāṃsi uṣāḥ divaḥ duhitā jyotiṣā āgāt  eṣā pratīcī duhitā divaḥ nṝn yoṣā iva bhadrā ni riṇīte apsaḥ
translated: Dawn, the daughter of the sky, driving away hatred and darkness, has come with light.🔽She, the western daughter of the sky, like a good woman, leads men to the waters.

original: vyūrṇvatī dāśuṣe vāryāṇi punar jyotir yuvatiḥ pūrvathākaḥ
analyzed: vyūrṇvatī dāśuṣe vāryāṇi punar jyotiḥ yuvatiḥ pūrvathā akaḥ
translated: She, the young maiden, spreading out boons for the worshipper, brings back the light as before.

original: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ
analyzed: yuñjate manaḥ uta yuñjate dhiyaḥ viprāḥ viprasya bṛhataḥ vipaścitaḥ
translated: They yoke the mind and they yoke the thoughts, the priests of the great priest, the wise one.

original: vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ
analyzed: vi hotrā dadhe vayunā vid ekaḥ id mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ
translated: He, the one who knows the ordinances, has set up the priestly offices, the great praise of the god Savitar.

original: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīd bhadraṃ dvipade catuṣpade
analyzed: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīt bhadram dvipade catuṣpade
translated: The wise one sends forth all forms, he has bestowed good fortune on the two-footed and the four-footed.

original: vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nu prayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati🔽yasya prayāṇam anv anya id yayur devā devasya mahimānam ojasā
analyzed: vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyaḥ nu prayāṇam uṣasaḥ vi rājati  yasya prayāṇam anu anye id yayuḥ devāḥ devasya mahimānam ojasā
translated: Savitar, the most adorable, has disclosed the vault, he shines forth following the course of the dawns.🔽After the course of that god, by his might, the other gods have gone to the greatness of the god.

original: yaḥ pārthivāni vimame sa etaśo rajāṃsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā
analyzed: yaḥ pārthivāni vimame saḥ etaśaḥ rajāṃsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā
translated: He who has measured the earthly spaces, that god Savitar by his greatness, the steed.

original: uta yāsi savitas trīṇi rocanota sūryasya raśmibhiḥ sam ucyasi
analyzed: uta yāsi savitar trīṇi rocanā uta sūryasya raśmibhiḥ sam ucyasi
translated: And, O Savitar, thou goest to the three lights, and with the rays of the sun thou art united.

original: uta rātrīm ubhayataḥ parīyasa uta mitro bhavasi deva dharmabhiḥ
analyzed: uta rātrīm ubhayatas parīyase uta mitraḥ bhavasi deva dharmabhiḥ
translated: And thou goest round the night on both sides, and thou, O god, art Mitra by thy own nature.

original: uteśiṣe prasavasya tvam eka id uta pūṣā bhavasi deva yāmabhiḥ
analyzed: uta īśiṣe prasavasya tvam ekaḥ id uta pūṣā bhavasi deva yāmabhiḥ
translated: And thou alone art appointed to the impulse, and thou, O god, art Pusan by thy own nature.

original: utedaṃ viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājasi śyāvāśvas te savita stomam ānaśe
analyzed: uta idam viśvam bhuvanam vi rājasi śyāvāśvaḥ te savitaḥ stomam ānaśe
translated: And thou dost shine over this whole world, and Syamavasu, O Savitar, has obtained thy praise.

original: tat savitur vṛṇīmahe vayaṃ devasya bhojanam
analyzed: tat savituḥ vṛṇīmahe vayam devasya bhojanam
translated: We choose that as the boon of god Savitar,

original: śreṣṭhaṃ sarvadhātamaṃ turam bhagasya dhīmahi
analyzed: śreṣṭham sarva dhātamam turam bhagasya dhīmahi
translated: the best of all, the most excellent, the most rapid, of Bhaga we think.

original: asya hi svayaśastaraṃ savituḥ kac cana priyam
analyzed: asya hi sva yaśastaram savituḥ kad cana priyam
translated: For this is the most famous, most beloved of Savitar,

original: na minanti svarājyam
analyzed: na minanti sva rājyam
translated: they do not diminish his own kingdom.

original: sa hi ratnāni dāśuṣe suvāti savitā bhagaḥ
analyzed: sa hi ratnāni dāśuṣe suvāti savitā bhagaḥ
translated: For he, Savitar, the impeller, sends treasures to the worshipper,

original: tam bhāgaṃ citram īmahe
analyzed: tam bhāgam citram īmahe
translated: to him we pray for that wondrous portion.

original: adyā no deva savitaḥ prajāvat sāvīḥ saubhagam
analyzed: adyā naḥ deva savitar prajāvat sāvīḥ saubhagam
translated: Today, God Savitar, grant us prosperity with offspring,

original: parā duṣvapnyaṃ suva
analyzed: parā duṣvapnyam suva
translated: and drive away evil dreams.

original: viśvāni deva savitar duritāni parā suva
analyzed: viśvāni deva savitar duritāni parā suva
translated: All evils, God Savitar, drive away,

original: yad bhadraṃ tan na ā suva
analyzed: yat bhadram tat naḥ ā suva
translated: and bring us what is good.

original: anāgaso aditaye devasya savituḥ save
analyzed: anāgasaḥ aditaye devasya savituḥ save
translated: Free from guilt to Aditi, at the impulse of the god Savitar,

original: viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
analyzed: viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
translated: we will win all good things.

original: ā viśvadevaṃ satpatiṃ sūktair adyā vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: ā viśva devam sat patim sūktaiḥ adya vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose today with hymns the lord of the house, the all-god,

original: satyasavaṃ savitāram
analyzed: satya savam savitāram
translated: Savitar of true impulse.

original: ya ime ubhe ahanī pura ety aprayuchan
analyzed: yaḥ ime ubhe ahanī puras eti aprayuchan
translated: He who comes to these two days without fail,

original: svādhīr devaḥ savitā
analyzed: svādhīḥ devaḥ savitā
translated: the self-restrained god Savitar,

original: ya imā viśvā jātāny āśrāvayati ślokena
analyzed: yaḥ imā viśvā jātāni āśrāvayati ślokena
translated: who with a verse proclaims all these beings that have been born,

original: pra ca suvāti savitā
analyzed: pra ca suvāti savitā
translated: and Savitar impels them forward.

original: achā vada tavasaṃ gīrbhir ābhi stuhi parjanyaṃ namasā vivāsa
analyzed: achā vada tavasam gīrbhiḥ ābhiḥ stuhi parjanyam namasā vivāsa
translated: Come, speak of the mighty one with these hymns, praise Parjanya with homage.

original: kanikradad vṛṣabho jīradānū reto dadhāty oṣadhīṣu garbham
analyzed: kanikradat vṛṣabhaḥ jīra dānuḥ retaḥ dadhāti oṣadhīṣu garbham
translated: The thundering bull, the giver of strength, places seed in the plants, a germ.

original: vi vṛkṣān hanty uta hanti rakṣaso viśvam bibhāya bhuvanam mahāvadhāt
analyzed: vi vṛkṣān hanti uta hanti rakṣasaḥ viśvam bibhāya bhuvanam mahā vadhāt
translated: He destroys the trees, and he destroys the Raksases. The whole world fears the great slaughter.

original: utānāgā īṣate vṛṣṇyāvato yat parjanya stanayan hanti duṣkṛtaḥ
analyzed: uta anāgāḥ īṣate vṛṣṇyāvataḥ yat parjanyaḥ stanayan hanti duṣkṛtaḥ
translated: And the innocent one fears the mighty one, when Parjanya, thundering, kills the wicked.

original: rathīva kaśayāśvāṃ abhikṣipann āvir dūtān kṛṇute varṣyṛṃ aha🔽dūrāt siṃhasya stanathā ud īrate yat parjanyaḥ kṛṇute varṣyaṃ nabhaḥ
analyzed: rathī iva kaśayā aśvām abhikṣipan āvis dūtān kṛṇute varṣyṛm aha  dūrāt siṃhasya stanathau ud īrate yat parjanyaḥ kṛṇute varṣyam nabhaḥ
translated: Like a charioteer urging on his horses with the whip, he makes the messengers manifest, the rain-bringing one.🔽The roars of the lion go forth from afar, when Parjanya makes the rain-bringing cloud.

original: pra vātā vānti patayanti vidyuta ud oṣadhīr jihate pinvate svaḥ
analyzed: pra vātāḥ vānti patayanti vidyutaḥ ud oṣadhīḥ jihate pinvate svar
translated: The winds blow, the lightnings flash, the plants are shaken, the heaven is swollen.

original: irā viśvasmai bhuvanāya jāyate yat parjanyaḥ pṛthivīṃ retasāvati
analyzed: irā viśvasmai bhuvanāya jāyate yat parjanyaḥ pṛthivīm retasā avati
translated: Food is born for all beings, when Parjanya with his seed supports the earth.

original: yasya vrate pṛthivī nannamīti yasya vrate śaphavaj jarbhurīti
analyzed: yasya vrate pṛthivī nannamīti yasya vrate śaphavat jarbhurīti
translated: In whose ordinance the earth bows down, in whose ordinance the ploughshare moves,

original: yasya vrata oṣadhīr viśvarūpāḥ sa naḥ parjanya mahi śarma yacha
analyzed: yasya vrate oṣadhīḥ viśva rūpāḥ sa naḥ parjanya mahi śarma yaccha
translated: In whose ordinance the plants of all forms are, may he, O Parjanya, grant us great protection.

original: divo no vṛṣṭim maruto rarīdhvam pra pinvata vṛṣṇo aśvasya dhārāḥ
analyzed: divaḥ naḥ vṛṣṭim marutaḥ rarīdhvam pra pinvata vṛṣṇaḥ aśvasya dhārāḥ
translated: O Maruts, send down rain from the sky for us; make the streams of the strong horse swell.

original: arvāṅ etena stanayitnunehy apo niṣiñcann asuraḥ pitā naḥ🔽abhi kranda stanaya garbham ā dhā udanvatā pari dīyā rathena
analyzed: arvāṅ etena stanayitnunā ihi apaḥ niṣiñcan asuraḥ pitā naḥ  abhi kranda stanaya garbham ā dhāḥ udanvatā pari dīya rathena
translated: Come hither with this thunder, O Asura, our father, pouring down the waters.🔽Roar, thunder, bring the embryo; go around with the watery one in a chariot.

original: dṛtiṃ su karṣa viṣitaṃ nyañcaṃ samā bhavantūdvato nipādāḥ
analyzed: dṛtim su karṣa viṣitam nyañcam samāḥ bhavantu udvataḥ nipādāḥ
translated: Draw the stretched-out, sloping leather bag; let the high and low places be even.

original: mahāntaṃ kośam ud acā ni ṣiñca syandantāṃ kulyā viṣitāḥ purastāt
analyzed: mahāntam kośam ud aca ni siñca syandantām kulyāḥ viṣitāḥ purastāt
translated: And pour out the great vessel; let the streams flow forth, the stretched-out ones, in front.

original: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī vy undhi suprapāṇam bhavatv aghnyābhyaḥ
analyzed: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī vi undhi su prapāṇam bhavatu aghnyābhyaḥ
translated: With ghee, O Heaven and Earth, be opened wide, let there be good drinking for the milch-kine.

original: yat parjanya kanikradat stanayan haṃsi duṣkṛtaḥ
analyzed: yat parjanya kanikradat stanayan haṃsi duṣkṛtaḥ
translated: When, O Parjanya, thou, the thundering, smitest the wicked,

original: pratīdaṃ viśvam modate yat kiṃ ca pṛthivyām adhi
analyzed: prati idam viśvam modate yat kim ca pṛthivyām adhi
translated: Then all this world rejoices in it, whatever is upon the earth.

original: avarṣīr varṣam ud u ṣū gṛbhāyākar dhanvāny atyetavā u
analyzed: avarṣīḥ varṣam ud u su gṛbhāya akaḥ dhanvāni atyetavai u
translated: Thou hast rained rain, thou hast lifted up the cloud, thou hast brought the water-brooks.

original: ajījana oṣadhīr bhojanāya kam uta prajābhyo 'vido manīṣām
analyzed: ajījanaḥ oṣadhīḥ bhojanāya kam uta prajābhyaḥ vidaḥ manīṣām
translated: Thou hast generated the plants for food, and hast given to men the thought of wisdom.

original: baḷ itthā parvatānāṃ khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi
analyzed: baḷ itthā parvatānām khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi
translated: Even so thou bearest, O Earth, the moisture of the mountains.

original: pra yā bhūmim pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini
analyzed: pra yā bhūmim pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini
translated: Thou, O mighty one, with thy greatness surpassest the earth which thou hast spread out.

original: stomāsas tvā vicāriṇi prati ṣṭobhanty aktubhiḥ
analyzed: stomāsaḥ tvā vicāriṇi prati stobhanti aktubhiḥ
translated: The hymns of praise, O thou who art to be sought, resound to thee with their voices.

original: pra yā vājaṃ na heṣantam perum asyasy arjuni🔽dṛḷhā cid yā vanaspatīn kṣmayā dardharṣy ojasā
analyzed: pra yā vājam na heṣantam perum asyasi arjuni  dṛḍhā cit yā vanaspatīn kṣmayā dardharṣi ojasā
translated: Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.

original: yat te abhrasya vidyuto divo varṣanti vṛṣṭayaḥ🔽pra samrāje bṛhad arcā gabhīram brahma priyaṃ varuṇāya śrutāya
analyzed: yat te abhrasya vidyutaḥ divaḥ varṣanti vṛṣṭayaḥ  pra samrāje bṛhat arcā gabhīram brahma priyam varuṇāya śrutāya
translated: Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.

original: vi yo jaghāna śamiteva carmopastire pṛthivīṃ sūryāya
analyzed: vi yaḥ jaghāna śamitā iva carma upastire pṛthivīm sūryāya
translated: Thou, O thou who hast a swift steed, who hast a swift car, surpassest the swift steed, the swift car.🔽Thou, O thou

original: vaneṣu vy antarikṣaṃ tatāna vājam arvatsu paya usriyāsu🔽hṛtsu kratuṃ varuṇo apsv agniṃ divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau
analyzed: vaneṣu vi antarikṣam tatāna vājam arvatsu payaḥ usriyāsu  hṛtsu kratum varuṇaḥ apsu agnim divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau
translated: He hath stretched out the atmosphere in the woods, and strength in the horses, and milk in the cows,🔽In the hearts he hath placed thought, in the waters Varuna, in the sky Agni, in the mountain Soma, in the sun.

original: nīcīnabāraṃ varuṇaḥ kavandham pra sasarja rodasī antarikṣam
analyzed: nīcīna bāram varuṇaḥ kabandham pra sasarja rodasī antarikṣam
translated: Varuna hath loosed the tree with the low boughs, the trunk, the earth, the sky, and the atmosphere.

original: tena viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā yavaṃ na vṛṣṭir vy unatti bhūma
analyzed: tena viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā yavam na vṛṣṭiḥ vi unatti bhūma
translated: By him, the king of all the world, as the rain the corn, he watcheth over the earth.

original: unatti bhūmim pṛthivīm uta dyāṃ yadā dugdhaṃ varuṇo vaṣṭy ād it
analyzed: unatti bhūmim pṛthivīm uta dyām yadā dugdham varuṇaḥ vaṣṭi āt id
translated: He watcheth over the earth, over the wide air, over the sky, when Varuna milketh out the milk.

original: sam abhreṇa vasata parvatāsas taviṣīyantaḥ śrathayanta vīrāḥ
analyzed: sam abhreṇa vasata parvatāsaḥ taviṣīyantaḥ śrathayanta vīrāḥ
translated: The mountains dwell together with the cloud, the heroes, striving for strength, are eager to burst.

original: imām ū ṣv ṛsurasya śrutasya mahīm māyāṃ varuṇasya pra vocam
analyzed: imām u su ṛsurasya śrutasya mahīm māyām varuṇasya pra vocam
translated: I will proclaim to you this great illusion of the far-seeing Varuna,

original: māneneva tasthivāṃ antarikṣe vi yo mame pṛthivīṃ sūryeṇa
analyzed: mānena iva tasthivān antarikṣe vi yaḥ mame pṛthivīm sūryeṇa
translated: Who, as if standing in the air by his measure, hath divided the earth with the sun.

original: imām ū nu kavitamasya māyām mahīṃ devasya nakir ā dadharṣa
analyzed: imām u nu kavitamasya māyām mahīm devasya nakir ā dadharṣa
translated: No one at all hath attained to this great illusion of the wise god.

original: ekaṃ yad udnā na pṛṇanty enīr āsiñcantīr avanayaḥ samudram
analyzed: ekam yat udnā na pṛṇanti enīḥ āsiñcantīḥ avanayaḥ samudram
translated: When the brown streams, filling him, as with a measure, pour him into the sea.

original: aryamyaṃ varuṇa mitryaṃ vā sakhāyaṃ vā sadam id bhrātaraṃ vā
analyzed: aryamyam varuṇa mitryam vā sakhāyam vā sadam id bhrātaram vā
translated: Whether he be a friend of Aryaman, of Varuna, or of Mitra, or a brother always,

original: veśaṃ vā nityaṃ varuṇāraṇaṃ vā yat sīm āgaś cakṛmā śiśrathas tat
analyzed: veśam vā nityam varuṇa araṇam vā yat sīm āgaḥ cakṛma śiśrathaḥ tat
translated: The gambling debt or the constant brothel, whatever we have done in ignorance, loosen that.

original: kitavāso yad riripur na dīvi yad vā ghā satyam uta yan na vidma
analyzed: kitavāsaḥ yat riripuḥ na dīvi yat vā gha satyam uta yat na vidma
translated: Whatever we have done in gambling, in enmity, in the assembly, or in truth or what we do not know,

original: sarvā tā vi ṣya śithireva devādhā te syāma varuṇa priyāsaḥ
analyzed: sarvā tā vi sya śithirā iva deva adha te syāma varuṇa priyāsaḥ
translated: all that, O gods, let loose as if loosened. So may we be dear to you, O Varuṇa.

original: indrāgnī yam avatha ubhā vājeṣu martyam
analyzed: indra agnī yam avatha ubhā vājeṣu martyam
translated: O Indra and Agni, you two who help the mortal in battles,

original: dṛḷhā cit sa pra bhedati dyumnā vāṇīr iva tritaḥ
analyzed: dṛḷhā cit sa pra bhedati dyumnā vāṇīḥ iva tritaḥ
translated: he even breaks through the firm, like Trita with his songs of praise.

original: yā pṛtanāsu duṣṭarā yā vājeṣu śravāyyā
analyzed: yā pṛtanāsu duṣṭarā yā vājeṣu śravāyyā
translated: You who are invincible in battles, you who are most famous in contests for booty,

original: yā pañca carṣaṇīr abhṝndrāgnī tā havāmahe
analyzed: yā pañca carṣaṇīḥ abhṛ indra agnī tā havāmahe
translated: you who have conquered the five peoples, O Indra and Agni, we invoke you.

original: tayor id amavac chavas tigmā didyun maghonoḥ
analyzed: tayoḥ id amavat śavaḥ tigmā didyut maghonoḥ
translated: The terrible strength of those two, the sharp thunderbolt of the two bountiful ones,

original: prati druṇā gabhastyor gavāṃ vṛtraghna eṣate
analyzed: prati druṇā gabhastyoḥ gavām vṛtra ghne eṣate
translated: the Vṛtra-slayer seeks with the ladle and the arms for the sake of the cows.

original: tā vām eṣe rathānām indrāgnī havāmahe🔽patī turasya rādhaso vidvāṃsā girvaṇastamā🔽tā vṛdhantāv anu dyūn martāya devāv adabhā
analyzed: tā vām eṣe rathānām indra agnī havāmahe  patī turasya rādhasaḥ vidvāṃsā girvaṇastamā  tā vṛdhantau anu dyūn martāya devau adabhā
translated: We invoke you, O Indra and Agni, for the sake of your chariots,🔽you two who are the lords of the gift of the swift one, you two who are most skilled in the praise of the singer.🔽You two, O gods, for the sake of the mortal, day after day,

original: arhantā cit puro dadhe 'ṃśeva devāv arvate
analyzed: arhantā cit puras dadhe ṃśā iva devau arvate
translated: you two, like portions for the horse, place in front even the worthy ones.

original: evendrāgnibhyām ahāvi havyaṃ śūṣyaṃ ghṛtaṃ na pūtam adribhiḥ
analyzed: eva indra agnibhyām ahāvi havyam śūṣyam ghṛtam na pūtam adribhiḥ
translated: Thus, for Indra and Agni, the oblation, the offering, the ghee purified with stones,

original: tā sūriṣu śravo bṛhad rayiṃ gṛṇatsu didhṛtam iṣaṃ gṛṇatsu didhṛtam
analyzed: tā sūriṣu śravaḥ bṛhat rayim gṛṇatsu didhṛtam iṣam gṛṇatsu didhṛtam
translated: That glory is great among the nobles, that wealth is held for the singers, that food is held for the singers.

original: pra vo mahe matayo yantu viṣṇave marutvate girijā evayāmarut
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe matayaḥ yantu viṣṇave marutvate giri jāḥ eva yā marut
translated: Let your thoughts go forth to the great Vishṇu, to him accompanied by the Maruts, to him who goes with the Maruts, to him who is born of the mountains.

original: pra śardhāya prayajyave sukhādaye tavase bhandadiṣṭaye dhunivratāya śavase
analyzed: pra śardhāya prayajyave su khādaye tavase bhandat iṣṭaye dhuni vratāya śavase
translated: To the impetuous one, to the well-sacrificed one, to the one who delights in good things, to the strong one, to the one who is praised by the Bhandis, to the one with shaking vows, to the strength.

original: pra ye jātā mahinā ye ca nu svayam pra vidmanā bruvata evayāmarut
analyzed: pra ye jātāḥ mahinā ye ca nu svayam pra vidmanā bruvate eva yā marut
translated: To those who are born great through their greatness, and to those who are self-existent, we know, speaking thus, to him who goes with the Maruts.

original: kratvā tad vo maruto nādhṛṣe śavo dānā mahnā tad eṣām adhṛṣṭāso nādrayaḥ
analyzed: kratvā tat vaḥ marutaḥ na ādhṛṣe śavaḥ dānā mahnā tat eṣām adhṛṣṭāsaḥ na adrayaḥ
translated: By your wisdom, O Maruts, we do not dare to offend your power, by your greatness in giving, their irresistible mountains.

original: pra ye divo bṛhataḥ śṛṇvire girā suśukvānaḥ subhva evayāmarut
analyzed: pra ye divaḥ bṛhataḥ śṛṇvire girā su śukvānaḥ su bhvaḥ eva yā marut
translated: Those who have heard from the great heaven with their voice, the well-praised, the strong ones, to him who goes with the Maruts.

original: na yeṣām irī sadhastha īṣṭa āṃ agnayo na svavidyutaḥ pra syandrāso dhunīnām
analyzed: na yeṣām sadhasthe īṣṭe ām agnayaḥ na sva vidyutaḥ pra syandrāsaḥ dhunīnām
translated: Whose dwelling place is not to be desired, whose fires are like their own lightning, whose strong ones are the streams.

original: sa cakrame mahato nir urukramaḥ samānasmāt sadasa evayāmarut
analyzed: sa cakrame mahataḥ niḥ uru kramaḥ samānasmāt sadasaḥ eva yā marut
translated: He who has taken a great stride, the wide-striding one, from that same assembly, to him who goes with the Maruts.

original: yadāyukta tmanā svād adhi ṣṇubhir viṣpardhaso vimahaso jigāti śevṛdho nṛbhiḥ
analyzed: yadā ayukta tmanā svāt adhi snubhiḥ viṣpardhasaḥ vimahasaḥ jigāti śevṛdhaḥ nṛbhiḥ
translated: When he goes forth from his own abode with his own swift ones, to the rivals, to the great ones, to the prosperous ones, with the men.

original: svano na vo 'mavān rejayad vṛṣā tveṣo yayis taviṣa evayāmarut
analyzed: svanaḥ na vaḥ mavān rejayat vṛṣā tveṣaḥ yayiḥ taviṣaḥ eva yā marut
translated: Like a young bull, your immortal one, O Maruts, makes you tremble, the impetuous, the powerful one, to him who goes with the Maruts.

original: yenā sahanta ṛñjata svarociṣa sthāraśmāno hiraṇyayāḥ svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ
analyzed: yena sahantaḥ ṛñjata sva rociṣaḥ sthā raśmānaḥ hiraṇyayāḥ su āyudhāsaḥ iṣmiṇaḥ
translated: By whom the radiant ones endure, the golden ones with fixed rays, the swift ones with their own weapons

original: apāro vo mahimā vṛddhaśavasas tveṣaṃ śavo 'vatv evayāmarut
analyzed: apāraḥ vaḥ mahimā vṛddha śavasaḥ tveṣam śavaḥ vatu eva yā marut
translated: Your greatness is boundless, O you of increasing strength, your splendor is mighty, O you who are to be invoked by the Yamas.

original: sthātāro hi prasitau saṃdṛśi sthana te na uruṣyatā nidaḥ śuśukvāṃso nāgnayaḥ
analyzed: sthātāraḥ hi prasitau saṃdṛśi sthana te naḥ uruṣyata nidaḥ śuśukvāṃsaḥ nā agnayaḥ
translated: For you are the supporters in the conflict, you are seen in the conflict. You two protect us from the curse, like the shining fires.

original: te rudrāsaḥ sumakhā agnayo yathā tuvidyumnā avantv evayāmarut
analyzed: te rudrāsaḥ su makhāḥ agnayaḥ yathā tuvi dyumnāḥ avantu eva yā marut
translated: Those Rudras, the great sacrificers, like the fires, with great lightning, may they protect, O you who are to be invoked by the Yamas.

original: dīrgham pṛthu paprathe sadma pārthivaṃ yeṣām ajmeṣv ā mahaḥ śardhāṃsy adbhutainasām
analyzed: dīrgham pṛthu paprathe sadma pārthivam yeṣām ajmeṣu ā mahaḥ śardhāṃsi adbhuta enasām
translated: The abode of the earth has been spread out long and wide by them, in whose paths are the great, wonderful hosts.

original: adveṣo no maruto gātum etana śrotā havaṃ jaritur evayāmarut
analyzed: a dveṣaḥ naḥ marutaḥ gātum etana śrota havam jarituḥ eva yā marut
translated: O Maruts, come to us with favor as our way, may the hearer of the call of the worshiper be invoked by the Yamas.

original: viṣṇor mahaḥ samanyavo yuyotana smad rathyo na daṃsanāpa dveṣāṃsi sanutaḥ
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ mahaḥ samanyavaḥ yuyotana smat rathyaḥ na daṃsanā apa dveṣāṃsi sanutar
translated: O you who are of the same mind as Vishnu, ward off the hostilities, like the charioteer, the bites.

original: gantā no yajñaṃ yajñiyāḥ suśami śrotā havam arakṣa evayāmarut
analyzed: ganta naḥ yajñam yajñiyāḥ suśami śrota havam arakṣaḥ eva yā marut
translated: May the worshipful ones come to our sacrifice, easy to invoke, may the hearer of the call protect, as one to be invoked by the Yamas.

original: jyeṣṭhāso na parvatāso vyomani yūyaṃ tasya pracetasaḥ syāta durdhartavo nidaḥ
analyzed: jyeṣṭhāsaḥ na parvatāsaḥ vyomani yūyam tasya pracetasaḥ syāta durdhartavaḥ nidaḥ
translated: You are the highest, like the mountains in the sky, you are the wise ones of him, the curses hard to bear.
